text: 2014 vintage at the brewery. Beautiful ruby color with pinkish head. Aroma has intense dark cherries, pulpy, ripe and juicy. Also cherry preserve, pits, almonds and clean farmhouse funk. Taste follows, really juicy and fruity. Easy drinking, just the right amount of funk and the perfect sweet/sour combination. Probably the best Cantillon beer I had so far.

A: Ruby with a small head
N: Cherries, sherbet, acidity
T: Cherries, fizz, medium acidity, berries
P: Thin
O: Great cherry lambic

Bottle at Cantillon Brewery, Brussels. Cloudy red with pinkish head. The aroma has notes of raspberry juice, wood, sugar and candy. The flavor has notes of raspberry yogurt, candy, wood, fruit cake and cookies. Dry, flat, light to medium-bodied. Excellent.

UPDATED: MAY 19, 2017 Bottle at the brewery. 2014 bottle. Hazy red color. Aroma full of cherries, oak and vanilla. Sour cherries, yogurt, lemon, oak, finish is mildly dry. Light-bodied, smooth texture. Great.
Bottle - Vintage 2014 - Dark cherry, complex and rich. Dark purple with a small pink head. Rich dark cherry, light sweetness, light sourness and a nice finish.

2014 vintage at Cantillon Brasserie. Pours dark ruby with a lightly pink foam, not very stable. Aroma is pure cherry and stone, over hints of funk. Body is medium to a full taste of cherries, lightly tart and sour, fizzy but low carbonation, for an incredibly smooth experience. Lingering sour cherry palate, yet dry. An experience not to have missed!

March 2017 - 375ml cork and cage bottle at Cantillon, as Cantillon Lou Pepe Kriek, 2013 vintage. Short review with Teresa. Pours opaque purple with a big foamy pink head. Aroma is huge on the cherry  rich cherry and cherry sherbet. Body is light, touch frothy with soft carbonation. Taste is dark cherries, plastic notes, not too sweet, light tartness. Like the most intense cherry essence youve tasted. But importantly its not sweet. Love it. (4.3)

Bottle shared by tom10101 and Minderbinder, thanks bros! Tasted blind. Pours a really dark cherry red with a thin pink-ish head that leaves low lacing. Nose is of sour cherries multiplied. Taste is quite acidic but not over the top, just really sharp and lightly puckering. More fresh cherries, both flesh and stones. Body is moderately light, carbonation moderate. A really solid kriek for sure! For a moment I thought it was 3Fs Intense Kriek (which is my favorite oude kriek out there) but it really makes sense that it is Lou Pepe after all! I would certainly get again if I had the occasion.

Bottle, 375 ml at the brewery. Shared with Miro. Pours deep red with large lasting pink head. Lots of cherries in aroma and flavor, funk, light to medium sourness, dry finish. Light to medium bodied. Easy drinkable. Great.

Backlog from 2016. 13 bottle at Himmeriget. Oaky, lactic, funky and tons of cherries. This is of course amazing but I feel like this has a tartness/hay/chestnut thing going on that isnt as crisp and refreshing as the normal Kriek. A teeny bit out of balance (relatively speaking). Hope I get to try it again, though.

2012 vintage on tap at Himmeriget, Copenhagen. 
Pours ruby red with small pink head that disappears. So much cherry in the aroma. Also packed with jammy notes, wood, tarty deliciousness, stable/barn, funky, vinegar. Taste is amazing! Super complex, but bounds of tartiness and is tastefully dry. Has all of the woody, oaky flavours alongside the fruitiness youd wish! Such a lively beer.
Bue en bouteille de 75cl. Pas mon style de bière à la base. Trop acide pour moi. Pas mon truc quoi.
Bottle at tads. Pours deep ruby, nose is cherry, cinnamon, funky, oak, taste is similar, bretty, juicy, pretty tasty.

From notes. Enjoyed at Cantillon on November 12 during the brew day. Shared this 2013 sticker, 375 mL bottle with berntholer when we met up for a trade. The pour is a deep red color with a thick-ish pink head that falls down to a thin ring quickly, leaving a couple spots of lace. The aroma is dominated by juicy and fleshy cherry. There is a light raspberry kind of sweetness, almost like a jam happening. There is a light woody pit in there as well, but its amazing. The flavor is just as excellent. The cherry absolutely dominates with a touch of funk and a light pit addition. This is just so tart and lovely. The smoothness really blows me away. The mouth feel is light and crisp with a bright carbonation and a lingeringly sweet and tart cherry that lasts forever. I love it!
Sample at the brewery museum after the tour. fresh sour and fruity finish, absolute fan.

75cl bottle @Irreale, Madrid. 13-04-2015.
Bottled 2012.
Pours reddish with nice pinkish head. Fast vanishing head, little to poor lacing. Sour, cherries, lactic, spicy and horseblanket nose. Light body, high carbonation, crispy texture. Taste is really sour, cherries, some spicy, clove, cinnamon, lots of brett character, wet cellar, nutmeg. Lovely.

UPDATED: JAN 27, 2017 375ml bottle at the brewery, 2013 sticker. Hazy ruby pour with a pink head. Tons of cherries, both macerated and fresh, cherry cores, almonds, roasted chestnuts, lambic funk, mineral components, all perfectly balanced. Light body, medium to high carbonation and a tart, refreshing finish.

2011 vintage, at the brewery - delicious, but slightly below the 2013 vintage. A bit more dry, more emphasis on the cherries as opposed to the almonds/chestnuts. 4.6/5

750mL bottle, vintage 2007 bottled 2009. Pours clear bright red with a subdued light pink head. Aroma of cherries, acid and a little funk with some esters. High tartness, while the cherries are still strong despite the age, some light medicinal flavours. Light body with a lingering tart and fruity finish.
UPDATED: MAY 14, 2017  Słodki, owocowy aromat. Skórki i pestki wiśni. Migdały. Bretty. Wytrawne, wiśniowe, pięknie zbalansowane, eleganckie. Totalnie aksamitne.
Bottle at Cantillon. Pours red color, pink head. Aroma of cherries, raspberries. Taste is sour, raspberries.

Bottle. Pours red with small pinky head. Aroma of great tart cherries mixed with al.ond and berries. In taste medium to high level of tartness, bit funky and very fruity. Medium body, bit oily, fizzy carbonated. Finish is cherry and tart, no vinegar at all. Fantastic kriek.

2013er bottle, 37.5cl.  Funky sour nose. The Sourness is smooth, the cherries intense, not sweetish but very round and complex. The aftertaste is long, dark cherries, lots of fruitiness with not too sour body. Fantastic.
Sample at SBWF 2016. Tart and fruity smell. Tart and fruity taste but also chemical. Rough flavour and mouthfeel.

750 mL bottle.. 2009 bottle. Bottled September 1, 2011. Originally reviewed 4/20/2013.

Bright pink with a faint pink head. Thick collar. Hazy.

Really nice cherry aroma. Deep cherry. Oaky and vanilla is very strong. A ton of acidity but not a ton of funk.

Tastes of sour cherries. Lots of oak. Vanilla. Funk is much stronger. Barnyard is more prominent here too. The cherries are the star of the show though.

Dry, very sour. Medium body.

Fantastic cherry flavor. Best characteristic of this beer.
05-05-16 // sample at Cantillon Quintessence 2015. Excellent deep red colour, funky sour cherry smell. Not to sour, the cherry sweetness overweighs.

A 750ml bottle at the brewery. 2013 sticker, bottled on 10th September 2015. Poured into a Cantillon tasting glass. It poured a slightly hazy dark ruby red with a three finger dark pink head and sparse lacing. Aromas of marzipan, cherry and almonds dominate with hints of biscuit. Only some light sour tartness. Tastes of cherry and almond dessert cake. Very nice. Light sour, tartness, oak and a touch of sweetness. Light to medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Overall another stunning Lou Pepe variety with great balance. Easy to drink and refreshing. I tried Framboise on the same day and not to take anything away from the Kriek as it is still really really good, but the Framboise was near perfect.

Rating #1897 - 2015.09.20 - Bottle for ZwanzeDay2015 - Bottle is (2013). Pours a bright pinkish-red with a bubbly white cap. Aroma is cherry jelly, sugar. Palate is more cherry sweetness - nice tartness - a well achieved fruit sour that begs attention to detail. Girlfriend approved.
2012 bottle Dark red color. Pours with a slight pink blanket of head. Cherry and chocolate nose. Fresh cheese and barnyard. Medium mouthfeel long sweet finish. Medium sourness.

Merci à Marc-André pour le partage. 2012 sticker. Le liquide qui coule dans mon verre est rouge vin et dune opacité parfaite. Jai rarement vu un lambic aussi mousseux que celui-à. La mousse rosée qui sest formée, malgré un service délicat, ne sest jamais affaissée et a fièrement couronné mon verre tout au long de la dégustation. Cerises de multiples variétés. Je me sens soumis à lintensité de la petite cerise griotte, tout comme au jus ample et fruité dune grosse cerise noire de la vallée de lOkanagan. Le funk de la Maison se prête magnifiquement à la fête. Complexité infinie où le fruit, très présent se marie à merveille à une culture microbienne savamment entretenue. Fine bulle, pétillance festive, je crois quil mest impossible de donner la note de 5 à cette bière, simplement parce que je suis pas un fan du style en général, bien quelle le mérite sûrement.

75cl bottle(bottled in 2011)
 pours a dark ref with pinkish head that does not last
 aroma is sour cherry ,almond marzipan
 Taste sour sweet cherry bit bitterness loads of fruit,long dry acidic finish
 simply a world class beer from the worlds best brewery
Sample @ Cantillon Quintessence 2016. Fruity with cherries and cinnamon. Dry and fruity finish.
Deep red color, pink lacing. Cherries, a little funk, lemon, and berry. Tart and sour, light to medium body, and moderate carb. Lemony tart finish.

Bottle. Thanks, KL. Two ratings here, for two vintages compared side by side.
1) 2001 Vintage. Toasted or scorched bread aroma, some smoke, char, wood, mold, and leather. Thin hazy reddish-brown color, thin pink head. Flavors of tart sour cherries, sour celery, mild acidity, and some vinegar. Thin body, with mild astringency. Very unusual nose (we discussed the provenance of this feature and sort of left it unresolved). Flavors are sourish, acidic, and rather diminished from the 2008 vintage, but still interesting and solid. This one has held up. Rating: 10/3/8/4/16 = 4.1

2) 2008 Vintage. Generous funky manure, very rich cherry nose. Bright red color with a 2-3cm. pink head and good lacing. Moderately tart cherries in initial. Flavors get brighter and deeper in mid palate. Some nuttiness emerges (almonds?) along with spice in late mid and finish. Thin, with light astringency. Wow! This old beauty tastes and smells as fresh as a one-year-old beer. Seriously, a great beer.
Sample @ Cantillon Quintessence 2016. Fruity, acidic, woody and bretty with cherries, light to medium body with a watery texture, the finish is dry.

Lp kriek 13 vintage

Pours a vibrant ember to lilac color with a fizzy, bubbly head, leaving back a thick film of lacing at the rim of the glass.

Dusty, leather accompanied, funky cherry from the very first smell. Produces a ripe, dark sour cherry impression, while ensuring an intriguing complexity, due to wood bark, dried oak and heated cherry pit among a fermented tartness.

Drinks soft and perfectly balanced, while adding a subtle dryness to the uprising, associated tartness during the finish, exhibiting the beers flavor richness perfectly well.

Amarena sweet cherries among a pleasant, earth coated funkiness, showcasing the fruits ripeness with a sugary peak to them. The beer produces a prominent stone quality among a dusty, pleasantly pungent funkiness. Utmost fruity in the finish, featuring almost overripe, juicy cherries in all its facetts and layers.

A different beast than their regular Kriek, way more complex and fruitier. The sherries establish a fantastic characteristic between lusciously ripe, and already fermented fruits, tied together by a crisp, citraic sour punch.

Bottle @ Cantillon Quintessence 2016. Deep red body with a small pinkish head. Tart, cherries, lots of funk, light cherry stones, fruity, cobweb, ripe cherries. Very jammy fruity finish with a touch of funk. Lovely.
Beer tasting @ cantillon brussels. Pours a deep red colour beer with a medium head. Fruity and bretty with wood and cherries. Dry finish
One of my favorite Cantillon beers. Pours a deep red with nice head. Nose is dense cherries and red fruits. Medium mouthfeel.

(bottle) slightly hazy deep ruby colour with a frothy dark pink head. aroma of sour cherries, some chlorine and cinnamon, with lots of custard, cherry pie, brown sugar and cheesecake. flavour is rather mild and oaky, with more cherry pie and vanilla, some bubble gum, spring foliage and lemon juice in the dry finish. medium-bodied with lively carbonation.
UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Przeklejka wyjazdowa, bez notatki, w celach kronikarskich, pity w browarze.Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).
Super fruity. Dry and wine tasting. Apple and tart. Carbonation. Not a fan of this

UPDATED: APR 18, 2016 2013 bottle at Cantillon. Bloody ref color, mice pink head. Aroma of cherry cake, small notes of wine, barnyard. Taste is light to medium bitter, very strong flavor of cherries, almost cover up Lambic character. But very tasty beer.

UPDATED: APR 15, 2016 Rocznik 2013. Niewielka piana. Barwa czerwono wisniowa, metna. Aromat mega wisniowy, pestkowy, beczkowy. W smaku lekko kwaskowy, wytrawny, wisniowy. Aftertease pestkowo migdalowy, winny. Nagazowanie wysokie.
Bottle at Brewery. Deep red with a small pink head. Aroma is cherries, yeast and sunshine :-). Taste is cherries, yeast and malt.

UPDATED: APR 8, 2016 Bottle at brewery. Aroma of Cherry and yeast; Brett. Faint hops. The flavour is moderat sour. The body is light and the texture is juicy. Lively carbonation. So good and refreshing.

Bottle at the brewery. Pours deep red, nice pink foam, flows slowly, quite viscous. Aroma has some fruit sweetness and cherries, a lot of cherries. Taste is a total cherry cake, sweet and sour, not so sweet actually. Cherries are coming out really pronounced, full of that fruity goodness, layered with tart background lambic flavours. I can totally understand why this has been rated as one of the best beers in Belgium, it is blowing my mind away.
Voor het eerst gedronken aan de brouwerij enkele weken geleden. Het bier zelf rook ontzettend goed maar de smaak vond ik veeleer plakkerig en kon mij eerlijk gezegd niet echt bekoren.

750mL bottle 2012, pours a dark ruby/purple with a large pink head. Effervescent aroma, dry cherry juice, oak, crisp yeast. Wow that cherry pops, tart yet sweet, no doubt off cherries, like eating fresh cherries and drinking lou pepe gueuze, sour, yeast, with mellowing oak. By and far the best kriek/ fruit beer Ive ever had!

2012 vintage 750ml bottle sent to me by _angst_ as a Secret Santa gift in 2014. Thanks a ton Alex! Finally cracked this bottle in the good company of friends. Pours a slightly hazy ruby color. Deep red hues along with a thin pink head that fades to a ring and leaves nice lace. Aromas of cherry skin and cherry pie filling waft out along with some notes of barnyard funk, wet basement and oak. Very inviting. Taste follows the nose, but I could not have been prepared for the massive cherry skin/cherry pie notes that accompanied this beer. Just loaded with fruit! The mouthfeel is a bit thicker than the regular Cantillon Kriek. And the signature funk has taken hold. Really nice tart note in there too. Not a puckering sour, but more of a tang. The oak gives some vanilla to couple with the cherry sweetness and leads into a semi-dry finish. Nice cherry tartness lingers for days. Pretty damn impressed by this beer and just a touch below the LP Framboise as my favorite Cantillon. Cheers!

Bottle at the Earth Eagle members night. Cheers, Alex! This was phenomenal -- the cherry flavor and aroma is overwhelming, giving it a jammy fruit taste, although its wonderfully balanced by the tartness and slight barnyard funk from the base lambic. World class beer.

Bottle at himmeriget 2012 sticker. Poures hazy Deep red with a tiny pink head. Aroma of tart, cherries, lots of funk, quite intense cherry, light cherry stones, very fruity, light cobweb. Taste is very fruity, ripe cherries, again lots of funk, quite sour. Very jammy fruity finish with a touch of funk. Waow!!

750 ml bottle. 2013 edition. Ruby red colour. Really nice pink head. Cherries all the way in the aroma. Cherries, cherries, and avain cherries in the taste. So nice and deep mouthfeel of the cherries. Hints of cherry stones. Absolutely perfectly balanced. Best kriek in the world.

Bottle shared at the RBWG hotel tasting 
Cloudy pink, no head or lacing. Aroma of red berries. Flavors of cherries and tart 
Good, smooth

Bottle (2006). Sampled at gregwilsonstls tasting. It poured a ruby red color with a pink head. The aroma was of cherries, barnyard, citrus, earth, leather and some funk. The taste was similar to the aroma with more tart cherries, funk, wood, earth with a dry woody cherry finish. Very tasty.
Amber. 2006 Vintage. Well this is certainly tart. Tasted at my variants themed tasting. Cherry. Thx Vyyvy.

Sampled at gregwilsons tasting. Thanks Vyvvy. Amber brown. Only a little head. Vinegar with funk, earth, bark, etc in the aroma. Oh, cherries, too. Gawd, so much going on. Cherries, wildness, bark, wood. Vinegar, and well, wow.

2012 bottle. Pours a rich dark red with a thin mostly lasting light pink bubble head. Aroma of cherries, hint of pine, really sour and tart, some lactose notes. Taste is dominated by cherries, hint of cranberry, long dry sour finish. Sticky light mouthfeel, medium carbonation.

The best kriek lambic Ive ever had. Deep red pour with a fizzy pink head. No lacing. Aroma of yeasts and cherries. Flavour is deep, sour cherries, yeasts, funk, and wine come through strong. Delicious.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

Je me trompe où la série Lou pepe de Cantillon est plus acétique que certaines de leurs autres bières? Le côté vinaigré est en effet assez présent... peut-être un peu trop. Le nez est cependant très invitant : la cerise est naturelle, foncée et sucrée. Il y a aussi une touche de muscade et dépices de Noël. Cest encore plus appétissant lorsque le liquide se réchauffe légèrement! En bouche cest très sûre et il manque, malheureusement, un peu de ce côté plus complexe qui ressort davantage, à mon avis, dans les lambiques non fruités. Les subtilités détectées au nez perdent en effet un peu de leur personnalité face à la présence un peu trop féroce du côté acétique.

From notes on 9/10/15. They must have liked us, because they gave us a pitcher on the house of this while there were bottling it in the other room. Since it was not bottled yet, the beer had no carbonation. Huge delicious cherry taste. Deep red in color. Would love to get a bottle, but, not going to happen.

UPDATED: MAY 5, 2016 Quintessence 2016. Unclear deep red with thin full pink head. Cherries, cooked cherries, marzipan, super fruity. Light to medium sour, otherwise a thick sweet base. Full body, light mineral, velvety texture. Faint carbonation fizziness on the tongue. The bees knees.

Had it here at brewery by my pad. Pours deep cherry and maroon and somewhat hazy. Nose is cherry pie and other red fruits such as raspberries and strawberries, predominately cherry. Very tat and then more cherry. Finishes dry and smooth. Excellent.

2012 btl at nuetnigenough, july 15.
Looks..deep cherry red, sml White/pink head
Smells..sour cherries are all still there in force, farmyard socks soaked in cherry juice.
Tastes..super sour cherries, green apple, lemon.. So Puckery and astringent, more so than any memory of the standard cantillon kriek. Wowzer!

Draft at akkurakt 
Nice deep red, minimal head, clear.
Aroma of fresh cherry jam, cellar.
Taste fresh, cherry notes. Nice fizziness and texture. 
Dry, sour, sweet and bitter in perfect harmony.

Draft at akkurat
Wow. Cherries, sour, tart, mindblowing kriek. Full body. Rich cherries. This is excellent. Well balanced. One of the best beers i have tried. Wow

Taste shared by Nick at Zwanze. Thanks! Pours beet red with a pink head. Aroma is heavy barnyard funk, cereal, mild cherry. Taste is very tart, cereal, tart cherry, finish has yogurt, a hint of oak. Very nice.

Bottle @ Voldby øl-messe. Pours hazy pink with a light pink head. Aroma of light sourness, wood, almond, rich cherry, both sweet and sour, cherry stones. Flavor is light sour, light sweet, rich cherries, almond, wood, almond, light cinnamon, sourness, light barnyard notes. Medium body, soft carbonation, light tart fruity finish. 290815

Aromas of tart cherries, vanilla, almonds, yeast, vinegar, some straw and barnyard. Taste is absolutely booming with sour cherries up front, marzipan, vanilla, vinegar, lots of barnyard. This is truly amazing.
A: Dark read with a small head. N: Loads of cherry! T: Cherry, marzipan, almond, hint of vinegar. O: Not as tart as expected, very much of the cherry flavour. Very nice Kriek!!

Bottle from 2011 shared with friends @ La Capsule, Lille - FR. Color: deep dark red beer, clear with no carbonation and no foam. Smell: nice cherry nose with almond. And cherry kernel notes. Very nice fruity domination well balanced with sour and tart notes. Taste: really nice fruity taste. You really feel the cherry, not so sweet good tart balance. Very amazing. Finish almond and sour cherry. Aftertaste: astringent sweet sour cherry. Really amazing beer !

UPDATED: AUG 17, 2015 Flasche (Lou Pepe Kriek, 75 cl, Jahrgang 2009, abgefüllt 2011 und einige Jahre daheim gelagert). - Intensives Kirschrot, klar, wenig Schaum. - In der Nase auch fruchtige Kirsche, vor allem aber die Geuze-typische muffig-kellerige Herbe mit deutlicher Säure. - Im Antrunk dominiert zitronige Säure, Kirsche kommt nur am Rande vor. Das berüchtigte Pferdedeckenaroma ist deutlich ausgeprägt, kommt aber nicht gegen die schroffe Säure an. Mild rezent, trocken. Im Abgang noch mehr Zitronensaft, dazu holzige Herbe, aus der die Kirschkerne herausschmecken. - Typisches Lambic, aber als Kriek fast enttäuschend: von den berühmten Schaarbeeker Kirschen ist herzlich wenig zu schmecken, das erinnert eher an Zitronensaft. Dennoch eine interessante Erfahrung. - Bewertung: 3,3
 Der Rest aus der Flasche am nächsten Tag schmeckte schon viel überzeugender, immer noch sauer aber mit einer unvergleichlich kirschig-säuerlichen Herbe. Doch ein großartiges Bier. Es braucht nur etwas Gewöhnung.

Cantillon Lou Pepe 2007 Bottled in 2009. Ive been waiting for a reason to crack this special brew and an upcoming trip to its birthplace, Belgium, as well as celebrating my 4th Wedding Anniversary seemed to fit the bill. 



The aroma once this bottle was uncorked was fantastic - rich juicy cherry, tannic barrel caracter & a bit misty and maraschino cherries candy as well. Deep red with a fizzy pink head. Light bodied with an effervescent mouthfeel. The taste is sour, tart cherry at first, mouth-puckering, some barrel and the finish is remarkably sweet. This is a kick ass beer that deserves the praise heaped on it. Awesome.

Appearance is a WTF. The most beautiful pink you can imagine. Head is nice and stable. Aroma is a lot of funk. Cherrries are to me less pronounced. Mouthfeel is oily & smooth. Taste is cherry in your face, oaky and barnyard. The oily charachter and good balance between the diffferent acidities make this a wonderful beer.

pinkish head. purple red murky colour. aroma is almond, cherry, cherrypits. taste like aroma, great sweet sour balance with a dry and long fruity finish. very soft silky mouthfeel, soft carbonation. delicious! bottle 75cl / 2011 sticker

Sample from 2012 bottle at Tomahawk Warriors First Birthday party on 06/06/2015: Pours a deep ruby red color with a medium pinkish-white head that evaporates steadily to a film. Short strings of lacing on the glass. Aroma of sour cherries, funky yeast and malt. Light-bodied with a tart cherry character and notes of yeast, doughy malt and berries. The finish is moderately tart with a sour cherry aftertaste. Really good all around.

Bouteille 750ml, 2012, partagée par tom10101, merci beaucoup Tommy! Couleur rouge voilée, mousse rose laissant une jolie dentelle. Arôme de cannelle, cerise, boisé, levures sauvages. Goût de cannelle, levures sauvages, cerise, boisé, bonne acidité. Carbonatation moyenne-faible, courir moyen.

Tons of cherries and tart pear aroma. Excellent there. Taste cherries, yet somewhat cherry skittle and syrup. Overall really good beer would like some more tartness and dryness to balance this out. Still a 4 in my opinion.
Oak cherry in aroma. Fairly carbonated. Cedar and cigar box initial flavor with abundance of cherries. Finished cherry like and dry.
UPDATED: JUN 9, 2015 Pink, tons of cherry, oak, and funk, this is very tasty beverage man! Could use another

Bottle. Dark ruby with a thick pinkish head. Dominated by sour cherry, very natural tasting and not too jammy. Musty funk present throughout. Fairly acidic but not overwhelming. Nice full body. Excellent.

(Cantillon Lou Pepe Pure Kriek) Bottle 750 ml at home, vintage 2009, served into a Cantillon taster, ABV 5%
Deep and bright red colour on a clear body, one finger of pinkish head with good retention, minimal lacing on the glass.
Aroma of cherries,cork, wood, light musk, smells pretty good! Tastes great too, lots of cherries, light wood, nice funky character, little musk, slightly sour.
Medium thin body with good carbonatiion, just a bit tart on the palate.
Just great!

Bottle thanks to Bruce, 2012 in 2015. Pours a deep purple, pinkish head. Aroma is raspberry, cherry, funky barnyard, lacto, oak, cedar, manure. Flavor is cherry warhead, oak, light vinegar, berries, sour fruits. So so smooth yet complex, ridiculous beer. 2012

On tap at Allagash Wild Friendship Celebration. Pours vibrant hazy red with pink head. Nose is sweet cherry spice, barny funk, some horseshit, musty, earthy berry. Taste is juicy tart cherry, sweet, mildly jammy, funk, wet barn wood, fruit spice. Finishes with balanced sweetness and tartness, some light vanilla cherry, juice, light oak, toast. Wonderful.
[Ölresa i Bryssel med Wihlan 2015] aromen väldigt fruktig och bärig. Smaken fantastisk balans. Klart röd med fint skum
On tap at Russian River. Pours a dark red color with a lot of frothy head. Subtle cherry that blends so well into the lambic.

Bottled 08.28.14. Poured from a 750ml bottle into a wine glass on 04.21.15.

A: Overripe sour cherries, ripe cherries, farmhouse funk, and sugar.

A: 1 finger foamy light red head that stays. Hazy ruby red body with champagne-like bubbles streaming from the bottom of the glass.

T: Cherry pit woodiness, overripe cherries, underripe cherries, and a back end tartness dominate. Green stem, slight brown sugar (back end) and a yeasty farmhouse funk (back end) are subtle.

P: Creamy smooth. Somewhat astringent with stickiness on the teeth.

O: This was my first time trying this. It apparently caused a ruckus at my local bottle shop which I wont name to avoid them being swamped again. Needless to say, its hard to find anything from Cantillon in the western U.S. Onto my humble thoughts. I enjoyed it more than I thought I would. It was not icky sweet like what must be artificially sweetened lambics. This was incredibly balanced. The sweetness was there, but the complexity was the shining part. The smoothness was first, then woodiness, overripe cherries, brown sugar, green stem, tart cherries, and funk on the back. I wouldnt move mountains to have this again, but it was a nice experience.

Bottle to glass at Chez Moeder Lambicus. Pours a beautiful ruby red color with a fizzy pinkish white head. Aroma is dry, mild tart, cherry. Flavor has a much bigger sour cherry that lingers into the finish. Lovely

Bright red with a thick pink head. Super tart aroma. Smooth and very tart hints of fruity cherry

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2012 Bottle at the brewery, shared, 14th April 2015. Dark rich red in colour, aroma is sour cherry, vinous, hay, funk. Taste is beautiful tart cherry, but not too mouth puckering, there is an almost rounded candy cherry balance. The cherries really shine in this example and probably my favourite Kriek

UPDATED: SEP 3, 2016 Shared bottle 2012 version bottled 2014. Dark red with big dark pink head. Looks amazing really. Sweet and sour cherries, red berries, berry pits, hay, straw, a little bit earthy, sourdough bread. A very light fruity sweetness with full sourness and a light woody bitter finish. Medium bodied with strong and light prickly carbonation. Massive beer, extremely fruity, here Id like to taste it slightly older, but the fruit character here is really world class. 

Update: 2013 version at Quintessence. Same as above but with lots of amazing marzipan notes. Incredible really. 

2013 from large bottle at Cantillon. Still think this is my favorite kriek, so super juicy and delicious cherry/almond combo.

2012 bottle. Tons of dirty funk on the nose with wet horse blanket, spoiled cherries, overripe bananas, mild leather, lactic acid, and a faint odor of damp dog hair. Amazing dark rose color with a fizzy pink head. The tartness grabs the tongue hard before a smooth, layered cherry and light vanilla blend pushes the funk aside. Moderately acidic flavor along with minor lemon and a pleasant dry finish. Soft mouthfeel. A real treat.

750ml bottle shared at Hoppy Pub, Thessaloniki, courtesy of Kostantinos. Pink-red color with pink head. Aroma is funky fruity, with intense barnyard notes in the beginning. After some time the aroma is only cherries and some wood. Sweet and light acidic-sour taste, funky tart cherries. Light thin to oily body with soft tp average carbonation.

Sampled from a bottle (2012) provided by Galen at ChurchKey, thanks! Reddish color with light pink head. Aromas of vinegar, raspberry, tart fruit, cherries. Tastes of vinegar, raspberries and tart berries, cherries. Medium-light body with a dry finish. Very nice.

Bottle from brewberry fab minty, cherry stone, almond, tart cherries. Opaque deep crimson. Spritzy, fruity, light,drying citric notes, long fruity yet tart finish. Up there with mariage parfait as best kriek.

UPDATED: JAN 21, 2017 Pours a cherry red with a pinkish head which soon disappears.Aroma of barnyard, lemon with a slight hint of cherry. Tate is almost all cherries, tart and sweet. Full bodied. LPK 2011 label - cinnamon cherries, modest tartness, oak.
Nez de cerise incroyable ! Belle acidité, avec une sensation moelleuse en bouche...

Superbe nez puissant de cerise. Belle notes boisées. Bouche moelleuse, très acide et sèche. La cerise domine. La bois est également bien présent, très bel équilibre. On distingue également quelques notes toastées. Superbe longueur.

Bottle thanks to bursprak! Pours blood red with a big, pink, short lasting head. Aroma of tart cherry, dry oak, vanilla, marzipan, slight cinnamon, balsamico. Very bitter cherry stones up front in the taste, "green almonds", sour, fruity cherries, deep dark cherry. Very good with a complex fruityness, high carbonation and a crisp body!

UPDATED: FEB 9, 2015 Poured from the 2012 vintage into a taster glass showing a deep blush red and opaque with pink dainty foam. 

The nose is bursting with the bretty influence that Cantillon is famous for; some faint hints of dry cherries but mostly brett. 

The palate is light bodied and highly carbonated. The flavor is extremely and impossibly cherry fruit forward in all ways - aroma, flavors, finish, etc. Although tart, its not overwhelming, making it extremely palatable. Famed for being one of the beers you have to try before you die, one can easily see why.
Ideal sustained Kriek. Acid and sweetness perfectly balanced, beautiful drink.

Bottle split 5 ways as part of Dangerous Bottleshare 5.0. Most recent batch released in september 2014. Deep red pour with some tiny pinkish lacings. Loads of cherry, cherry pits, almonds, vanilla, marzipan and some leathery notes. Very good stuff!

Bottle. Pours hazy dark red with thin pink headlines. Aromas of tart cherries, vanilla, almonds, yeast, vinegar, some straw and barnyard. Taste is absolutely booming with sour cherries up front, marzipan, vanilla, vinegar, lots of barnyard. This is truly amazing.

Fantastisk frisk & syrlig smak av bär! Speciellt ja.... Körsbär.. Underbar surhet & frän, frisk doft. Underbart! Blir inte bättre än såhär!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

acquistata al museo Cantillon Lou Pepe 2012
rosso carico, schiuma color rosa carico, la densità della birra è la prima cosa da prendere nota, al naso profumo di ciliegie sciroppate ed amarene, in bocca lacidità aiuta a pulire la grassezza delle ciliegie.
davvero ottima

Vintage 2013, dégusté après 1 an
Odeur de cerises rouges sucrées. En bouche, le goût acidulé renommé des lambics de Cantillon est ici plutôt discret. Ce nest que des cerises et encore des cerises. Le côté plus acidulé sinstalle brièvement vers la finale. La texture et sensation est superbe. Très fruité et crémeuse. Cantillon cest bon!

Rouge, rubis. Texture huileuse. Corps incroyable, vraiment dense et et soyeux. Acidité plus légère que les gueuzes Cantillon. Goût damande et de la kriek.
La bouteille était jeune (2014). Doit être très intéressant à faire vieillir.
Really awesome. Tasted some months ago in Cantillon, one bottle for me, hehe. My best lambic till date.

750ml bottle. 2012. Red colour, short-lived foam head and aroma of cherry, woody, funk. Taste is sweet cherry, dark fruity, woody oak, sour citric and light bitter. Slightly oily mouthfeel, medium bodied, fine carbonation, dry sour finish. Complex, well balanced, very drinkable.

May 12th, 2013 - Joining our celebrity line up of beers for an eminent tasting event is a thoroughly aged, well bred Lou Pepe from the year 2001. While the world was leaving behind the 90s, Cantillon was hard at work putting this together. I knew that some age would tone down the sourness, but I think maybe the Lou Pepe went just a little too far, taking 12 years to get here, and losing some of its fang and claw. The first clue comes in the nose, where it smells a bit like chlorine, or a pool freshly treated. Theres a touch of sulfur too, and maybe even baby powder. Its clean and sanitary smelling, but unexpected from a beer. The palate is still alive and well. Carbonation gives the Lou Pepe some life, activating the thin layer of flavor that seems to be left after much of it has faded away over time. What remains is a clear, pure taste of light watermelon, apple skins, and an acidic splash. The overall impression is a highly sophisticated carbonated beverage, which suggests that this is either an ephemeral beer, or the ravages of time took too much and gave back too little. Still, it is a landmark moment, and I am happy to have given this legendary brew a try.

Keg at Kernel Brewery at Zwanze Dat 20/09/2014. Deep purple / red with a bright pink head. Georgous. Aroma is big horsey cerry fruits, sour smokey cherry, raspberry. Flavour is big cherry, tart raspberry, cherry sweets, hint of smoke. Nice smooth solid sourness. Huge fruit flavour, rich deep and layered. Palate is refreshing, medium clean sour, highish carbonation. Long fruit duration. Superb beer.

On tap at the Birre Sotto l'Albero festival in Rome-ITALY (Macche and Bir&Fud). Pours an amazing red/rose cloudy color, medium tick rose color foamy head. Nose: mild acetic feel, vinegar. Mouth: light, refreshing, dry, thirst quenching. Cherries and red fruits. Great. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
2006 Bottle at Cantillon for drink, no label. Pours gorrgeous red. Cherries, tart, funk, strawberry, quite dry as well. Tarty drink dominated by cherries. Awesome stuff.

UPDATED: JAN 13, 2015 Well, I was quite disappointed with this one, I am a big fan of the classic version of the Cantillon Kriek, which is I think is the ultimate cherry lambic... The Lou Pepe was not as great as I expected it to be. The nose was quite flat, less aromas than the classic kriek, the taste is also more sour, less balanced. I am thinking I might have bought a bad bottle because also there was a strong cork smell... I will give it another go.
2007 Sticker @ post-GABF party. Very sour, very cherry, very, very good. Ill be chasing that dragon again for a long time... well, at least until the 2011 bottle matures.

October 24, 2014. Bottle, 2011 sticker. Ruby red with a large pink head. Aroma is cherries, barnyard, citrus, earth, leather and funk. Taste is tart cherries, funky, woody and earthy with a dry woody cherry finish. Light to medium bodied, average carbonation.

Bottle 2007 sticker bottled September 04 2009. I purchased this off the shelf 5 years ago back when you could just buy them. Pour has a rich red color and a fat one finger pink head that held very well. Aroma has mild cherry, light acidity, some fruit skin, funky touches, and a fair bit of jam for a beer aged this long. Mouth feel is medium and carbonation plenty strong. Flavor is where the cherry starts to pop, nice dry acidity, mild funk, cherry skins, dryness from the barrels, and a lingering jammy finish. This has aged better than I would have hoped for and is a fantastic treat.

Poured 2011 from bottle to glass. Blood red hue with fizzy pinkish red hue. Aroma is jammy, cherry, lactic, slight peppercorn, straw. Mouthfeel is great with a medium light body and crisp carbonation. Taste is dry sweetness followed by a tart following that extends through the finish. Overall this is a great brew.
Bottle. Pours deep red with pink head. Aroma vanilla, cherries, sour, wild, very jammy. Taste is very sour, great tart cherry, light bodied, high carbonation. Overall, super good.

750 ml bottle. 2008 vintage. From some web store long time ago.
Dark ruby red colour with a small pinkish white head. 
Cherries, sourness, acidity, vinegar and some red berries in the aroma. 
The flavour is dry red berries, cherries, tartness, sourness and mild acidity. Rather drinkable for a such sour and acidic brew. Tasty.
This is a damn good beer. Sweet pink color and foam. Its kinda sour, yet, still got the sweet taste of cherry! Recomented.

(On tap at Akkurat, Oct 14 2014) Pours a nearly opaque intense deep reddish pink with a moderate pale pink head and no lace. Aroma has a huge whack of cherry, a slight cheesiness, musty moist barnyard sort of character, a little woody but not overpoweringly so, and not too sour. Oh,, did I mention tart cherry? On the palate, another huge whack of tart cherry begins things, light lemony acidity, fading into a moderately bitter, lightly woody and barely musty finish. Dry, lightly tannic feel to the aftertaste with nice lingering fruit tartness. Medium bodied with a little chewiness and effervescent carb. Words dont describe this. The fruit character, feel and balance is almost off the map of typical kriek, and it is an amazing beer period.

UPDATED: AUG 6, 2016 750ml bottle served in a snifter glass. Bottle from September 2009. Cork in perfect state. 
A: Pours a cloudy ruby red color that forms a medium and soapy and fizzy rose colored bubbled head with medium retention and practically no lacings left in the glass. 
S: Nose is very fruity. Strong notes of red fruits and pale malts. Strong notes of cherry and raspberries. Notes of oak, leather, earth and metal. Quite sour. Notes of apple vinegar. 
T: Slightly sweet upfront taste. Strong notes of cherry, raspberries, sweet malts, oak, leather, earth and yeasts. In overall, the taste is quite dry and sour. Light hops bitterness. 
M: Light body. Strong and lively carbonation. Very fruity and sour aftertaste. Strong notes of raspberries. 
O: Good drinkability. Very fruity beer. Masterpiece. 
[ BA Review @ 1/22/2012 ]

2007 bottle - How can a 7 year old bottle hold so many fruit notes? Dark cherry pour with tons of fruit and funky barnyardness (yes that is a word). Shit tons of super tart cherries and mouth puckering tartness without an overwhelming amount of acidity. Long dry finish. Great stuff

Spina @ Eurhop 2014.
Rossa quasi fosforescente con bella schiuma.
Acida, aspra e molto amarenosa.
Ottima.

This 2007 vintage bottle pours with a rosy deep red to purple body that supports a white head of foam that has a bit of a pinkish hue. The aroma offers up a modest degree of funk, some fruity candy tartness and cherries. The taste is straight up tartness that gets puckering and biting to midway. Behind the tartness is a nice cherry thing going on. It gets fully tart and puckering into the finish. Do damn tart

At Stephens during GABF 2014. Pours bright red with pink lacing. Aroma is fresh Cantillon funk, soft interesting cherries. Taste is funky Lambic cherry, hint of sweetness, light acidity, some light red fruits, raspberry notes, cherry.

UPDATED: AUG 31, 2015 "more cherry apparent then in the regular kriek. still way more sour and tart than sweet, but the cherries were obvious, as well as the intense tartness. still not sold on Cantillon at the high prices, but this is a very good beer. 8/11-the 2008 vintage just blew my mind. first Cantillon beer Ive had that was hands down worth the $. i dont know if its the vintage, or the age, but ill be looking for more. ridiculous complexity, and one of the best uses of fruit in beer ive had to date. time will tell if this one was the anomaly, or the last, but the 08 was amazing!"
09 was close.
4.4 prior to the 08 vintage, but Id give that alone a 4.7.  
4.5 for 2009.
Excellent....crazy cherries, as it should be. Very dry on the finish that made it more tart. I loved it!!!!

2011 sticker. Thanks to Erik. Opened this last in the cantillon tasting. Good, but I actually think Ioked the LP fram better. Lots of tart cherry. Very dry like a red wine which kinda turned me off. Slightly sour, less than I expected.

On tap at Zwanze Day. Hazy deep red colour with a fluffy pinkish head. Tart, yeast, oak, and fruit in the aroma. Average carbonation and medium body. Taste starts tart but then turns into a complexity complicated to describe with fruitiness, vinegar and sour notes. Overall, a nice lambic.

Sour cherry smell. Taste is the same with the sourness mostly being at the forefront rather than the cherries, which was disappointing given that it is a Lou Pepe, but the bottle was a 2010 drank in 2014, so perhaps that was the reason.

Beautiful hazy red with fluffy white head with red hues. What a view! Aroma is fresh cherry perfume, vanilla, funk and some citrus. Very fruity palate. Aftertaste is bitter, loads of cherries and a round finish. Overall: excellent!

UPDATED: FEB 4, 2017 On tap at Erzbierschof for Zwanze Day 2014. Hazy cherry red with a pink small head. Comolex sour cherry aroma, tartness, barnyard, some feeling of the stone left. Great dry-sour taste, low carbonation, complex finish. Really good stuff, as I expect from Cantillon. 8-4-9-5-17

2013 Bottle at Cantillon, consumed February 2017. Dark blood color with nice pink head. Aroma is fresh cherry skin, almonds, and a distinct funk note as well as some vanilla as it becomes warmer. Taste is citrus, cherry skin, again the almonds, vanilla (only after decanting, though), and a strong, nearly mouth-puckering sourness that is in perfect balance with the fruit. Still, amazing stuff. 9-4-9-5-17.2014 bottle at Cantillon, consumed February 2017. Has a bit more sweetness than the older bottles, but still deep and balanced.

UPDATED: JAN 30, 2015 Hazy red with a weak pink head. Deeply sour, very complex, almond, red berries, funk, hay. Taste on this one is very balanced, but so much going on, not that much cherries but straight red fruit with very prominent almond cherry pit feel to it, quite acidic, with a lot of funk and hay.
2008 750ml bottle pours a dark red with a thin off white head. Aroma of oak cherry and lemon. Nice tart and sweet cherry taste.

The highly acclaimed kriek in the Lou Pépé series, which is made of only 2 year old lambics and refermented with the help of a sugary lambic solution to feed the yeast - and of which no residual sugars remain in the finished product. Dirty pink head, pearly, crackling but quickly dissolving as often in traditional lambics (and no lambic lover really cares for it anyway), dark cherry red colour, hazy. Amazingly complex lambic aroma, hay, tons of fresh sour cherries, citric and lactic acidity, sulphur, wine vinegar, barnyard but in a completely elegant and noble way. Fresh fruity taste of the sour cherries beautifully mixed with the lambic esters, tomato, powerful lambic sourness, sharp, appetizing, earthy, woody, sparkling champenoise mouthfeel, with a very complex, long, oaky, dry finish. One of Cantillons great masterpieces, like the other two Lou Pépés.
Bottle 2011 - Pours a dark red. A nice sour cherry aroma and some sweetness. The taste was mostly cherry and slightly sour w/ a little banyard funk. Overall, damn good!!!

2009 vintage Pours a beautiful deep red with a white head. Nose is acidic cherry, taste is puckeringly tart cherry. Not a sour guy, this didnt change anything. Those around me who like the style seemed to enjoy it very much.

Tap at gbbf. Pours ruby with a pink head. Aroma is wonderful - lightly sour with lemon, red berries, light custard, cherry... Light body, light carbonation. Lemon, light egg, cherry, raspberry, white wine, peach, apple... Lovely. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle thanks to mora..Pour is dark red with a thin whote head..Nose is cherry, oak, cherry skin, earth, berries, tary, sourness..Taste is tart, cherry juice, cherry skin,

Pours dark pink with low pink head Aromas are intense of bretta, cherries, red fruits Very nice sweet and sour taste from cherries, caramel, wild strawberries Nice and balanced palate ending nicely dry but still lightly sour

This one poured a Ruby red color with a pinkish head. Aroma was of cherry cough drops, cinnamon, and mild funk. Flavor was similar, dark cherry skin cinnamon character with underlying barnyard funk. Pretty good.

UPDATED: JUL 22, 2014 Reddish purple pour with a pinkish head. Aromas of slight earthiness, barnyard, big sour cherry. Taste is sour with a sweet syrupy finish of cherry. Medium thick mouthfeel. Medium carb.
Bottle shared thanks to artmcd88. Poured light hazy red with pink head. Aroma of acidic citrus berry. Light carb med bod. Light sour quite acidic taste.

75cl Pours a hazy purple pink with fluffy dissipating pinkish white head that leaves very light lace. Aroma of funky yeasty awesome fruit, lactic hay. Taste follows, nice cherry flavor, wow. Bubbly and refreshing on the tongue, not overly sour. Amazing.

Draught at pikkulintu. Pours murky dark red with pink fluffy lacing head and a sour scent. First taste like an explosion of sour cherries also some marzipan, and perhaps some other berries also in taste. Nice rounded sweet and sour taste. Well balanced. Goes down really easy on this hot summer day.- beerbasher

Tap @ Pikkulintu, Helsinki. Pours a carmine red with a small, slightly pinkish head. Aroma is a lot of sour vinegar, cherry and berries. Taste follows along the same lines. Tart with vinegar and cherry as well as berries. Dry. Full with some carbonation. Just plain superb.

Some people with a bottle and a sample for lil ol me: Pours opaque red with loose with head. Aroma is cherries, the funk, hints of vinegar, and wood. Taste is not as sour as I expected, but very tart and tangy. The cherries add very little in the way of sweetness, but compliment the sour aspects. Very pleasant mouthfeel. This was a 2011 bottle by the way.
Amazing gueuze lambic, very complex and full of different tastes, so enjoyable, very sour, grains, cereals, wild fruity and flowery notes. Almonds, krieks. Uauuuu

Bottled. Pours amber iwth a small, pinkish head. Aroma of wood, vanilla notes, barnyard and sour cherries. Slightly sweet flavor that ends up dry and tart. Medium bodied, watery to oily texture and soft carb. An excellent Sour.

Another wonderful Kriek from this brewery. Great use of different sour cherries, the fermentation turned out fantastic, with perfect palate. One of the most complex Krieks I have had, and real balanced to match.

Poured from bottle into sample glass (Kriek-off): Pours ruby red with a decent pink head. Aroma of cherry and funk. Taste is a little sweet, cherries, and some grape. Very tart, very pleasant. Medium body, dry finish.

Bottle @ Quintessence and at home. My favorite among the LPs. Intense cherry flavor with the bitter cherry seed, the skin and pulp. Not surprised to find lemon, almonds and barnyard funk. Tanins and bitterness that gives variety to the sourness when it comes to mouthfeel.

shared bottle at the cantillon brewery. poured a nice poured a dark rube red colour with a pinkish head. cherry, tart, funky sourness, oak, nice sour cheries, some kind of earth tones, plums, red fruits, nice drie in the finish. the use of the cherries really makes this a complex beer. perfectly balanced. awesome mouthfeel.
At quintessence. Red colour with pink head. Dust, fruity aroma. Sweet, cherry, fruity taste, also slightly sour. Medium body.

Deep ruby pour, pillowy frothy head and high lacing retention. Fruit slurry kind of aroma, fresh cherry pie with a mint sprig.. you can smell the pits and other green matter too. This is a shining example of what extra fruit can do when dosed in larger quantities vs. the standard fruited lineup. Cherry pulp and fruit skins, moderate tannins and bright acidity are the hallmarks of this brew, easily my favorite from the LP series and a treat to age and watch develop.
@ Cantillon Quintessence. Beautiful dark red colour, pink foam. Complex cherry aroma with notes of almond. Light sweetness, funky sour finish. Wonderfull beer.

UPDATED: MAY 2, 2014 On tap @Chez moeder lambic and bottle sample @Cantillon Quintessence 2014. Pours cloudy intense red with light red foam. Aroma is little sweet, bit sour, fruity, cherries. Taste little sour, fruity, cherry. Fruity cherry finish.
I preferred the bottle version over the tap version because of the intenser aroma and taste.  Rating given is for the bottle version.  Tap version : 6/10, 3/5, 7/10, 3/5, 13/20.

Bottle 2013 vintage, tasted fresh. Beautiful deep red red with pinkish-red foam. Aroma is a nice mix of barnyard funk, wood, wheat and cherries. Very nice cherry presence, almost grape and wine. Taste beautifully showcases cherries with an intense tartness. Rich and full bodied. More complex than the regular kriek which is very straightforward cherries with very few funk. One of the best Cantillon out there.
A revelation! Aged cheese, mushrooms, funk, and fruit on the nose. Very sour, big cherry finish. A very special beer!

Bottle shared at the brewery. Pours a dark purple with purple head, gorgeous. Aroma is cherries, raspberry, Bordeaux, bitter almond, lemon, massive fruitiness. Taste is raspberry and sour cherry, grapefruit, tangerine, bitter almond. Very acidic. So creamy and fruity. Lovely.

I drank this with good friends on the evening of Feb 10th, having no idea that within a week I would quit my job, almost loose my wife, & become the father to a baby boy. I was just waiting for a milestone to enter my rating for this beer, but it feels like a lifetime ago since I took these notes.

Pours a bright reddish pink with a big head and nice lacing on the glass. 

The aroma is tart cherries with a nice bright acidity. Its got some lemon rind, barnyard, & musty basement... but its dominated by tart cherry character.

The flavor is loads of sour cherry, with some oak & some tart lemony character as well. Its very fruit forward but holds that bone dryness giving that great juxtaposition that the best fruit lambics pull off so well. Its got the earthiness of citrus rind & some oakiness, but like the flavor is just extraordinarily cherry dominated. 

The mouthfeel is nicely bubbly and lively on the tongue. 

I hate to just dole out a huge score to a hard to get "loon" but this is just fantastic.
2009 bottle shared downtown. Ruby pour, a baby finger of head. Tart cherry/ leather aroma. Sour cherry, leather, vinegar, mild funk.
Bottle shared at LeviLOL tasting - thanks Brad!! Hazy light red pour with off white head. Really nice nose, lots of cherry, crisp. Huge cherry taste, tart but not sour. Really great!
UPDATED: APR 14, 2014 2008 bottle shared by Brad - thanks! Hazy reddish pink pour with a white head. Wow, what a beer! Sour cherry, funky, prickly on the tongue. Damn.

Bottle with 2010 sticker. Deep clear ruby/magenta pour with a bubbly pink head that sticks around for the whole bottle. Aroma of sour cherries, black cherry jam, oak, pizza shop funk, worn leather and lemon rind. Sour, juicy cherry, lemon peels, leather, oak, sourdough and earthy flavors. Smooth puckering, juicy palate with a lingering tart finish. Fantastic.

2008 Bottle with Ray, Chris and Jay. Pours murky bright red. Head diminishing to just a couple pods, no lace. Aroma is tart cherry, big horse blanket, deep oak. Tingling tartness right up front, super dry...lingering tannic dryness on the tongue. Real nice

Dark pink with a good sized pink head. Aroma is cherry pie, cherry blossoms, cider vinegar, funk. Medium-full bodied, sweet on the palate with a subtle hint of sour, stylish finish. Taste is cherry pie, sour cherries, cider vinegar, cherry yoghurt. Definitely one of the most complex and tastiest krieks that I've had.

2011 bottle at cantillon brewery, brussels. Dark red color, light red head. Fantastic aroma of cherrys, sweet and sour notes, earth, stables. Taste is also good, cherrys, earth, sour and many other flavors.

750 ml corked green bottle shared with Brenn79. Thanks Alen! 2008 vintage. Pours a gorgeous ruby red hue with a huge pink head with excellent retention. Aroma is strong in funk, firstly, followed by cherries (the flesh and the pits) and vinegar. Taste is tart cherries (8/10 on a sour scale), acidic, vinegar. Excellent lambic.

750 ml bottle 2008 vintage, shared with Poisoneddwarf, 1400 milestone rating- Pours ruby red with a beautiful light pink head. Aroma is tart cherries, cherry pie, funky as hell. The taste is tart cherries, funk, creamy and delicious. This was worthy of a milestone, best beer I have had in a long time.
UPDATED: JUL 16, 2016 Lou Pepe Pure Kriek 07-750 bottle @RBWG-A-thin pink-hazy red/pink. A-yeast, med fruit. T-vinegar, sour cherries, grainy/lt malt. 160716 @rbsg-pbgh GT. 02 bottle too
Backlog from a bottle tried at a beer tasting with Systembolaget 2011. Cherries, somewhat milder in its acidity than for say 3 Fon. Cederwood, some hay, spices and citrus.

Very excited to be able to try this beer with bmmillsy super generous beer buddy. Absolutely the most beautiful pink/red coloration -deep maroon. Foamy pink head dissipated quickly. Sour, cherry, vinegar, cherry licorice aroma. Always love to try a new limbic, but i am very thankful to try this hard to find beer. Light medium body and well carbonated. Not as sweet as a normal limbic, but the cherry lambic makes up for it with its sour hay-tart fruit.

UPDATED: APR 28, 2014 Bottle from Tipples. Awesome score here and had to leave work early to snag it. 2010 sticker poured into a tulip on February 15, 2014. Pours bright bright darkish red and totally clear. Bright pink fizzy one finger head on top and dissipates quickly. Aroma of lots of vinegar, tart cherries and cherry skins. Flavor is sour vinegar up front and then lots of cherry skins and tart but sweet cherries. The balance here is outstanding. Not medicinal at all, cherry is highlighted but not overpowering like the New Glarus cherry brew, and it comes together beautifully. A nice vanilla oak in the backdrop that really mellows this out. Juicy cherries but lightly dry finish. Medium light mouthfeel, full flavored, and big bubbly carbonation. While cherry isnt my favorite in beer, this balances it as perfectly as possible. Very nice.

Dull red, pink head that fizzles into lacing and disappears. Nose is tart cherries, wood, subtle sweetness. Taste is tart cherries, oak, tart yogurt. Very light and dry mouthfeel. Lingering tart yogurt finish.

Esemplare Vintage, 2006. Semplicemente nettare divino, ambrosia, elisir della lunga vita. Un tale livello di perfezione lascia il bevitore adorante e attonito. Il gusto pieno e voluttuoso delle ciliegie scivola alla pefezione sullacidità morbida e vellutata, che avvolge il palato esaltando le note fruttate e acetiche secondarie, lasciando nella bocca la sensazione di aver baciato una maestosa divinità femminile della birra. E infatti è proprio così.

Pour is hazy red with a small reddish head that fades quickly. Aroma is of tart cherries, oak, acidity, spice, and lemon peel. Flavor is much like the nose with some initial sweetness and a tart body/finish. Slight vinegar, but it is subdued.

750 ml. bottle. 2011 Sticker. Thanks Louis! Pours a bright crimson with a large pinkish red head. Big aroma of tart fruit, funk, and wood. Taste is tart cherries, funk, and some wood. Very tart and refreshing. Superb.

Rated from memory. 
Pour a beautiful dark pink? with a big n fluffy pink head Absolutely gorgeous. 
Aroma of unripe cherries, sweet cherries, cherry skin, sour sweets, slight green apples all rounded beautifully up by the classic Cantillon funk n tart. 
The taste is pretty sour, but has plenty of fruity, juicy sweetness to it. 
Medium bodied, with somewhat champagne fizzy carbonation. Rather dry mouthfeel.
Thanks to my man Hoprider for sharing this bad boy.

UPDATED: JUL 16, 2014 [Bottle / 2008 ] Thanks, Kevin! Ruby, crimson red & brown tinted body with a lavender tinted head that simmers to a collar rather quickly. Aroma is blood red cherry skins & cherry flesh with a signature Cantillon funk behind everything. Tart & fruity with a great presence of slight, underlying funk. Taste is perfectly sour with gushing cherry flesh & grape skins, a light presence of oak, sour & hay-like funk, & a dry, lemon-y acidic finish. Touch of vinegar... This stuff is truly great. Another amazing sour from Cantillon. Impressive.
[Bottle / 2011] Thanks, Ben. Lovely cherry presence, even more so than the 2008 bottle. Gushing, sour cherry flesh, faint cinnamon sticks, light wood & some spicy Cantillon funk. Delicious.

Bu en bouteille de 75cl, magnifique couleur rubis trouble avec une mousse très peu longue. En bouche on va pas se mentir ça sent la bonne cerise qui est bien de saison mais acide comme il faut. Incroyable comme on sent le bon côté de la gueuze, cest à dire avec une acidité marquée pile comme il faut, se met en avant.

Anxious to rate this one. Hazy reddish pink with a small pink foamy head. Of course cherry, but along with that, vinegar, sweaty feet, cow feed or dunk, not sure which one. Wild yeast probably. And to top it off, wet wood and straw/hay. All of this for smell. First taste, Phew! Sour! Wild yeast all over the place. It is cherry but thats not the dominant flavor. The barrels wood and...huh? Salt? Holy shit, this is one complex beer. Barn peaks through, and a lot of fresh and sour red fruits. And after a while it hit me....cloves, hah, who wouldve imagined.Champagne like mouthfeel with the right amount of bubblies. Tough beer to rate but hats off to such craftmanship. Hate it or love it, dont know, I guess I tolerate it.

2010 bottle. Pours a hazy purple pink with fluffy dissipating pinkish white head that leaves very light lace. Aroma of funky yeasty awesome fruit, lactic hay. Taste follows, nice cherry flavor, wow. Bubbly and refreshing on the tongue, not overly sour. Amazing.

Bottle shared with and thanks to kermis. Pours cloudy red with not much head. Aroma is beautiful sour tartness and cherries. Great red fruits with some funk. Taste is moderate sour and light sweet. Absolutely lovely. Medium body with average carbonation.
Proche de la Cantillon Kriek, mais un peu plus de goût peut-être, un peu plus acide, plus de notes épicées, de noix, de bois, mais toujours de la cerise très concentrée.

UPDATED: DEC 19, 2013 Kanske lite snål på betyget för det här är kriek i absoluta världsklass, men får för mig att den kan nå ytterligare magiska nivåer med lagring. En öl-legend från Bryssel sa att om man en gång testat Lou Pepe så går det inta att gå tillbaka till den vanliga. Sant. Klar rubinröd. Perfekt doft av äkta körsbär. Balanserad och härlig. Ren smak utan komplexitet. Mycket tydlig smak av körsbär, låg sötma, syra och beska. Nästan lite trögflytande och dom små bubblorna får verkligen kämpa för att ta sig till ytan. Pinfärsk flarra på Cantillon



Flaska på Akkurat årgång 2000, flaskad 2002. Samma rubinröda färg men klarare jämfört med ung, svagt disig bara. Doften drar mest åt surkörsbär. Kroppen känns tunnare. Betydligt surare. Låg mousse. Surkörsbär ät tydligt och intensivt i både doft och smak.
Notes from backlog. Even better than the regular kriek, this is a real shock to the system. Excellent tartness, and a lot of cherries!

750ml bottle with 2008 sticker. Dark red with light pink-tinged head. Big leather and oaky notes in the aroma, cherry also of course. Throw in some vinegar, a dash of liquorice and almost almost dark and velvety hint of spice. On the tongue: cherry, red grape, drying, oaky, tannic finish. Great sourness. Not as mind-blowing as my first sampling of the regular kriek, but perfectly balanced, complex, intriguing and delicious nonetheless.

Bottle all to myself at Cantillon, 26/09/13. 2010 vintage.
Hazed raspberry-ade red with a well topped crimson head of bubbles.
Nose is musty wood, tarte cherries, damp straw, dry rot, light smokey cherry waft.
Taste comprises cherry drops, dry rot, cherry dipped straw, musty barnyard notes, smoked cherry mash.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, tarte cherry finale.
Top draw fruit lambic with a wonderful nose.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: 2009 bottle pours pink red. Nose has funk, sweet cherries. Huge cherry pie flavor with a mild finish. Cinnamon, crust. Holy shit. Man. This is the perfect beer.

75 cl. Bottle bought at Cantillon. Vintage 2004. Huge off-white frothy head that mostly lasted. Cloudy to muddy dark reddish color. Aroma of strong cherry, leather, almond, citrus, vinegar, sour sweet and woody notes. Over the palate came strong sour and wood like notes with cherry and some fruitiness. Medium bodied with an average carbonation. Moderated sour with some counter sweetness. Lingering sour fruity finish. Seems more smooth with age. A lovely Lambic!
Amber-ruby cloudy color with white head. Nice fruity aroma, also sour. At taste is sour and dry with cherry flavour.

Light red with a pink head - A nice sour berry aroma A very good berry and wood taste with a descrete sourness in the back - Lingering berry finsih and again a descrete sourness in the back - This was a very good beer

UPDATED: JUL 4, 2014 Bottle 0.75l at Pikkulintu, Helsinki. Vintage 2002. Colour is clear light red with very small white head. Aromas and flavours: Berries, raspberries, cherries, some sweetness and sourness.
Tap at Pikkulintu, Helsinki. Vintage 2007. Points 3.5.

2001 Vintage

Bomber into tasting glass

A: Reddish Hue, Passes Some Light, White Head, Mild Lacing

S: Bitter Cherries, Bitter Raspberries

T: Bitter Cherries, Bitter Raspberries, Mild Sour Mash

M: Decent Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Bitter, Sour

Overall, 2001 is uber sour, so worth the cash
aroma a cerezas. carbonatación media con espuma blanca/rosada. sabor ácido nada agresivo. cerezas y mas cerezas. una maravilla

2008 vintage. First pour is a violet or purple color with small right of head. Nose is cherry, wild funky yeast and fruit sugar. Flavor is mostly the same as the nose with the addition of some fresh berry jam. The finish is sweet without any acidic notes anywhere. Tart yet very smooth and real easy to drink. The texture is slightly syrupy. Crazy amounts of cherries. Thanks to Adam Jackson for the bottle share!

Bottle sample at Holy Grale for Zwanze Day 2013. Dark red color with a medium pink head. Aroma of big funk and sourness and cherries. Flavor is vinegar up front, then peppery yeast with a big cherry finish. Huge thanks to the gentlemen at the next table who shared some of their bottle, as this one was sold out by the time we got outside to try to purchase it.

Pours an intense red. Aroma is sour cherries, strawberries, funk. Taste is cherries, strawberries, funk, hints of vanilla.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours dark pink with low disappearing pink white head
Aromas intense of bretta, cherries, red fruits
Very nice sweet AND sour taste from cherries, caramel, wild strawberries
Nice and balanced palate ending nicely dry but still lightly sour

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: SEP 17, 2014 Dark pink with white head. Aroma is Sour, sherbet. Taste is a queue of flavours - Tart, oak, cherry. Overall, best kriek Ive had - smashing good beer, complexity in spades. Pitch perfect.

2009 Kriek, bottled 2011. Pours cloudy red with a head that disappears quickly and leaves a ring that hugs my glass. The aroma is of tart cherries, oak, acidic, and flower like notes. In the flavor I picked up on vinegar, cherries, a puckering sour with a dry finish. It has a mildl tone of funkiness and does not effect the pallet much. Overall it was a good brew.
2008 bottle. Pours deep ruby with a pale pink head. Oaky tart cherry aroma. Big, tart cherry aroma with wood and vanilla notes with lots of brown sugar. Nice and puckering, but very enjoyable.

Pours a light maroon color with webby pink head. Aromas of rich cherry pie, cherry syrup, oak, funky, and cherries-n-cream. Nice funky/musty palate of oak, light sour cherry, more cherry pie, and raspberry yogurt. Fine carbonation, dry finish.

UPDATED: JUL 2, 2013 Taster at the brewery. Shared with Mathieu87. Vintage 2007
APPEARANCE: red beer, stable red/pink head.
NOSE: very fruity, some horse blanket.
TASTE: lots of sour cherry, some wood, nice and sour beer.
Bottle shared by madbeerbaron. Thanks. Holy crap is this good. Super tart cherries backed up by a little funk. Wow. I need some more please.

750 bottle shared by Ben, thanks man!  Pours a bright clear red with a pink head, the aroma is pure cherry with a little bit of funk and sourness mixed in with it, the flavor has a little bit of sourness on the front end with an awesome finish of cherries, great mouthfeel, awesome.

UPDATED: JUN 8, 2013 750ml bottle courtesy of MadBeerBaron.  Really has a huge, massive sour cherry flavor not found in other Krieks.  Bright pink-red body, looks artificial, steady patchy white head.  Kind of dry, pitty aroma.  So much real cherry character, quite intense.  Mouth puckering, intense cherry experience.  World Class all the way...fantastic!!!!
Draught at Akkurat. Red colour with a small pink head. Aroma is sour cherries. Flavour is a lot of the same, sour, cherries.

750mL from some place in Portland long before Cantillon was difficult to find. 2007 sticker date/2009 bottling date.

A: Pours a deep plum with a light pink head. Sits pretty in the glass - if you were to show this to someone they might call it a chick beer. Poor ignorant bastards.

N: Lots of ripe sour cherries, oak, some vinegar and glue. Wine grape and raspberry jame in here. Some straw and lemon zest. 

T: Cherry dominant. Rounded sourness with a touch of fruity sweetness. Has a wonderful depth of oak and fruits. 

M: Sharply carbonated with a light, manageable body. I love how the Belgians are able to get such character into such a drinkable beer. 

O: Tasty and it seems like its balanced out the fruit and the funk at this point. Delicious. Need more.

750ml bottle, 2009 Vintage, from La Cerveteca in Barcelona. Pours a cloudy, ruby-brown colored body with a finger-width, fizzy, pinkish head that dissipates quickly and leaves a nice lacing. Aroma has a nice balance of tart and slightly sweet cherries with some dry funk, wet oak, must, and lactic acid. Flavor is similar. Tart cherries up front with some lemony notes and a good amount of wet oak before some sweeter cherries come in alongside a nice musty funk. Lactic acid comes out more towards the end before this finishes pretty tart and dry, but really well balanced with a touch of sweetness and a nice, light funk. Fairly lengthy aftertaste following a light body and a somewhat active, soft, moderate carbonation. Overall, this is a pretty awesome Kriek. Very dry and tart, but there is a slight sweetness from the cherries that provides a really nice complexity. The light funk, wet wood, and lactic acid stay balanced as well. Damn good beer.

Bottle at Akkurat 2008 vintage. Hazy deep red almost no head. Aroma: massive cherry note, classic cantillon funk, slightly cheesy. Taste: big sourness, lots of cherries, tart apples, funky, lemon, very nice!

Bottle at Akkurat. 2008. Hazy reddish liquid with small to medium white head. Aroma of lemons, almonds, barnyard, cherries, apples and funk. Taste is dry and medium to high sour with notes of cherries, almonds, funk and lemons. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Very nice and sour. Still lots of cherries.

2010. Pours ruby red with white/pink hued head. Aroma is overwhelming cherry pie, lemon, funk, hint of oak. Taste is much more balanced and enjoyable than their regular kriek - sour cherries, oak, tart with a hint of acidity and a nice pleasant fruit sourness in the finish, dry. Great stuff! Perfect balance of fruit and sour. Hard to beat this

Thanks jedwards. 2008 bottle tasted in 11. Pours a brilliant rubine red with a pink head. Smell is tart fruit, citrus, cherry. Taste is tart cherry, dry and crisp then tart and dry on the aftertaste. Light body with active carbonation...smooth really nice.
Deep red color, Light pink head.  Aroma is full of tart cherries.  Flavor is crisp  and tart, but not a ton of fruit.  HIghly carbed and a bit thick, nice beer.

UPDATED: OCT 27, 2014 2008 Bottle shared.  Pours hazy pink red with a pink head.  Aroma of tart cherries, earth, vinous, oak.  Flavour is light moderate sour, light sweet.  Full bodied with soft carbonation.

75cl bottle courtesy of and shared with Kermis.  Vintage 2008. 
Thick pink head.  Hazy deep red/pink pour.  Good sour beer.
2010 bottle.  Bright red pour with a lots of cherries, tart and sour goodness.  This is very awesome!

Rated 4-13-13. 2009 vintage. Unclear pinkish red. Soft pink head. Dry fruity sour, smooth tarty. Berries. Balanced and delicate. Sips tickle my palate into my nose. This comes together very well as a package.

2010

Bottle poured a marachino cherry color, no head very little retention

Flavor was jam packed with cherry both sweet and tart and slight woodiness.

Unesperienza mistica. Un crescendo di sensazioni dal momento di stappare la bottiglia fino allultimo sorso. Carbonazione molto lieve, acidità pronunciata, ma bilanciata magnificamente dal fruttato delle ciliegie. Bevuta anche di annate precedenti, dove naturalmente lacidità sale di tono e la birra diventa molto più astringente. Da gustare meditando.

Tap. Deep cherry red with a large pink collapsing head that leaves a bit lacing. Aroma is cherries, cherry stones/almond, light wood, leather. Taste is medium sweet and sour. Medium/light body, oily/watery texture, medium carbonation. Ends dry with cherry and wood.
Bottle at the brewery: Funky-good beer with a real wholesomeness to it. Nutty, earthy, slightly tart and sour. Mild bitterness. Countless aromas, but none jump out obnoxiously. Very fun beer.

Aroma of stinky cheese, overripe strawberries, cherry and toe jam.  Pours opaque red and nice pink film.  Taste is very funky.  Beers, raspberry, feta cheese, vinagrette and cherry.  Very tart and funky.

2008 Bottle shared by Pallieter85, thanks! Aroma sour yeasts, cherry. Red head, cloudy red colour. Taste is a bit rough. Moderate tartness complements the sourness. Not excellent, but still a quite good one. Finish is tar sour bretty.

Bottle vintage 2008 brought to our tasting by Pallieter85, many thanks. Cherry red color with medium pinkish head. tart fruit in aroma.Taste, sour cherries, vinous notes, oak. Tart finish. Very tasty beer.

Bottle 750ml.
Pours pink with medium pink/reddish head. Aroma is of fruits, cherries, sligth funk. Taste is of schaerbeek cherries, loads of cherries. Sour. Palate: Ligth body. Overall: Pretty good kriek.

bottle thanks to david! pours relatively clear beaujolais nouveau with a very nice pinkish head, good retention and lacing. fresh cherries, semi-sweet dark cherries, tender ripened red flesh around cherry pit, peppery, spicy, dusty, light to medium acidity. average carboantion, very nice lightly acidic and herbal-grassy finish. very nice although not my best from cantillon!

UPDATED: OCT 21, 2014 Bottle (750 ml). 2010 sticker. Thanks to David for sharing this one! Unclear ruby red with a small pinkish head and some lacing. Aroma of cherries, cough syrup and spices. Taste is slightly sour with a lot of cherries, cough syrup notes, cinnamon and coriander. Medium body. Lively carbonation. Not my favorite Cantillon but still very good. Theres a real aging potentiel here. 8-3-8-4-15

Sample from a bottle @ Cantillon Quintessence. 2011 sticker. Deep red with a nice pinkish/red head and little lacing. Aroma is a nice mix of tart and sweet cherries along barnyard, Cantillon funk and herbal notes. Taste is also of bright fruitiness from the cherries, moderate barnyard, oak and nice tartness. Medium body. Medium carbonation. Dry finish. Nice complexity. Really tasty and enjoyable. One of the best Kriek out there and way better from last year vintage from what I remember. 9-4-9-4-17 

EDIT: 2012 sticker is also incredibly good. Super juicy kriek. + 1 overall

Bouteille 750ml (2008), courtoisie de SlovakSniper. De couleur rouge vin et voilée. Nez de levures sauvages et aux notes terreuses, fruité (cerises sûres, notes de rhubarbe, traces de framboises), légèrement boisé (bois humide) avec des petites notes de vinaigre et décurie.  Moyenne-mince en bouche avec un pétillement moyen-élevé ainsi quune texture auc faibles notes vineuses. Goût moyen-aigre de fruits légèrement sucrés (cerises sûres, notes de framboises vertes, traces de rhubarbe) et de levures sauvages aux notes terreuses dès lentrée en bouche et qui restent présent toute la gorgée, auquel se rajoute progressivement un léger goût boisé (bois humide) avec de faibles traces de fromage vieilli en finale. Post-goût long et sec, moyennement acide et légèrement sûr de levures sauvages et de fruits (cerises sûres) avec de faibles traces boisées.

Bottle from Etre Gourmet. 2009 vintage. Pours unclear pink/red with a big foamy pinkish head. Aroma is fresh fruity, sour cherries. Taste is fruity with lots of oak notes, sour cherries, very dry taste, light sticky palate, with a rather low carbonation level.
2008 vintage. Aroma is Tannic cherry sour lemon cranberry. beautiful dark red off whut pink head.. smooth dark cherry lemon cranberry. Crazy beautiful mouthfeel.  Super sour and beautiful.

Kaatuu lasiin kirkkaanpunaisena ja kirkkaana, vaaleanpunaisella vaahdolla. Haju on vahvan kirsikkainen, hapan (mutta kuitenkin raikas) ja yrttinen. Maku on todella hapan, kirsikkainen, mausteinen, yrttinen ja "lambicmainen". Suutuntuma on keskitäyteläinen ja olut kuivattaa suuta. Kokonaisuutena valloittava ja täyteläinen tuotos, sopii parhaiten kesäterassille. Juotu pullo oli 2008 versio.

75cl bottle,2008 shared with Steve bought from Beers Of Europe.Really nice rich red colour sporting a nice foamy pinkish coloured head.Immediate cherry aroma and barnyard as well.Sweet and sour cherry taste balanced perfectly alongside some acidity making it a drink you just cannot stop sipping away at.Hints of various spices in there too.Lovely drink,another superb offering from Cantillon.

pours red , realy nice red ! pink/white foam; rather steady. 
smell is very fresh cherries
taste is SOOOO much cherries, damn! so fresh, so drinkable, so much taste, soooo good! absolutely love it !
Bue en fût dans un évènement chez Hill Farmstead, absolument génial...Même si jai vu cultor vider son verre dans la garnotte pour une lampée de CBS.

2008 bottle acquired via trade with Benzai!  Truly remarkable beer!  Soft mauve body with a cotton-candy colored head.  Nose of tart cherry, funk, barnyard, plum, oak, lemon zest/pith.  Flavor provides lots of cherry complexity.  Get the crisp tight skin, sweet ripe flesh, some vine and leafiness...every part of the plant.  Both sweet and sour.  Also get some mild apple, some cinnamon, perhaps nutmeg.  Acidic but not overly so.  Great stuff!

750ml from State Line, Elkton. 2005 blend, bottled 2006. Gorgeous blood red pour with a pinkish afterglow, a body that almost looks as hefty as NGBR. Nose is initially mellow and vaguely tannic but comes on with righteous tartness. Similar balance and elegance in the taste, with touches of sweetness coming through, but not at the expense of even a smidge of the glorious, deep, complex lambic character. Gorgeous beer!

On draft @ Novare Res. Pours a cherry red color with a finger of pink foam. Ripe cherry aromas mingle with wet wood and tart lemon. On the palate it holds a nice balance between sweet cherry, tart lemon and a touch of slightly spiced wood... creating a full richness unlike any other... almost malty but more just palate pleasing. Nice rich and full of balanced goodness !

2007 bottle.  Glorious red in color, crystal clear in color, with a fluffy white/pink head that dies down quickly.  Taste is funk, tart cherries, and those sour candies you got as a kid.  Refreshing.  A fastastic kriek, this one is one of my favorites.

2009 sticker date.  Red wine barrels meet Cantillon Kriek; lambic fans everywhere rejoice.  Cherry fruitiness meets a mildly acetic base, blending into an extremely pleasant mixture of fruit and tartness.  Sourness is kept in check moreso than in its 100% Kriek sibling; exceptional balanced overall.

This is undoubtedly a better, more balanced beer than the Cantillon 100% Kriek Ive had on multiple occasions. I love the puckering sourness of the former but appreciate the refined character of the latter.  Can I choose both?
Fantastic brew, my fav of the series. Just love the tart cherry flavor mingling with the acidic sourness and medium funk.
Pours a clear and red beer with a reddish head. The aroma is fruit, cherries and marzipan. The flavor follows the nose. The palate is sweetness with sour notes. Overall a good beer.

750ml bottle poured a dark red color with aromas of light sour cherries and some light barn yard.  Flavors are sour cherry juice, and some lactic acid.  This was undercarbonated which could be good, reminded me of the sour cherry juice you can get in the organic section at the store.  Really nice beer overall, wish I had more because I could easily drink this all day and night.

37,5 cl bottle vintage 2008 @ Gastropub Tuulensuu. Rated on 28.10.2012
Tasted in blind tasting with 10 other krieks
Aroma has cinnamon, spices, some cherries and juice. Flavour is sour with cherries, some cinnamon and earthy notes. Somewhat disturbing finish with spices.

Beautiful red body with a dark pink head. Excellent sour aroma with sour cherries, lemon, green apple. Amazing very sour and yet nicely balanced flavour with plenty of sour cherries, wood, lemon. Superb.

Bottle from etre gourmet.

This is a great kriek it is amazing the best kriek together with Schaerbeekse.
