Bottle. Vintage 2003. Frothy white good mostly lasting head. Orange red colour. Powerfull cherry aroma. Many sour notes. Exstremely powerfull sour flavor with some kriek notes. Very astringent. Long sour finish. Creamy palate. I think its sourness is too powerfull to be world class. Still very nice brew.

UPDATED: NOV 2, 2012 2009 sticker vintage poured into a Duvel art glass tulip. Pours a deep red/burgundy in color with about a fingers worth of light pink head. Head dissipated rather quickly.  Nose is stellar, its Schaerbeekse cherry skins, lemon, and some mustiness. Nose translates over to the flavor. It starts out with the sour cherry and continues with lactic lemon goodness. The cherry endures well throughout the sip. Light mouthfeel, heavy acidity, light carbonation, and a long finish. My third favorite of the regular Cantillons fruit lambics behind Fou Foune and Saint Lamnivus. Great color, nose, and taste on this, I could drink this by the gallon (and subsequently did when it was on tap at Zwanze Day 2011).

Special flight at Provisions. 2009 vintage. Pours beautiful pale ruby red with light pink head. Aroma big with sour cherries and just a bit of funk. Flavor packed with sour cherries and beautiful sour yeast. Perfect finish.

Bottle shared by esp0r at our #1000 rating celebration. Beautiful deep red body, low pink head. Aroma of cherries, sweet candy, nuts. Taste is mostly cherries, good subtle sourness, oat and honey. Really nice, good balanced. Finishes with a lasting cherry taste combined with caramel. A superb beer!
draft at Blue Monk, cherry colored opaque pour. big tart cherry aroma and flavor. sour cherries, tart but not overbearingly so. acidic. great
one of the grand daddy bottles right? well this is one of the best cherry lambics out there. so drink with adoration!

UPDATED: OCT 11, 2012 2009 vintage bottle shared at the daje & esp0r hits #1000 rates sessions
Pours deep red with a pink head. S,ells of cherries, cherries, cherries and more cherries. Some malts in the back. Light sweet, medium sour flavors, alot of wonderful cherry flavors. This beer is really a beauty, well balanced, not too sour, just smooth and wonderful
2012.10.06 - sample at brewery (brouwkwintessens Cantillon) - nice kickoff off the day
Wow  for en øl, rød farge lite skum,  en god sour ale, smaker  moreller kirsebær og druestein. Veldig god hvis man liker sour ale

2008 bottle @ The White Horse. Pours deep red with a medium reddish white head. The aromas overbearing strong blue cheese funkiness with accents of mellow fruits and sugar. The taste is wonderfully meaty cherry pit. Quite jammy, fruit-forward. The is slightly acerbic yeast and mild sourness. Light body, easy to drink. This beers very lively in profile, and drinking nicely indeed. The blue cheese-heavy aromas were the only real problem I had with this. Very nice.
Uit 2009. Gedronken met joes, benzai en dutchdrebus, kleur is mooi rood/roze met een roze schuimkraag. Ruikt muf en zuur. Smaakt zuur en vooral naar kersen.

Wow! Thanks to the Tampa crew for sharing this one at a tasting. Aroma is tart cherries, some funk, and a light oak aroma. Pour is deep red with almost no head. The taste blew me away on this one. Slight tartness with a ton of cherry flavor. Pretty much like cherry puree with a slight touch of wood. This is my kind of lambic. Awesome!

Thank you Mark - this was quite a drink! The scent is full of basement aromas, cherries, sour patch kids and grapes. Flavors are very crisp and tart; fresh grapes and sour cherries come together like candy and lead to a satisfying bitter finish. Now I know what Cantillon is all about.

Pours a bright red with no head. Aroma of funky cherries and oak. Taste follows, tart and funky. Nice cherry taste. Smooth and delicious. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle 2009 vintage @Pizzeria Paradiso. Saw this mini-whale (for me at least) sitting in a shelf, although it was not on the bottle list and ordered for 40$. Pours hazy red with a medium pink head and very nice lacing. Aroma is beautifully tart & sweet cherry. Flavor is cherry dominated, lightly tart and lightly sweet. Notes of yeast and a tiny bit of funk round out the flavor profile. Light bodied and beautifully balanced.

UPDATED: JUN 27, 2016 75cl bottle (2009 vintage) shared with Dutchdrebus, Joes, Ansjelaah. Lightly unclear pink-red color, small pinkish head. Smell cheese, sweaty, musty, sourish. Taste sour, sour fruits, slightly candy. Medium body, medium carbo.
Puple to pink colour with a light pink head. Smells dusty, cellar, oak, minty, fruity. Tastes mint, not that sour, cherry, fruity, slightly dusty, cellar, wood. thin to medium body, low carbo.
Pours dark red with a pink head. Aroma is acidic, cherries, almond, light yeast and light marcipan. Flavour is acidic, sour cherries, almond and light marcipan.

09 draft.Pours a dark pink to red with a pink lacing. Huge layers of tartness in the palate with heavy notes of cherry in the aroma. Incredibly tart upon finish with an initial sweetness upon touch to the tongue.
neon cherry color. Nice off white head. Notes of sour cherry, funk , vinegar and horse blanket. Not as sour in the mouth and feel. Very drinkable and easy to drink. Great stuff

Bottle again thanks to nightfall. Thanks! Shared at weihenheizens tasting. Pours a dark red with a large pink head and sticky lacing. The aroma is really quite tart with a heavy cherry influence. The taste is pretty sour with a sour cherry pie filling thing going on. Fairly drying on the tongue. One kick ass beer, for sure.

2008 vintage at Eleven Madison Park NYC. Cherry color with a pink head and lace.  Very pretty.  Aroma is a wine like sour funk.  Flavor is rich deep earth with sour cherry and lactic.  Texture is dust, long and deep dimensioned though fairly thin.  This was nearly as deep and complex and as I can remember having and was a incredible start to one of the best dinners I have had.

UPDATED: OCT 1, 2013 Refrigerated green 2009 bottle poured into a tulip.  Pours deep red with small pink head.  Small bubble lacing, medium body, nice carbonation, and sweet aroma.  Taste is sour cherrys.  Wonderful beer, best new beer I had this evening.  Way better than Cantillon Kriek, I will be seeking this out in the future.

2009 bottle @ Monks with Mike and Dani!  Pours clear red with a foamy pink head.  Aroma of tart cherry pie filling.  Flavor is cherry pie filling without the sweetness...a bit vinous...nice funk...touch of leather...wow!  Mouthfeel is light...still a touch lively...dry tart finish.  Delectable!
Bottle at monks 2009 thanks Kerry. Pours pink red with thin white head. Aroma of black cherry and funk. Taste is semi dry slight tart cherry pie filling

bottle 2009
Pours a deep pink with a big frothy light pink head, fading fast and leaving no lacings.
Nose is tart and plesantly sour, accompagnied by a avalanche of cherry-juice. Taste is mellow cherries with hints of oak. Again pleasantly sour.
Body  and mouthfeel is light  and slightly fizzy.

UPDATED: AUG 1, 2012 2008 Vintage bought off the shelf in Belgium from De Hopduvel in Gent. Enjoyed in a Champagne flute at 60 Degrees F with amazing friends. 

A - Exceptionally ruby red cherry appearance. Hazy and consistently dark with a half finger head produced on the pour but faded quickly. 

S - Very mild kriek scent on the nose. Slight hint of walnuts. Jammy and funky.

T - Wow. Excellent cherry jam taste. Up front tart and sour taste with an acetic finish of big gorgeous cherries. The taste is very fresh. It tastes like these cherries were picked yesterday. Very barnyardish and up front funkiness. 

M - Swishing this around I get almost no carbonation. Light body. Perfect Cherry pulp finish

O - I have an 05 Kriek in the cellar. This beer only makes me want to try the 05 more. This is great but needs to age for a while. Fresh, its not very good. I want this with a few years on it. Thats the key. 

Update: 2008 Bottle shared with friends:

Smell was more Jammy and up front cherry than the last bottle. Taste was more tart with a subdued cherry compared to the 2009. Carbonation was in line with the 2009 and same finish. Without looking at my old review, I gave the 2008 a lower rating as the 2009 at 4.3.

Bottle thanks to Bobby91w!  Clear dark ruby red pour, almost no carbonation and an aroma of very funky cherry.  Flavor is slightly soured cherry, sugar cereal, roses, flowers and finished very tart and a little dry.

Bottle as an EXTRA thanks to bobby 91w, thanks a bunch for this!  Shared with some of the MN crew.  Pour is a beautiful dark red pour, with an insane pink head.  No lacing.  Aroma is lots of jammy cherries, some tartness, a bit of funk.  Taste is lemony tartness, lots of fruit, finishing with a great dry tartness.  Not overly dry or tart or funky, but a very, very nice easy drinking beer.  Thanks!

Bottle at home. Pours a hazy deep red colour with a small pink head that diminish extremely fast. Pleasant aromas of sour berries, forest, barnyard, wood and a hint of cinnamon. More berries in the flavour including cherries, wild berries, crowberries, heather, and with a vinous ending. Light and sparkly mouthfeel. Bitterness = light+. A really good and fantastically balanced kriek.

750ml bottle 2009. Clear deep ruby red with a foamy pinkish head. Aroma is mostly tart pie cherries with some graham cracker and light earthy/musty funk. Flavor is very tart and sour upfront with some acidic fruit and vinegar and light wheat malt. Light body with good carbonation and a puckering feel. This one is interesting, tons of cherry in the aroma but tons of tartness/sourness in the flavor. Not sure Id buy this again for the cost but would be interesting to age for a few decades.

2009 vintage. What a spectacular beer. Pours ruby red with an initial big foamy head that dissipates to a light ring. No lacing. Aromas of barnyard, maybe some blue cheese, sour cherries, and maybe some cotton candy. Possibly cereal as well. Taste is sour, but very well balanced with the fruit. Neither is overwhelming. Body is medium-light with light carbonation. Bottom line, a spectacular beer.

2007 vintage, courtesy of Darrell.

This lambic pours a stunningly gorgeous, brilliant ruby color with a beautiful off white head reminiscent of sea foam. No lacing left in the wake, as to be expected, given the style.

The aroma is fantastic. Cherry pie jumps out at you if you get your nose anywhere in the vicinity of the bottle. Classic Cantillon barnyard funk along with hay, straw, wild yeast give the beer a very inviting scent.

The taste is even better than I remember from the previous occasion I drank this beer in 2007. All aspects of the flavor are spot on. The sourness in relation to fresh fruit ratio couldnt be better. This beer has incredible depth and complexity, and is just phenomenal. It is obvious why this barrel was specifically chosen to be a Lou Pepe.

The feel is incredibly smooth, with a great lingering aftertaste that continues to develop long after each sip.

On a night with many great beers on the table, this was without a doubt the highlight of the evening for me. This is one of my all-time favorite beers.

18-JUN-2012, 2009 bottle @George & Dragon, during "Un Mare di Birra".
Red with pink head.
Sour cherries and funk. Lovely cherry drink. Could be more sour, could be more funky...
...but a really nice clean sour cherry drink.
I just had to hug Sonni:-)

2009 Bottle: Pours a beautiful Bright red with a nice red tinted head that was big and frothy but left the scene quickly. Smelled like cherry candy wiht some sour adn slight wood. Tastes quite similar with a boom of sour to begin with a great balance of cherry candy sweetness, a tiny bit of woody dryness at the end. Overall a Beautiful beer that I absolutely loved

Bottle 75cl, a red beer with pink head ! Nose is gueuse like with cherry notes typical brett profile in the nose. Aroma is on cherry with dark cherry notes, cherry skin as well a floral rose notes, very dry and acidic. Light fresh cheese touch as well as wet wood, long floral and cherry finish.

Bottle @ Matts house, courtesy of arminjewell. Thanks Armin! Colorful pinkish purple appearance with a pink head. Super rich, delicious cherry, somewhat herbal, leafy aroma. Super bright, rich pie cherry, tangy, quite acidic, well carbonated, cherry skin, rich berry flavor with a lingering rich cherry pie, tart finish. Quite delicious.
Bottle to oversized snifter (2009). Looks great; fruity and inviting. Smells great! Fruity and funky. Tastes delightful. Bombies!

0.75L bottle (2009 vintage) @Groves. Thanks for sharing!  Body is shiny deep red, slightly hazed. Low pink-shaded blond head. Fresh and genuine fruit aroma from the cherries. Light sour and tart with wood tones. Taste is sour, yet rounded and harmonious with the cherries shining through. Barnyard tones and a faint sweetness underneath. Light in body. Ends dry, tart and fruity.  Super drinkabilty, nice all over.

Bottle. Pours a nice ruby red, with a big, quickly receding head. Aroma is very fruity, with apples and an oaky touch. Flavour has a lot of cherries, sour orange and apples. Long finish with a nice acidic fruitiness.

UPDATED: NOV 15, 2013 07 on tap at Brouwers. Pours red with great carbonation and thin bubbles. Smell is light tart funk. Taste is super sour and a nice cherry finish. Wow.

2011 at the brewery.

Pours hazy crimson, finger pink head.

Smell sweet vibrant cherry, bit musty.

Taste big tart cherry, candy cherry, bit syrupy, vanilla.

Lighter bodied.

Amazing
Pours a clear red, luscious pink head. Aroma is sour just like the flavor with aggreat bit of cherry flavor and wonderfulness.

2008 "vintage" into tulip.

Aroma: Very sweet/sour cherries, vinegar, slightly latexy, swedish berries candy, wheat, flower bouquet...more complex than usual. 

Appearance: Slightly hazy maroon color with a reddish head. 

Taste: Quite sweet in comparison to the normal Kriek and a little less complex and wild. I think I prefer the other one for character but this has mellowed out considerably. 

Palate: A little mouth-puckering but nothing horrible. Quite a heavy feel in the mouth, spritzy CO2.

Overall: A very interesting Lambic but a little too mellow for me. However, it is still very, very good. I wonder how a 10 year old bottle must taste....

Hazy darker bordeaux-red coloured beer with almost no carbonation and a small pinkish head. Slight sweet tart balanced aroma with some clear hints of sour cherries clearly comming forward with some fruity woody hints. Full light sprankling and fruity hinted palate. Finish is sweet sour balanded, sour cherries comming forward but not as prominent as in the aroma. Overall very good.

2008 vintage that I finally decided to drink. Pours a bright red with a medium amount of carbonation. Smells of ripe cherry and funk. Taste is less cherry than the nose but blended really well with the sourness on the beer. Awesome, glad I got to try it.

Pours deep dark red with a two finger white head. Nose is leathery barnyard funk, sour cherries and earthy soil with some oak. Taste is sweet up front with a great sour balance but ultimately the cherry sweetness wins out. But then again, this is fresh. Mouthfeel is crisp, clean, long aftertaste and light body. Outstanding. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Annata 2009, questa kriek, a differenza di molte altre, ha quella nota non  marcatamente fruttata (anche se ben presente) che lascia spazio al gusto acido e avvolgente tipico di cantillon e delle lou pepe..

Shared from bottle. Poured a bright red color with a pink, tiny head. Aroma was tart and funky. Flavor was a bit tart, with a slight vinegar note to it, between a touch of dried fruits (cherries) and a tinge of something like vanilla. Liked the tartness of this particular one.

2008 vintage, 05/03/2012.  Pours raspberry red with ruby highlights, fine strawberry cream head.  Aroma full of sour cherry, tart but at the same time a distinct round, almost creamy aspect, with raspberries, light yeast and horse blanket quality.  Taste follows suit, though not as nuanced, with dark sour cherry, bright tart citrus, lactic finish bursting with fruit flavor.  Smooth palate and dry finish, not overly sour, striking a nice balance.  Outstanding.

Ive never been one for sour beers, but this one can flip your whole perspective around.  Pours beautfully cloudy with the same hue as a blood orange.  Theres a thin white head that lines the rim of the glass but overall carbonation is quite calm.  The aroma is filled with fermented fruit, sour cherries, apple, apricot, and mild notes of hay.  The flavors are magnificently balanced.  Although the palate is acidic, the sublte sweetness of the sour cherries helps to break up what would otherwise have been an abrasive flavor profile.  Im hooked.  This beer is quite expensive, but its an absolute treat.

750ml bottle, 2008 Vintage, split with a friend. Pours a bright red color with a big pink head. Aroma is fruity, cherry, a little sour. Medium on the palate with lively carbonation. Flavor is sour, tart, cherry, with a light, tart finish.  An amazing balance between the cherry and the sour.

Bottle at home. Dark pink, deep red colour with lovely pink bubbly head. Aroma sour, lots of cherry, lemon, grapefruit, lovely. Very fruity. Taste lovely, spritzy, lots of fruit, bit vinous, some sourness and tartness but not overpowering. Sweetness but not cloying. Lovely, cant describe it properly. Really nice.

UPDATED: OCT 5, 2014 Rating #100! Vintage 2007. Poured a deep maroon, hints of purple, and a frothy pink head. Smells of sour cherry, raspberry, a touch of funk, and vinegar. Taste is sour and acidic throughout, with hints of vinegar and raspberries. Light body, with suprisingly lively carbonation and ends kind of funky. Very delicious Kriek and I am glad this was #100. Updated for 2010 vintage. Much Jammier aroma - great spice - reminds me of cherry pie - cinnamon, some vanilla, graham cracker and fruit skins. Taste is much brighter fruit - still sour though tastes much fresher. Really delicious stuff.

75 cl bottle @ Gastropub Tuulensuu, Tampere.
Originally rated on 20100312.
Pours beautiful clear ruby red color with small head. Aroma of cherries, fruits, raspberries and vinegar. Flavour of ripe cherries, ripe fruits and barnyard notes. Top notch.
3457
Bottle (2008). Aroma kriek, sour fruits. Sour all the way and I and I love it. Not Bad

UPDATED: JUL 29, 2012 07 Bottle at the Monks Cellar Dinner for this rating. Poured a bright hazy pink color, barely any head, small amt of lace. Aromas and taste of sour cherries, cranberries, cinnamon stick yankee candle, perfume notes like lavender and maybe some cotton in the aroma. Other notes of green grapes, tart dark cherry, and oak. Amazing. Re-rate, 2003 vtg, ultra tart, sour cinnamon, sugary cherry, amazing. Slightly better then the 07.

On tap at Beer Revolution. It pours a very nice ruby red with a striking pink head. The aroma is sweet cherry skin with some minor notes of hay and funk. The flavor is very fruit forward with a great tart cherry flavor that is surprisingly rather low in acidity. A lemony pucker comes in the back of the mouth with a little vitamin/mineral quality. The funk is pretty subdued. Decent body. Very bright and clean. A real pleasure.

2007 Bottle. Dark ruby brown with a fizzy head that reduced quickly. Full bodied murky cherry. Pits and skins definitely included. More sour than sweet. The fullness seems to hold back some of the bite. Noticed that the last pour of the bottle was much thicker than the first few. Top pour was too thin. Very nice. Similar to, but not better than, Lost Abbey Red Poppy.

750 ml bottle @ 3 Små Rum. Pours hazy ruby red with a frothy and fizzy pink head that quickly dissipates without leaving any trace on the glass. Smell is sour, slightly sweet and full bodied with cherries, cherry pits, sour cherries, hay, lemon juice, orange zest and some notes of horse blanket. Taste is tiny sweet and sour with tons of cherries and sour cherries, lemon juice, lemon zest, wet grass, green apples, black currants and hints of wet earth. Mouthfeel is tart, slightly mouth-puckering and medium to full bodied. Finish is sour, tart and dry with sour cherries, cherry pits, gooseberries and grass.

Bottle 750ml vintage 2009 @ Patricks Pub og Restaurant, Kristiansand
Pours cloudy deep red with a pink head. Aroma has notes of tart and sour cherries, Taste is light to medium sweet and medium to heavy sour. Body is medium, texture is thin, carbonation is soft.

03/04/2012 Open Baladin Roma (on draught, 2008 Vintage). Color rosso ciliegia, intensissima, densa e torbida, con bellissima schiuma bianco-rossiccia, non molto persistente. Aroma intenso, agrumato e di ciliegia, vinoso, si percepisce nettamente già in fase di spillatura. In bocca è morbida ed equilibrata per lo standard di Cantillon, si sentono bene le ciliegie, con note citriche, balsamiche, sul finale è secca, appena astringente. Corpo medio, vellutata, carbonazione soft. Tra le migliori Cantillon mai bevute.

Poured into a tulip. Brewed in 2008, bottled September 8th, 2010. I had a 2010 non-LP Kriek a few months ago and it was quite an ass-puckering experience. I hope this is a little less caustic.

3.5 A: Lightly hazed deep cherry mahogany color. Two and a half fingers of pink, fizzy head. Retention isnt so great and no lacing is left.

4.0 S: Im a bit surprised. This is way more funky than fruity/tart. Musty basement type funk dominates with rotting wood and old sweatsocks. Cherry is surprisingly faint for how "young" this is. Mildly tart with mild to moderate notes of lactic acid tanginess. Very light acetic acid. Its quite nice, but I was expecting a bit more depth.

4.5 T: The cherry definitely comes out more in the taste. Mildly tart with a big hit of cherry flavor. Again, this is much more funky than sour. Musty basement, musky large mammal, dry-rotted sweatsocks, decaying wood, and apple orchard. Mild lactic acid, but its just enough to add some fruit depth. Acetic acid isnt really detectable. 

3.5 M: Medium body. Carbonation is on the higher end, but its fine except that it isnt very spritzy. Also could use a bit more creaminess. Super smooth though.

4.0 D: What a completely different experience than what I had with the regular Kriek! This one is not only palatable, but also mighty tasty. Im not too crazy about the price of this though.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 02-27-2012 00:43:37

reviewed 03-14-2011 - 2008 vintage. served in a lost abbey stemmed glass. pours a vibrant deep pink with strong ruby and red. light pink head that quickly dissipated. little to no retention. beautiful color. super ripe cherry just smacks you. nice dry oak right behind it. very light musty scent blends with the oak. massive deep fresh rip cherry. it has that flavor you would find in a fresh cherry pie. this is without a doubt the dominating flavor here. there is a nice subtle oak and woody flavor. sourness is quite light in this, the least sour cantillon i have had yet. a nice moderate carbonation with a very dry finish. tartness barely triggers the gums or tingles them. this is pretty delicious, for $7 more than a 750ml of regular kriek, i would hands down choose this. much more complexity in the cherry. near perfect.

Bottle at the R-Kelly tasting of 2012. Vivid pinky red with a ravishing rosy head. Sour cherry flavour but a far more redeeming sourness. It doesnt linger and it doesnt activate your adenoids. Its a far more accessible flavour than other lambics. Its well rounded and that but I do get a kick out of the radgeness of a stiffer lambic.
From bottle. Beetroot with pink head. Nice funky lambic aroma, cherry comes through. Big lambic taste with a good whack of cherry. Nice sour finish. Delicious
UPDATED: MAR 18, 2012 Bottle. Good looking hazy red/pink . Sour cherry nose. Bitter, sweet and sour flavour. Not as radge as I thought it would be but still very good.

Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Vintage 2008. Hazy dark red with a lasting pink head. Aroma is sweet, malty, heavy cherries and marcipan. Flavor is quite sweet and rather acidic. Dry and moderate acidic finish. 270112

2008 Vintage. Deep red with a medium pinkish head  beautiful. Aroma of sour cherries, barnyard, a bit of sweat and citric notes. A very tart dry flavor with cherries, some lemon and oak  delicious! Some pleasant light astringency. Rounded mouthfeel. I like this beer more and more with each sip. This is a wonderful lambic.

UPDATED: NOV 7, 2012 From notes.  First reviewed 9/20/2011.  2008 vintage on tap in a Cantillon long stemmed flute at Zwanze Day.

The pour is a hazy cherry color, hazy enough that I cant see through the narrow glass. The head is a pink ring that never bubbles up or really fades.

The aroma is full of cherries, slightly on the tart side, slightly sweet, with a little bit of straw and barnyard funk in the back. 

Up front, light toasted grains roll into sweet cherries. Gradually the flavor turns sour. It never becomes too acidic, and the sour is more tannic and dry as opposed to vinegary. The finish is somewhat sour but fairly clean.

For a lambic, the carbonation and body feel to be right in the middle of the spectrum. Moderately sour, slightly dry. This does not really cause salivation or puckering.

This is my second time having this vintage, and although I really appreciate the quality of the beer, the lack of intense funkiness or puckering sour keeps me from loving it. I was definitely in the minority of people who did not enjoy this as the favorite of the day.
Bottle. Pours deep red with pink head. Aroma of cherries, lemon, oak and funk. Flavor is sweet and sour with some funk, cherries, wood, citrus and tartness. Medium body, average carbonation.

Bottle @ Too many Geuzes - only one toilet , Ulfborg 2012 - Day 1. 2008 Vintage. Nice red color with a lovely pinkish head. Aroma of fresh cherries, almond, marzipan, a bit of wood. The flavour is a moderate sour at first , then leaves a nice sweet cherry note, with soem unsweetened marzipan in the end. not as tart as I remember the plain Kriek. The cherry aftertaste last for long. Best kriek I had so far..

Bottle, pours murky unclear red, but I got some sediment too. Aroma:  loads of woodyness, oak, vanilla, very clean tart cherry aroma, fruity sweetness,, dusty notes,  acidic notes, brett,  lovely aroma. Taste is fruity sweet with heaps of cherries and oak and vanilla, the acidity is there as well but very subtle, not as sour or acidic as cantilons can be.  Some deep almost meaty flavours. You get the funk, dusty notes, Brett and its very complex but also really smooth, clean and balanced. Beautiful
This is the beer that should be the first in the standings! We say to the family Cantillon thanks for the existence of these treasures!

This version of Lou Pepe Kriek is from 2006.  It pours a very dark red color.  A light white head forms but quickly fizzes away to what you see in the picture.  When I took my first smell I was very put off.  Its hard to explain but the beer smelled, well rotten.  Like rotten eggs and cabbage.  Ok maybe not that bad but I think you get the picture.  But as I let it sit for a while the real goodness came out.  The sourness stings the nose, beautiful hints of wood, cherries, vinegar.  I fell in love with the aroma. 

 Now from how sour the nose was,  I thought I would get blasted in the taste, but it wasnt like that.  Ive heard some Cantillon brews are just extremely sour and I cant wait to try some but this one was more of a nice balanced sourness mixed in with the oak, cherries, and barnyard funk.  Dont get me wrong here, its definitely a little puckering.  But not over the top. It also has a nice sugary sweetness that lingers on the taste buds.  A masterpiece in my books.  Its complex but highly drinkable. 

Mouthfeel is nicely carbonated.  Slick and medium bodied.  The sourness lingers for a while after youre done.

Aroma:kirsebær mandler  Ud.:rød uklar Skum:rød   E.smag:sød moderat sur moderat Krop:medium For.:vandede Brus:blød  
27/1-12 @f1
Bottle, vintage 2006, courtesy of Nino of Sherwood. Pours a dark cloudy orange. Smells of balsamic, with some metallic oxidation, and basement funk. Tastes of sour cherries and grapes. Very nice.

Pours cherry red colour with profuse head that dissapears later. Fermented cherries and grapefruit in the aroma. Sweet and sour taste with the fermented notes present. Full body, thin feel, soft carbonation and medium sweetness and medium sourness in the after taste. Not my kind of beer but worth the try.
2007 bottle opened in 2012. Surprising amount of head when first poured from the bottle, but it settled quickly. Very complex but distinctive sour cherry lambic.

Bottle, courtesy GT2, thanks man! Pour is bright pink/red with a off-white/pink head, impressive retention/lace. Aroma of cherry, raspberry, funk, barrel. Taste is fruity, cherry, horseblanket, light oak. Plesantly tart and light. Palate is soft, tart, high carbonation, funky/mineral finish. Very nice.
[Rated 06/03/2010] Vintage 2000. Bottle. Pours dark red-brownish with foamy head. Aroma is light with cherries and carrots(?). Flavor is fruity -- cherry and sour apple. Good stuff.

[place holder rating- notes backlog] A vibrant, spritzy, glowing pour with incredible pink head formation. Juicy cherry and raspberry all over. Perfect lactic palate. So soft and one of the first beers I ever had that brought a new dimension of what could be accomplished with wild yeast. Now an all time favorite and certainly a world classic.

2006 vintage, 750ml bottle, into Darkness tulip.

A - Pours a dark purple, looks like Barneys blood, with a light purple head that doesnt stick around long at all. Theres pretty much zero head and no retention to speak of, along with no lacing, just a dark purple liquid.

S - Lots of fruit notes, some sweet, some sour. Cherries, grapes, raspberries, oak. Overall, cherries, lots an lots of sweet and sour cherries. 

T - Really strong tart and funk notes right off the bat. Cherries, oak, sour grapes. Pretty straight forward here...I dont mind that at all. Horse blanket, funk, funk and funk.

M - Light bodied, almost zero carbonation (which is a disappointment), dry finish.

D - If youre in the mood for a wild and want a bunch of cherry notes, this is your beer. Very good, will purchase again.

750 ml. bottle @ home  purchased at the brewery bottled on 01/09/2011  finally accomplished my dream of trying at least 20 different Cantillons: pours a bright pomegranate into my Cantillon snifter with a non-lasting pink head  smell is pure kriek, utterly delicious, small hint of mustiness, the sourness in there is not the lambic kind but the same one as the fruit itself has  taste is extremely fruity, pure concentrated kriek, fruity goodness, the sourness is once again the same as the one that can be found in the smell, not originating from the lambic but similar to the fruit itself, slight touch of lemon zest & acidity underneath, barnyard funkiness, tartness from the actual fruit, very fresh, body is light & well-carbonated, extremely drinkable pure fruity goodness

Bottle at November tasting. Pours a red pink with small pink white head. Jam and cherry aroma. Thin mouthfeel with a  sweet tart  and light sour flavor. Easy to drink so refreshing. Wow this was an amazing Lambic from Cantillion.

2008 Lou Pepe - Kriek served on-tap at Maxs Taphouse during their "Rare and Obscure" event.
A - Pours murky red, bordering on pink, with a small film of pinkish tinted head leaving spotty lacing down the glass.
S - Smells of tart cherries, horse blanket funk, light vinegar, and a good bit of sourness. This is one nice nose, lots of things going on but not to the point of going overboard.
T - This was a bit of a letdown after that nose. The tart cherries this beer is known for where there initially but they are quickly swallowed by the overwhelming sourness. Some dry wood and light sweetness creep in toward the end but they fade quickly. The finish is more sourness, lingering for some time.
M - Medium body and flavor with moderate carbonation. Very tart feel with plenty of sourness lingering throughout the finish.
O - Overall this beer is very good. I have had it multiple times out of the bottle and it has always impressed me. I would have liked a bit more out of the taste department but these things can be a bit hit or miss. Glad I have a few bottles of this stuff in the cellar.

Kriek 2009 - Pours light red color with bit of a head. Has a pretty good taste of the kriek berries, but misses the real berry taste like de Cam or 3F. Couldve been more sour for me. An average-good kriek.

Bottle looks simple but good. Beer in the glass red, small head. Sourish aroma, a bit moldy. Starts intense fruity like cherries, also intense sourish, modest dry. Finish less fruity, yeasty-sourish. Moldy aftertaste. Good!

Draught at Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen, May 2011. 

Big tart aroma of cherries and other berries. Sour, rich and full with big sourish notes. Some funk but mostly just heavy with cherries. The taste is just as rich as the aroma with a big flavours of cherries and some tart lemon zest. A light sweetness and some barnyard funk towards the end.

Really nice beer here but didnt blow me away.  Aroma is rich cherry and notes of vanilla and vinegar.  Taste was at first very acidic and vinegary but as it warmed some more delicate flavors came through and it was actually quite good.

UPDATED: DEC 18, 2011 1,000 beer review, 2008, 750 ml bomber. Initially i was slightly underwhelmed. Pours bright red. Aroma is funk, tart, vinegar, cherries. Flavor starts tart, then vinegar then nothing. After 10 min or so it warms a little and wood, vanilla, and cherries comes through. The vinegar takes a back seat. Much better.
75cl bottle. Dark red with a pink head. Smells and taste fruity and sour with a similar finish, maybe abit rasberry.

Enb botella,2009
Color rojizo oscuro,turbia.Aromas a cerezas,como es de esperar.
En boca es seca,agria,con final de cereza.Muy Buena kriek.

0.75l bottle shared with ClubGonzo @ Olympen, Oslo. Ahh, another in the Lou Pepe-series, and this time the Kriek. This one pours a hazy deep red body with a quickly disappearing pinkish head. The aroma is fruity, sour and filled with cherries, sour red currants and hint of almonds. Lovely! Lively carbonation, and it has a fantastic slick to sticky mouthfeel. Lovely sour cherries in the flavor. Never on the break of being to sour, just lovely lemony-sour, it has hints of other berries as well; strawberries to be exact and it ends with a lingering way light sour aftertaste. Really good stuff.

2007 vintage bottle thanks to ksurkin for the sample.  Pours a deep red body with a light red on the outside of the glass.  It smells like sour cherries all the way.  You can tell it is going to be a puckering beer as soon as you smell it.  The taste follows the nose as expected and is balanced by just a touch of sweetness to keep this from being an all out assault on your palate.  I wish I could have this beer everyday whenever I wanted.  My oh my what a wonderful beer.

From the bottle. Poured a perfect blood-red ruby color, with no head after a minute or so. Cherries, cherries, cherries. Also get some floral notes. Wonderful effect on the palate, causing puckering and mouth-watering but finishing dry. So well balanced.

75cl bottle. Vintage 2005. Pours a cloudy dark ruby colour with a nice pinkish head. Woderfully complex aroma: lots of cherries, hay, flowers. Lightly sweet, moderately acidic flavor, becomes moderately sour. Taste is really complex and fruity, but not sweet at all. Really sour, but still balanced thanks to the huge amount of cherry presence. I think I found in this beer, in this vintage, the perfect balancing between fruit presence and classic lambic characteristics. Acidic, pretty dry finish. Medium body, lively carbonation. World class, awsome.

Bottiglia comprata su ilbeershop.it e gentilmente offerta da Gian e Giulia..abbinata con un ottimo piatto di gamberi, matrimonio damore. La bevanda è morbida e meno spigolosa come tutte le Lou Pepè, ma non eccelsa come la framboise. Rimane comunque una prelibatezza

750ml bottle bought at Brewery Creek in Vancouver. Pours a murky pinkish red with thin pink head that disappears quickly. Aroma is tart cherry, woody sourness and a hint of sweetness. Taste is puckeringly sour, slightly woody, fully cherry and pith. Very alive on the tongue. Finish is a nice, long sour note. Quite delicious for the style.

On tap at zwanze day at wlv Chicago. P is brilliant hazy rose w minimal white head. Nose is rich tart cherries . Taste is awesome cherry pie w cinnamonn and  some Apple. Tart but balanced and delicious!

Bottle split with mcberko. Pours a cloudy bright red with a small pale pink head. Aroma of soured cherries, marzipan, and lots of funk. Same qualities in the flavour but with some oak in there too. Well balanced sourness, not too overpowering. Light carbonation with a dry finish. Smooth mouth feel with light bitterness. Really nice for this style.
Bottle at the brewery, the taste is very nice in cherrys. minimal sweetness. the taste of fruit is very mild and it is quite nice. Very good drink
Reviewing the 2008 vintage on draft. Aroma was like cherry pie, very inviting. The taste was very well balanced, a perfect mix of sweetness and tartness. An amazing beer!

08 provided by Dstructo. Ruby red color with an off red head. Aroma is just heavenly, hints of raspberries cobbler and vanilla. Flavor is absolutely delicious, tart and sour with vanilla hints. Incredible!!

(Old notes. Draught at Akkurat 17/3.11, vintage 2008). Hazy dark blood red with a short pink head that disappears in an instant without leaving any trace.
Sour tart aroma with cherries, some ripe apples and horseblanket.
Taste is sour and dry with sour cherries but I also come to think of young raspberries and green apples. Woody dry ending.
Very tart and mouthdrying with very little carbonation that just slightly prickles the tongue.
Straight on and tasty sour.

UPDATED: MAY 30, 2014 750mL bottle, pours an opaque ruby red / pink with a small ring of pink head. Aroma of sour cherries, oak barrels, slight sweetness and slight funk - not overpowering on the nose, though very pleasant. Flavour initially brings out sweet cherries, which very quickly shifts to sour cherries, with more of the oak barrels coming through. Lots of funk on the finish. Very enjoyable - definitely one of the best kriek lambics Ive tried so far. Phenomenal stuff.
08 vintage bottle thanks to Destructo.  Ruby red pour with a pinkish head.  Raspberry, vanilla, and oak aromas.  Tart cherry, sour raspberry, semi-acidic with  light funk, and oaky notes.

2005 VIntage @ Rich Os Publick House, New Albany, Indiana. Aroma of tart cherry, oak and tootsie roll chocolate. Appearance was blood red with off pink head that remained at the top of the pour. Flavor is a crescendo of cherry tartness with oak and chocolate undercurrents; nice, puckering acidity that never goes too far- and not a hint of oxidation. Palate was very bubbly. A great pleasure to drink.
750mL corked bottle.  Vintage 2007.  Poured cloudy deep red with pink head falling to fine thin lace.  Aroma of cherries and yeast.  Tastes tart cherries.  Body medium.  Effervescent carbonation.

UPDATED: OCT 12, 2013 Draught @ Pikkulintu, Helsinki. Originally rated on 23.8.2010. Excellent and well balanced, tasty kriek.8-4-9-4-16 4.1

Re-rated on 12.10.2013, 750ml bottle (Vintage 2002!) @ Pikkulintu. Much more sour and complex, but still an extremely well balanced and earthy lambic with loads of cherries and sourness. Has aged really well, simply an awesome beer for sourheads.

UPDATED: SEP 17, 2011 Shared by the Michigan crew, cant remember the vintage but mid 2000s. Poured a hazy amber red with a thin grayish head that started at the edges and dissipated completely. Aroma was full of intense sour cherry with a good amount of acid backed by some nice funk. Flavor was similar with a start of sour cherries that grew in acidity that was slightly cut by the funk note that grew.

On tap at Stone Sour Fest 2011.  Pours a deep red with a pink head.  The aroma is very minimal cherry compared to the standard Kriek.  Light hops come through in the taste with again, very faint cherry.  The sour is not overly pronounced.  Overall, underwhelming but still a nice medium sour.
user_location: Morro Bay via Orange County, California, USA

text: The aroma is tart cherry, vinegar. The appearance is an opaque red, off white head. The flavor is tart cherries vinegar. The finish is sour, acidic, cherry.   Medium in body. Very good. Good balance between fruit and sour.

Vintage 2006 Stone Sour Fest 2011
Appearance: Pours a bright salmon pink with no head. The body is rather cloudy.

Aroma: Big tropical fruit, sour cherry, watermelon rind and funk.

Taste: Watermelon, tart lemon, sour cherry and tannins.

Mouthfeel: Puckering, full bodied, low carbonation.

Overall: Amazing.

Draught at Maxs Rare and Obscure.  This beer pours a vibrant red color with a small amount of pink head.  The aroma is like being in a cherry bowl, but not in a bad way.  The taste is cherry up front, but nice sourness to make it work well.  Not overly sweet, very well done to get the cherry flavor in there without being to sweet or too tart.  A very nice classic Lambic.
My number one beer at the Stone Sourfest 11. Smelled and tasted like a spiced cherry pie. All that was missing was the crust. Pours a blood red and has a lovely sparkle to go with the sour.

Draught at Mikkeler Bar, 2011-05-24 (something)
AR: almonds,kriek
AR: N/A
F: tart kriek, mmm

Bouteille de 750 ml, édition 2008. Arômes très invitants de cerises sûres, de chêne et de levures sauvages. Magnifique robe rouge foncée, très légèrement trouble, belle petite mousse et effervescence moyenne. En bouche, les cerises sûres et leurs noyaux sont omniprésents (beaucoup plus que dans le kriek régulier). Le lambic est relativement délicat pour une Cantillon et apporte de belles touches rustiques et citronnées. Longue finale sèche, moyennement lactique et citrique. Une bière très rafraîchissante et complexe !

200ml on tap at Mikkeller Bar. Deep, dark-red body. A few bubbles at the top. Mid-sour berries to the nose. Refreshing taste of tart fruits and sweet-sour berries. Palate cleansing (Copenhagen, 26.05.2011).

Bottle/750ml - Shared at the Three Penny Taproom - Pours a ruby red in color with a small head and very little carbonation.  Aroma is slightly sour and *very* strong of the cherries.  Flavor is also strong of cherries and some citrus.  Sourness is not overwhelming and adds to the overall experience. Outstanding!
Shared bottle @Kaisla, Helsinki. Poured ruby red with a thin head. Aroma is sour berries and cherries. Flavour very similar, with lingonberry more towards finish. Nice lambic, well balanced.

UPDATED: JUL 11, 2014 Shared bottle at Kaisla, Helsinki. Poured dark red in colour with a pink head. Sour and light fruity with red lingon berries in aroma. Pretty sour lingonberries in taste.

Re-rate
Draught. Unclear dark red with a small head. Cherries, marzipan and notes of sour red forrest berries in aroma. Some tartness in taste, sour berries and cherries too. Sweetness is present as well. Part sweet cherries and sour lingonberries in aftertaste. Nice one.

UPDATED: JAN 19, 2015 Pours ruby red with a pink head. Aroma of sweet cherries, vinegar, tartness, wild yeastyness and funky freshness. Taste of nice fresh berries and cherries, tartness, oaky notes and sweet cherries. Had this again @ dangerous bottleshare 5.0. This was the recent batch (2013 sticker). Wow this amazed me! Lots of fresh cherries, moldy oaky notes, marzipan, funky barnyard and vinegar - Right on! The taste was cherry forward with a nice funky background as well. The sweeter oaky and marzipan notes are there as well. Also some vinegar and fruity freshness all over the place! Really a stunner here!

Bottle at the Cantillon Brewery. It pours deep ruby-red, with a thick fizzy pink head and high carbonation. The nose is juicy, rich cherry, grapefruit, kiwi, cocoa powder and red apple. The taste is red grapefruit, lemon sherbet, red grape, some metal, wine-like, tart and ripe cherry. There is a really good balance of both juicy sweet fruit and tartness. A premium kriek offering from Cantillon.
tap at Rattle n hum - pretty delicious, though I think I liked the framboise version better. Lots of tart cherries, lactic acid and a funky note that sticks on the tongue. Delicious.

2004 Säuerlicher, sich noch steigernder Antrunk mit eingreifenden, eher aber zurückhaltenden Kirschnoten. Die Säure ist auch weiter vorherrschend und befindet sich in einem Status kurz vor der Penetranz. Dabei kommen die Kirscharomen zwar zum Vorschein, klebenm aber weiter an der Säure und begeben sich eher wenig in den Vordergrund. Konzentriert sauer, das Bier könnte noch etwas ausgewogener sein. Insgesamt aber ein ziemliches gutes Kriek mit fast aggressiver Säure. 12/12/11/12/13/12
At rattle n hum during beers gone wild. Sugary raspberry taste, has a nice graham finish.

At a tasting, many thanks Lee, pours an amazing chardonnay color with a huge pinkish head, aroma of toffee, wood, vanilla, woodruff, honey, brett and some shit, flavor is citric with sour cherries juice, sprouts, cheesy sourness, wood and some hops, full bodied, outstanding.

Pours a brilliant red.  Smells of sour cherries, lots of them, and lactic tartness.  A great tasting and smelling beer, but it is tart as a mother and will burn quite a bit in the belly.  Still pretty awesome.

2007 vintage. Bottle shared by STLWill. Thanks a lot! Pours deep red with a pinkish head. Aroma is tart cherries with hints of farmhouse and funk. Flavor is tart cherries with hints of wood with a pretty dry finish. Overall a really good lambic.

UPDATED: NOV 23, 2011 750 ml bottle, 2007 vintage, shared by STLWill at Dark Lord Day 2011- thanks again, Will! Pours a bright, deep, ruby-red color with a pink-tinted finger-thick head. Nice balance of tart and sweet cherries in the aroma, lactic acid, oak, and lemon juice. Flavor follows suit pretty much, with some underlying earthy, oaky notes. Medium-bodied, with a tart, sweet, juicy mouthfeel and medium carbonation. Awesome lambic. Re-Rate, 11/22/11: 2008 bottle. Very subtle. Drier, not as tart as I remembered at all. Not nearly as sour as the 3F Schaerbeekse Kriek we opened next to it, or any other lambics we had last night. Still, for a subtle, smoother lambic, this is great.

DLD 11, 2007 bottle big thanks to STLWill! Beautiful deep red pour with pink head, looks like cherries in a glass.  Aroma has notes of cherries, vanilla, more cherries, the actual stem and leaves of the cherry plant, with big acetic funk, tart lemon and apple.  Taste is cherry plant in a glass, with the stem, fruit, skin, and leaves all playing a part, with a big sour funky presence, that finishes dry and oaky.  Wow.  Fantastic brew.

UPDATED: MAY 24, 2011 750ml bottle, 2007. Pours a hazy ruby red with a generous redish head. Great cherry tart aroma with some farmhouse and funk, along with yeast. Great sour and tart taste, get the cherries throughout, starts to dry out the palate, some wood. Well carbonated, fairly smooth but not balanced - need to like a very sour and tart beer to enjoy...and I do! Re-rate of a 2005 bottle - 6 years old - has gotten better with age, cherries have strangely become more prominent although funky black cherries now. Great beer - 7 - 4 - 9 - 5 - 18.

UPDATED: APR 4, 2013 On tap at Fountainhead. A slightly hazy cherry red pour with a dense pink head. Aroma is sour cherries and more cherries, with a little bit of funk in there. Very sour to begin with which slowly turns to a sweet cherry finish. Quite tarty. Pretty good overrall

Rating Lou Pepe bottled 2005, enjoyed April 2011.
Pure ruby colour, slight haze, light pink small head, fine tiny bubbles.
Beautiful aroma of cherries, earth, slightly sour with molasse sweetness.
Flavour of summer fruits, slight tartness (less than the regular cantillon kriek), some lingering sweetness, oak, dry astringent finish with loads of cherry notes. Low on carbonation. Fine(!) kriek
(from 75cL -champagne- bottle)

Bottle, generously shared by Sammy. Sampled with many others. Slightly hazed cherry red with a foamy pink head. Very enticing aroma of sour cherry, funk, wood, yeast. Mouth watering. Extremely tart with sour cherry and strawberry, highly acidic, with yeasty funk and woody notes. Palate cleansing, refreshing, medium body with mouth puckering finish. Excellent tart cherry aftertaste. Great beer, thanks Sam!

Lou Pepe Kriek on kirsikanpunainen ja todella kaunis olut. Sen vaahtokin on vaaleanpunainen ja vain lisää osaltaan oluen kauneuteen. Tuoksultaan Pepe on hapan, hiivainen ja mausteisen kirsikkainen. Maussa on mansikkaa, kirsikkaa ja happamuutta. Samettinen olut.

10/04/2011 75cl bottle @ parents home  - 2008 version (2011-140) 
Little cloudy bright ruby red coloured beer. Small pink head, little stable and adhesive. Aroma: lots of bretta, just a hint of fruity candy, sweet forest fruits. MF: soft carbon, light to medium body, bit watery texture. Taste: lemony sour, geuze, then fruity, little candy-like flavour, sour cherries and sour raspberries. Aftertaste: more sour notes, bit of basement. Leaves the cheeks prickling afterwards.

UPDATED: JAN 28, 2012 Bottle year 2003 courtesy Chrisv10. Nice head with good duration. Color is red amber. Aroma and taste are rich cherries, sour lactose acid, yeast and malt. Rerated @ fonefan tasting bottle from 2008. Not as good as after it has matured as long as the 2003 one. New rating. 10/4/9/4/18

75cL bottle from brewery in Brussels. Year 2008 bottled 02.010 (08 September 2010). Pours a ruby color with a red-tinted head that disappears quickly. Aroma is very sour with a slightly musty/old attic smell. The carbonation makes the body feel a bit fizzy, but very finely so. Flavor is a very intense fruitiness up-front with a sour background. The stage of intensity shifts around between the cherry fruit, yeast, and sour tones as different layers of each flavor emerge. Finishes on a dry and sour note. Excellent and very clean.

Ill have to check but I believe it was a 2007 bottle. Beer is red and forms a pink head of medium bubbles. No lacing really, carbonation is high and made of small bubbles that rise through the beer quickly.

Aroma is wonderful. Not as much cherry as the 100% but still pretty good. Classic Cantillon sour aroma with great lactic and slight acetic notes.

Taste is surprisingly smooth with only subtle cherry flavors. I tried this immediately after the 100% Kriek and if I were to do it again I would reverse the order. The tartness is nice and the lactic character highlights a nice cherry flavor. I wanted it to be stronger overall but this was amazing. I cant wait to try my 2005. Yum.

___

Ive had this again and my reviews were way way too low for this beer. This is probably one of the best sours out there, hands down.

Serving type: bottle

This lambic pours a dark blood red, reminds me of sangria. There is tons of carbonation, a 4 finger dark pink head rises quickly with surprsing retention. The lacing is pretty light.
The aroma is sour cherries. It is not overly funky or have the typical barnyard funk. The sour is more in the form a naturally tart fruit as opposed to mold. Its a little disappointing in his regard. 

The taste is dead from start to finish. As you start to swallow you finally get some sourness hit you but its much to late and not balanced at all with any amount of sweetness from the cherries. At the very very end after you swallow you get a little sweet cherry.

The feel is on the lighter side, but it does have quite a dry finish that makes you pucker.

The drinkability is high for a lambic because there is no funk that puts you off.

(Draught at Akkurat, Stockholm. Vintage 2008) Deep red colour with brief, pink head. Fruity, tart nose with cherries and almond. Aromas with fresh sourness and a deep, clean fruit character. Fruity, tart taste with notes of ripe cherries and bitter almonds. A harsh, dry acidity in a finish with a clean and fresh sourness. Medium body, dry and tart. Slightly sharp carbonation makes it a bit prickly on the tongue. Fresh, clean and excellently balanced. Lovely beer.

Au fût @ Moeder Lambic, anno 2007.
De couleur rouge flamme allant sur un bordeaux, opaque avec une épaisse mousse rosée.
Arôme de cerise qui est évident toujours en ayant ce côté de lambic laissant au nez une fine aigreur fruitée. On ressent là dans ces cerises tout un patrimoine local qui est évidemment dur à retranscrire.
En bouche, je note doffice la complexité de la bière mais aussi de ces cerises qui jouent la un rôle sublime. Alliant à la fois douceur et aigreur ainsi que des saveurs du verger qui se heurtent à ce côté boisé du tonneau. On ressent en bouche cet aspect bucolique et artisanal dont seul Cantillon arrive à produire les meilleures lambics.
Une lambic qui met là la cerise dans toute sa splendeur.
bottle shared by Marcus. Pours a cherry red with a fizzy light white head. Aroma is of  spoiled cherrys. Has a distinct cherry tart flavor with a perfect sour finish.
UPDATED: APR 7, 2011 Bottle from 2003. Deep red/ruby with medium pink head. Flavour is sour, tart, fruit, cherries, little sweet and funk.

UPDATED: FEB 10, 2011 2007 edition bottle from Beer Planet, Brussels. Been looking forward to this one for a long time; its been kept out of my reach by a friend since we came back from Belgium last summer, but now its time to have a blast from the past. :-) Pours a deep cherry red, clear pink-ish body with a moderate cloudy light pink head. Aroma is pungent, deep and very complex: sour cherries, coconut, hay, brett tones, hints of wood, grapes and tart, dense port wine. And I still feel I cant really get my nose around it all. Taste is no more complicated to sum up; tart, bretted-up cherries and bits of citric-like, woody grape tones. Some coconut getting in mid-palate again. Hay and basement tones in the aftertaste. I struggle to describe this, as it is subtle and assertive at the same time. A very good kriek, well-deserving of its high rating.

Bottle. Pours a brilliant deep burgandy with a very lively light pink head. Head falls away super quickly leaving just a hint of lacing. Huge aromas of sour cherry and almond from the stones. Some earthiness mustiness also comes through. Brilliant stuff. Flavours are dominated by lemony mouth puckering sourness. Lively mouthfeel. Brilliant beer,

Bottle 750ml 2007, thanx to Reza at 3smårum. Pours hazy dark red with a large pink head that reduces quickly, beautiful. Aroma of acid, cherry and oak. Dry, medium acid and cherry in the taste that lingers. This is perfect balance in its purest form! Amazing!
2004 bottle shated by weeheavy.  Wow nice sour  aroma. Not a ton of fresh fruit but balenced smoorh throughout. Perfect.
Pours a stunning hazy dark red with a tight pink head. Aromas of tart cherries, backyard and some grass. The sourness and fruit play well together. The carbonation is lively. Wonderful beer.
Deep murky red with no lasting head. Sour cherries and almonds on the nose. Very nice cherry sourness. Slight funk and zero sweetness. Absolutely great kriek.

UPDATED: FEB 20, 2015 (75 cl, brassin 2008, mis en bouteille le 14 septembre 2010.  Bouteille partagée avec ma belle Bruxelloise)  Le liquide a une robe rouge flamboyante qui présente une belle opacité.  La mousse se dissipe instantanément.  À lil, les bulles sont vitaminées et terminent leur course dans un certain bouillonnement.  Au nez, les arômes de la levure sauvage sont transpercés par des effluves de petites cerises surettes.  Les cerises se manifestent sous une forme vinaigrée et, en réchauffant, permettent des vapeurs légèrement sucrées.  Des notes boisées finissent par se manifester.  Le goût est tout aussi intéressant avec des notes franches de levure sauvageonne et avec des bons fruits surets chargés de bonnes saveurs acides et de sucre naturel.  Tout simplement magnifique.  En bouche, le liquide a un corps moyen-léger avec une effervescence increvable et une texture mince somme toute efficace.  La finale est superbe sur des notes surettes et fruitées.  Classique, solide, nimporte quand.

Dans cette bouteille de 750ml ce cache derrière la capsule de métal et le bouche de liège une belle bière rouge avec une mousse rose très bruyante. Les levures sauvages traversent le nez  et il semble y avoir quelque notes de cerises. En bouche cette bière est acide à souhait, un petit brulement destomac avec ça, le coté sauvage est très présent et bien dosé et surtout bien équilibré. Les cerises ajoutent un petit quelque chose de très rafraichissant et le finale est longue,aromatique et bien mordante. Millésime 2008 embouteillée en septembre 2010. 9/10
red coloured body with a little pink head a fruity (cherry) sour aroma a sour fruity ( cherry) bitter taste with a sour bitter finish

750 ml shared at Dereks Tasting. Awesome. Pours a nice murky ruby reddish rust hazed hue, small offwhite head rings, laces small. Aromas are tart cherries, rich tannins, wet oak and lactic acid, a touch of vinegar, and rich red fruit. Some hay, straw, decent bretty funk. Big sourness, tart and sour cherries, touches of vinegar, lactic acid, a touch of lively carbonation. Light funk, lingering sour acidity. Light funk, big red fruit sweetness gives a touch. Rich sour and tannins, big fruit and sourness. Very nice, balanced in a sourheads eyes. Sour cherries, touches of vinegar and big tannins, decent funk, acidic. Very nice. More funk in the nose

Pours a beautiful sparkling pink with a snow white head. Very sour and tart. Taste of lemon and yeast. Lightly sweet, but heavy on the sour. Very lively on the palate with a crisp finish. A bit too bitter in the finish like they left the cherry pits in too long... Overall very crisp and pleasing.
Caution to decant it carefully when you pour the yeast is best left in the bottle for most casual lambic drinkers as the flavor of the concentrated yeast can be overpowering to some.
26th January 2008  Dry pucker inducing lambic. The cherry is mostly only evident in the colour. Lemony and tart. Ouch.

Bottle, shared with Geoff, and a little with Parksy (not his favourite style). Pours a gorgeous bright ruby pink with an exuberant light pink bubbly parfait-like head. Aroma is full on sour cherries, with that nice black-cherry skin note that conveys a sense of succulent real fruit, also some vinegar and mustiness in the background. Flavours of sour cherry fruit, heaps of lactic acidity, nuances of vinegar, funk, new wood. Exceedingly dry, sour-tart finish. Absolutely awesome, and perfectly fitting for my 3500th rating!
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Dark red, whispy head, head appears with swirl. Rotten cherry mustiness up front, oak, lots of tannins, light cork. Flavor has a nice mouth puckering sourness, oak/tannic character in the finish. Spritzy carbonation, falls apart a little.

Clear red coloured beer with small reddish/pink head and medium carbonation. Soft sour cherry aroma. Full sour sparkling palate. Finish is sour with nice cherry dry ending. Nice balanced flavours. Good one. (@WE)

2007 Bottle .  Pours a deep red and hazy color, with almost no head.  Aromas of strong fruits and griottes.  Flavors of strong sour fruits, griottes, cherries, hints of wood and oak, vanilla, yeast.  Long lasting flavors in mouth, very dry and sour.  Very drinkable, packed with wonderful flavors, very pleasent to drink.  Bravo Cantillon.

Red pink beer small head. Cherish light spiced smell sour sweet,ok. Taste is sour fruits not my thing. Maybe the bottle was not good, but Im not a fruitbeer lover at all... some people will maybe hate me for this score, sorry.

A-pours a very dark pink almost blood red with pink edges and a ton of active loud light pink head.

S-great barnyard funk to this, strong nose of earthy funk and a touch of mushroom.  The cherries lie behind the funk accentuating the nose, lightly sour with a touch of acidity.  very solid nose but the cherries seem slightly overshadowed.

T-cantillon does such a good job with a very focused funk that plays so well into the beer and adds such a nice balance to it.  the cherries are ripe and juicy, the sour is light and pleasant with an ever so light touch of lemony acidity in the finish. well integrated bright flavors that truly show complexity and balance with a level of subtlty that shows a truly solid beer.

M-full bodied and very creamy with a lively carbonation and prickly feel to it.  quite dry in the finish with a light lingering tart bitterness.

D-this is another great cantillon beer that has a very concise funk that is centered and balanced.  the fruits are so fresh a delicious and the sourness is assertive but not biting.

2007 Bottle thanks to Savvy1982. Pours deep ruby with a large foamy pinkish/red head. Aroma of pure goodness- cherries and a fair amount of lactic sourness. Taste is of fresh cherry juice, sweet and tart. There is some earthy herbal flavor present as well and a dry finish. Body is light with lots of fine carbonation. Overall this is a great beer, not as much mouth puckering acidity as I expected, very nice.

05 bottle.  Deep red/purple in the glass with a thin layer of foam hugging the sides.  Faint but steady carbonation.  Tight and focused aroma with clean, dry cherry, light funk, and subtle underlying tart.  Taste is sharp cherry up front, underlying lemon tart in the middle, returning to sour cherry with a lingering sour/mild funk through the finish.  Intense dryness throughout.  Body is somewhat soft (perhaps due to the age).  Absolute pleasure to drink.

2001: 750 ml bottle poured into a flute.  Pours and deep and rich red color with pink frothy head and lively bubbles shooting up the glass.  Aroma of vinegar, sour cherries and wheat, very tart on the nose.  Taste is quite sour, with just a tad of sweetness to balance it, but ultimately not a lot of overall balance - much more sour than sweet.  Mouthfeel is crisp and quenching, with medium carbonation.  A challenging beer, takes a while and many sips to form an opinion of it, but thats cool, isnt it?

2007 Edition. Bottled 21 August 2009. Poured into a tulip.

A: Pours an absolutely beautiful rich, dark cherry color with a towering bright pink head that settles into a nice pink ring around the edges of the glass. Perhaps the most beautiful beer I have ever seen.

S: The initial nose is a lovely bright cherry aroma with a little bit of sweetness followed by a wonderful tartness. A little bit of acid in the nose, but it appears as if most of this character is coming from the cherries.

T: Tart cherries and a bit of a puckering feeling as a result. A nice, crisp acidity comes through, and it goes down really smoothly. Cherries are absolutely the dominant flavor without much else coming through. Perfect balance between the sweetness and tartness within the cherries, especially alongside the slight acidity that comes through as well.

M: Light to medium-bodied with just the right touch of carbonation. Very elegantly balanced.

D: Supremely drinkable. This is one I would love to quaff back all day long.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 02-17-2010

Bottle (2005 label). Pours a deep, darky cherry red that has ruby in it as well.  Hazy with a very light pink head.  Sour fruit and vinegar dominate the aroma, but not overwhelming and nicely tart, the fruit certainly suggests tart cherry, but only slightly.  Vingegar at first, and then rounds into a cherry sourness with some lacto.  Not a palate wrecker, but certainly puckeringly nice at first.  Medium body with more subdued carbonation.  Classic.

Pours deep red, big and nice looking light pink head. Aroma has gooseberries, cherries, læder, wet wood, vanilla, loads of barnyard and wild yeasts. Taste has massive tartness, wood, cherries, sour berries, yeast. The classic cantillon tartness is in its place. Couldve used a bit more fruit and perhaps more wood in the taste.

UPDATED: MAY 26, 2013 Bottle: 2007: Rose lemonade-a-like quick disappearing foamy head.
Cloudy deep dark sweet rose, beautiful colored, beer.
Smell wood, cherry, sour, malts and sweets.
Taste is a beautiful mix of sour, sweet, red fruit, cherry, raspberry, wood, citric, bread, cookie, barnyard.
Light hints of cherry sweets and malty wood and a dominating sour taste. Mild carbo. Awesome beer!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text:
Drank out of a wine glass with a friend. Red/burgundy color, big pink head that doesnt hang around for too long, and neither does lacing. A beautiful beer to look at. Some cherries on the nose, along with sour funk and bret smell. Tastes sharp, sour, and dry. A bit of cherries and a very tart finish. A very well done beer, but Im not sure if its my thing, it might be a little too sour, even four a sour beer. Very interesting and very well executed.

After drinking a bit more the sourness is more manageable to my palate. While very intense, this is one of the most elegantly executed sour beers Ive had.

Serving: 750 ml. bottle of the 2007 vintage from State Line Liquors. 
Aroma: The nos is funky with a good bit of barnyard and dark cherries.  Well balanced and not overpowering. 
Appearance: The color is dark violet-red with a foamy, pink head.
Taste: The flavor is tremendously balanced with a nice tartness, a good bit of barnyard notes, dark cherry skins, earth, and an amazingly clean finish.  The funk and the fruit achieve a perfect balance in my mind. 
Palate: Light to medium body with high carbonation leading to a short, tart then clean finish. 
Overall: I have to say, its my favorite lambic yet.  The balance in this brew is spectacular and makes it extremely drinkable.  A bit pricey at $40 a bottle, but I have to say this one was worth it.  Now if I could only afford to drink it more often!  Highly recommended.

UPDATED: MAY 3, 2012 750 ml bottle.  2009 Vintage.  Pours a clear dark pink with a light pink head that settles fairly quickly and leaves some light lacing on the glass.  This is definitely one of my favorite looking beers.  The aroma is huge cherry, pie crust, some hay, funkiness, and some lactic acid.  The cherry is phenomenal.  The taste has an initial light cherry sweetness and lots of of lactic twang.  There is also funkiness, hay, and pie crust.  Finish is fairly tart with lactic and tons of cherry.  Medium-full bodied.  Slightly creamy mouthfeel. Medium-low carbonation.  Just an amazing beer.  The amount of cherry is overwhelming.  This is definitely the best fruit lambic that I have had.
10.5.10.5.19


Updating rating for a draft at the Trappist.  2008 vintage.  Pours a darkish read with a two finger pink head with good retention that leaves a small amount of lacing on the glass.  Just beautiful.  Aroma is huge cherry.  Smells like a cherry pie.  Typical Cantillon funk, but just a background note as the cherries are front and center here.  The initial taste is sweet, juicy cherry.  Tart, but certainly not overly sour.  Perfect balance to the fruit.  A little bit of the barnyard funk, but again just a background note behind the fruit.  Nice tart finish.  Almost no astringency.  Medium body.  Medium carbonation.  I enjoyed this when I had a bottle, but on tap it is phenomenal.  Easily one of the best beers I have over had.  If this were available regularly I would be ecstatic, but my wallet probably would not.
9/5/10/4/19

750 ml bottle of 2007 vintage.  Pours  a darkish red with a big pink head leaving a small amount of lacing on the glass.  Possibly the most beautiful thing I have ever seen.  Aroma is cherries, barnyard funk, brett, and a bit of wheat.  Initial taste is tart cherry.  Very funky and very sour.  A little bit of wheat.  Brett on the finish.  Light body.  Medium carbonation.
9/5/8/4/17

2007 bottle, 750ml.  Pours a hazy, purple red with a thin pink head.  Looks really cool.  The funk is there right from the get go.  The funky nose can be experienced from a mile away.  The nose has plenty of raspberry, malts, light spice, strawberry patch, popsicle, cheese.  Flavor is tart, berry, band aid, medicinal, jam.  Finish is full bodied, tart with lactic acid.
Tasted 10/8/10. 750ml cork and cage. Clear with a reddish hue. Aromas of cherries and strawberries. Full bodied with a bitter and tangy palate. Great complexity between the sweet and tart. Solid!
n ganska snäll suröl med fin syrlighet, trevliga rödbärstoner  kunde kanske önskat att den var lite fräshare då den verkade en aning trött. Med helt klart en mycket stabil öl.

Bottle, vintage 2003.

Red with a small white head.

Very tart aroma and taste, still a lot of cherries. Really drinkable and dry. Not the best from Cantillon that I have drunk but still very good.

Bottle; Pours a ruby color, a little cloudy, nice pink frothy head with nice retention. Big barnyard aromas, cherry pits, a bit of funkiness, of course, yet a touch of sweetness comes out as well, very modestly. Just had the Cantillon Kriek in front of this one - This one seems a little more full bodied in comparison, flavors sightly more sophisticated, yet very similar, nonetheless. There are particulates in this brew as well - Tart lemon flavors mesh with cherry pits and strong sour. Funky yeasts, and a slight basement element rears its head here -  Finishes dry, of course.

2007 bottle. Beautiful deep red with a fine, low, thick pink head. Huge cherry and dust aroma, funk, citrus, lactic, almonds. Flavor of citrus, lactic cream, funk, with good cherry; also stones like almonds, creamy yogurt. Dry as a bone. Huge cherry flavor with minimal sweetness. Carbonation still very strong. Body is rich and full, even a bit prickly. Perfect sourness. Wonderful, amazing stuff. Probably my favorite lambic to date.

Bottle from 2005. The pour is deep red with a pink head that lays like a crown on this giant from Cantillon. It tends to fade a little but manage to hang on to the edges of the glass. The aroma is packed with fresh a sour cherries. There are some sweet and acidic notes along with it. The taste is great but not as sweet as espected from the aroma. Still the cherries dominate the picture, but here its the sour and bitterness from the cherries that takes of. The mouthfeel tends to be a bit watery and is on the light side of medium but leaves your mouth dry. The finish is long and sour - a sourness that tends to fade very slowly as the dryness sets in. I will keep bringing these Lou Pepe babys to my cellar - Cause damn they are soo good.

Pours a murky rose red with a brilliant pink head of two or three fingers.  This recedes quickly to leave a ring round the glass, and even this tiny ring is pink!  The nose doesnt hold the usual lambic funk, at least not to the extent of so many Cantillon beers.  There is, of course, a tartness, a certain scenery sense of fields and grass - no doubt due to the use of Brettanomyces.  Then come the aged cherries and wood, the notes of oregano and other herbs.  There too is a hint of cracked black pepper.  Rightfully its tart and acidic in the mouth.  The cherry flavours are rounded, ranging from freshly picked to old and dusty.  Its dry but smooth, with a thin body and a fine carbonation.  On the finish the cherries and wood combine for a lingering fruity taste.  Here finally a bitterness is found.  Its a deceptively simple beer - just wood and cherries - but what it does it does elegantly.

Tap @ Olutravintola Pikkulintu. 2006 version.
Pours a deep red colour with a minimal white head. Very rich aroma of sour cherries and oak. Heavy tart on the flavour with a fair amount of cherries and acidity. Medium bodied, dry mouthfeel and decent carbonation. This is probably the best Kriek out there.

cherry pink and a good head. nose is cherry must!!!!, a hint of lees and almost smoked to me. wow tart on the palate! big cherry notes. high acids. it has quite the acidic kick to it. Not sure I like it but I respect it.
definitely interesting just not my style.

750ml bottle. 2007 Vintage. Pours deep deep pink with a strawberry milkshake head that is good and thick. Nose of fresh cherries, serious barnyard funk and a solid sourness. Really very super sour cherry with a little barnyard kick near the finish. This being my first rated lambic Im not sure how to describe it well, but its fucking awesome.

Bottle, huge thanx to Ron Extract. Pours a beautiful deep cherry red with long lasting pink fizzy head. Aroma is full of barnyard and fresh cherry. Flavor is very much the same, is also dry, nice tartness, light acidic. Mouth feel is light body with fizzy carbonation. Overall, a very tasty, well made lambic.

UPDATED: AUG 29, 2010 2007 bottle thanks to ron extract.  poured a reddish color with a pinkish head that would not go away.  aroma and flavor both were a gorgeous blend of cherries, oak, tart, and some good old fashion funk.  body was light and well carbonated.  awesome stuff!!!

Beautiful red coloured beer with a fast diminishing pink head. Fresh sour cherry aroma. Flavour starts of acidic, then sour and much fresh cherries. Perfect dry finish. Best kriek ever! (Corked bottle 75cl, vintage 2007)

Tasted from bottle purchased at Discount Liquors, Vintage 2005.  Pours a cloudy but bright brick red color with an average rose head that recedes to lace.  Nose is sour and funky with just a hint of vinegar and lactic acid, some vanilla oak, and a very fresh cherry aroma that also has a hint of sweetness.  Most Krieks I have tried smell more like a Kirsch brandy, where the cherries here smell much more fresh.  The flavor starts off very sour and acidic, but quickly and seamlessly moves to the oak vanilla and very fresh cherries that throughout seem to give an illusion of sweetness, but I dont think that there is anything sweet to this beer at all.  The body is medium with almost sparkling carbonation and a long sour and fresh cherry finish.

75cl bottle at home vintage 2000. This was the first traditional lambic I tried. I hated it. Fortunately I bought a case and left it for a few years. The next time I tried it after a few training wheel lambics I loved it!!! So smooth and full of cherry especially for a 8 year old beer. Very bretty and cherry, spritzy carbonation. The beer that made me sure that I was converted to lambic.

Bottled in 2009.

Poured from a 750 ml bottle into a decanter.
Poured from the decanter into a tulip.
Poured from the tulip into my gaping maw.

Drinkability this high is a bad thing. I like beer I can drink slowly and savor. Lambics are a fine example as their acidity forces me to prolong my enjoyment. In this sense, most Cantillon products border on the Tantric.

But fresh LP Kriek is far and away the smoothest Cantillon Ive had. So fast was I guzzling it that I had barely enough time to observe its attributes.

I managed to catch a few of them as they flew by: cherries, oak, cherries, funk, and cherries. I can confirm that this was a kriek.
user_location: The Court of the Crimson King, California, USA

text: 2007. Pours blood red with a dark pink head that retreats to the rim. Sour cherry and vinegar aroma with wheaty laundry dank. Tart early, then gentle seeming-sweetness and intense, brooding barnyard flavours. The flavours and sensations seem to travel around the mouth from tongue tip to mouth roof to gums and finally lips. Its sharp but remarkably mouthfilling. The cherries give the illusion of sweetness and enhance the depth of the beer. Finish becomes woodier as you drink it. There are hints of the wildness and also the cruelty of nature in this. A little of the sediment crept into a second glass and mellowed things a little, but I was surprised how much more full-on this was relative to the Lou Pepe Gueuze I had.

2007 Bottle.  Aroma has notes of sour funky cherries, brett and oak.  Deep red hue with an average sized fizzy pink head that fully diminished and left no lace.  Flavor is sweet sour and tart.  Palate is medium bodied with a fizzy carbonation and astringent finish.  Overall a good Lambic.

Bottle 2003 vintage - Pours murky, rosy amber with a touch of a white head. Smells of deep, dark cherries--juice and pulp--with a nice malt backbone. The taste is the most realistic cherry taste Ive had in a beer, save for maybe NG Belgian Red--but its right there. Nice tart finish, but not as mouth puckering as the framboise version. Smooth and velvety, with good carbonation. Drank this next to the framboise, and this blew it away. Didnt have any of the rotting fruit funk that some seem to love but Im not a huge fan of. Wonderful stuff.

Bottle Vintage 2003. Pours out a dark pink topped with a small pink head. Aroma was awesome so much cherries, funk, tart, and some light spice. Taste was just the  same lots of cherries, good sweet and sour balance. This was the highlight of the night for me. I so want a couple more bottles.

2005 vintage. Sampled from a 750 ml corked green bottle this beer poured a dark red color with a trace pink head that faded quickly. The aroma was tart, vinegary and had a moderate cherry presence. The flavor was extremely tart  and very sour with a moderate dry cherry note and notes of vinegar, cider and Sweettart candies. The finish is amazingly long with tart and sour cherry. Light to medium body. Interesting.

2006 Vintage. Drank at home, july 19 2010. Deep purple-raspberry color with absolutely no head. Intense sour cherries aromas, cherry pits (almond-like) with a bit of acetic acid too. Sharp sour bite, light body, loads of sour cheries and a long sour-acetic finish. This is almost too intense on the acidic side, but really tastfull at the same time, and refreshing.
Bottle.Deep reddish colour with pinkish head.Aroma of cherries and marzipan nice and wonderful mouthfeels slight dry and some hint oak good flavor like champagne.

As close to a brut fruit beer/champagne as you can get. Poured with a pretty, cherry pink, fine foamy head and no lace. Color is an intense, clear, ruby red. Aroma is a tart, pie cherry, slightly earthy. Flavor is like nose, very crisp and pure. Body is full and has huge champagne carbonation. Finish is super clean and bright..Be a great summertime appertif.
Vintage from 2003. Aroma of funk and cheeries. Appearance is beutiful red. Taste is wonderful of tart, funk and cheeries. Very pleasent souernes. Overall a superb beer, one of the best ive had.

Pours a brilliant red with an electric pink head. The aroma is quite funky and bursting with oak, cherries and spices. The flavor is bright, tart and spicy. Cherries, cloves, cinnamon, oak, must basement on the palate. Very complex and extremely enjoyable.

2007 - bottled in 2009. Pours deep ruby into a tumbler. Bright pink micro head with excellent retention. Sweet marshmallow, sour cherry,  and funky bug juice aromas. Lively with sweet and sour cherry upfront turning more to the sour in the lasting oaked marshmallow finish.

UPDATED: JUL 28, 2013 2004 Vintage on Tap at Monks in early 2010.
A: Dark blood red. Nice one finger bubbly pinkish head. Quickly receded to a nice skim and collar. Spotty lacing left in the glass after each sip.
