2005 vintage.  Pours a beautiful red, more red than usual Kriek or I just could be forgetting that others are this red too but either way it looks gorgeously bright.  A fizzy pink head forms then quickly and audibly dissipates to the thinnest ring of bubbles.  Brettanomyces noticeable from several feet away.  When inhaling close to the glass I get very intense cherry aromas.  Full, round, juicy cherries, the most Ive experienced in a fruit lambic.  Brett is obvious underneath providing a nutty and lemony character.  The more this breathes and the warmer it becomes the funkiness increases with elements of horse and barnyard coming out.  Some intense leather characteristics are also noted.  So far this is the best lambic Ive ever smelled.  Just a huge cherry aroma blended perfectly with Lambic funk.  Taste is, wow, super acidic.  Very lemon like.  Tartness and sourness is actually not that high.  Its there, to be sure, but the acidity blends into an intense fruit flavor that is more like tart cherries than the sourness I associate with a good Geueze.  This is like eating straight cherry pie filling.  Much juicier and less dry than I was expecting.  A long, tart and sweet finish lingers on the tongue for many minutes.  This is certainly the best fruit flavor Ive experienced in a lambic.  The cherries really stand out on their own among all the funk and acidity.  This is just amazing.

01 Bottle:  Courtesy of pepsican...thanks Andy.  Cloudy, ruby red pour with no head.  The aroma is very intense, consisting of notes of vinegar, cherries and a subtle earthiness that I couldnt really put my finger on.  Very tart from the get-go...flavors of fine vinegar with exquisite cherry notes that finishes very dry and extremely tart.  Unbelievable stuff...the sourness of the brew doesnt at once detract from the wonderful flavors bounding about.  Damn near perfect.
A little bit cloudy cherry red colour. Lots of cherries in the nose. Suitable dryness. A very nice kriek.

UPDATED: JUN 10, 2008 2001 bottle from pepsican:  pours a beautiful crimson colour with a small whte head. good carbonation for a 7 year old beer. aroam is fantastic  great cherry aroma very tart adn quite sour. flavour is awsome the sour is again fantastic the cherries are all over the place and still taste fresh. the tart acid is there but not overpowering. the finish is extra dry adn awesome.
Bottle. Clear raspberry red colour with a medium pinkish creamy head. Tart raspberry aroma and taste. Long finish. Impressive beer.

Draught 2005 Vintage (Pikkulintu,Helsinki)- A rich red in colour with a pink head. Tart and acidic aroma with the beautiful cherry scent being rather prominent. Deliciously tart,tangy,acidic taste with the cherries giving it an extremely satisfying sweetness. Goes down a treat. Exceptional.

Bottle shared by theisti. Pours a raspberry red with a thin pinkish head. The aroma is a super tart cherry; dry as a bone with no detectable sweetness whatsoever. Medium-bodied and just as tart as the nose telegraphed. Finishes dry and puckering. Tart cherries and yeasty funk. This is uber-sour and satisfying. Its so tart, I think my head is caving in... Thanks a lot for sharing this with us, Tim.

750 ml purchased mail order from Liquor Max in Loveland, Colorado. This was the 2005.  Pour is strawberry red with a 1 inch pink head. Aroma of wild funky yeastiness and cherry fruitiness. Very sweet, tart and sour in the nose.  Taste is super tart, lemon citrus and whole bunch of cherry sourness. Really tart, really nice. The sourness is intense and biting.  Palate holds everything together nicely, the flavors were very well melded in this beer, and nothing really dominated, including the tartness.

On tap at Monks.  Pours red.  Just red.  Served with no head.  The nose is rich tart cherries, with a bit of a earthy note.  Very rich cherry flavor.  Kind of a big body.  High carbonation.  Dry tart finish.  Nice stuff.

2005, 75cl bottle. Deep ruby red, small pink head. Nose is sweet cherries, tart red currants and mild woody notes. Flavor is earthy red currants and cherries, seedy tartness and little vanilla (!) spiciness. Amazing fruitiness. It seems I keep finding my new favorite Cantillon with every bottle sampled.
UPDATED: MAY 19, 2008 2005 Big thanks to Tim for this one. Red colored, pink head. Tart cherry, horsey, light cider vinegar, oak. Taste is more of the same. Tart, but not over the top.

(2005 vintage, draught at Pikkulintu on 2008-05-15) Deep dark red colour. Pink medium sized head. Sour nose contains lot of cherries and cherry stones. Sour and acidic palate. Cherries in flavour. Some bread. Soft aftertaste. Great.

750ml - 2001 sticker - 1000th rating - Aroma has lots of barnyard funk, animals and everything that goes along with them.  Then the cherry kicks in, dark and lush.  Pours deep garnet with a medium pink head and great lacing.  Flavor is dark cherry with a healthy dose of funk.  Palate is mouthwatering sour, dry and super tart.  I was a little worried since this was sitting on a shelf at a local store for 6 years, but it was awesome.  Did I mention sour?
2003 blend, beautiful bright red appearance with strong white head.  flavor has some sour cherry subtle appearance with classic lambic acidity.  very good

bottle 750ml shared with FatPhil and Anna 
at Kaisla 310308 17 euros bottle
Color:nice deep red
Scent:sour and cherry
Taste: nice sour and cherry. Refreshing and    easily drinkable all year round.

750ml from a trade from awhile back.... poured a cloudy garnet red with a thin soapy fiilm of milky white head.... aroma of tart funky sour cherries.... flavor lend toward much of the same.  a long lasting zesty tart sensation which is made equally enjoyablt by the just right amount of carbonation.... a very nice lambic indeed.

bottle from brewery.  pours blood cherry red, aroma is all sourness with a tinge of candy and cherry.  Very smooth mouthfeel, Id say medium, with a buttery smoothness and nice sourness.  Not too sweet.  VERY nice.

1999 bottle and 2005 draft at Monks cafe.  Pours to a very nice red color with a medium head.  Aroma is powerfully sour and sweet/funky - more funk and smoothness in the 99, A bit more cherry in the 05.  Taste has a similar difference - the 05 is very much a fruit flavored lambic, while the 99 is quite well rounded, sour, and earthy.  Great mouthfeel here and a finish that lets you know youre drinking a world class beer.  Brilliant stuff.  1999 version certainly wins out, but this is a treasure at any age.

2001 bottle courtesy of pepsican. Definitely the best Kriek Ive had. Pours opaque ruby red with small head that lingers throughout. Very tart cherries, yeasty funkiness, dry sour finish. Worth $25/bottle? Well, thats up for debate....but I sure did enjoy this one.

03 bottle at obrians.....sooo good
bought and shared by my neighbor at the bar......the best kreik that I have ever had...super complex cherry nose..and a damn fine flavor...every thing that a kreik should be!
2005 bottle poured red with a fair amount of pink head.  Flavor of tart cherries with a quick finish.

750ml 2004 (Bottled 2006). It poured dark red with a thin light pink head. Aroma is strong, typical of Cantillon yeast with a nice amount of sour cherries. Taste is very tart, nice sour cherries, cantillon funk, and a little oaky. A bit acidic and it has a very nice dry finish. The 750 was gone before I knew it.  I just LOVE Cantillons and this is just stellar as well.

I thought maybe it was just those gueze beers that give off the weird bathroom stink so I thought I would try a fruit lambic.  Basically, this is drinkable, but the all too familiar smells overwhelm the tartness of the fruit.  My recipe for a cheap fruit lambic: buy a bottle of wheat beer and pour it into your glass.  Then add some fruit and take a laxative.  Head to your thrown and bring the beer with you.  Enjoy drinking as the gasses from your bottom side permeate the air.  Itll save you about $35.

UPDATED: JUL 10, 2011 Re-rate 7/3/11: Bottle sample at the 1st Israeli Sour Tasting. Thanks Shachar. 2008 vintage. Deep red with a pinkish head. Sour aroma of cherries with medicinal notes and a bit of yogurt. Sour flavor with cherries, some barnyard and citric notes. Smooth mouthfeel. 8/4/9/4/17=4.2

Re-rate 5/1/11: Bottle sample at a tasting. Thanks Lee. 2008 vintage. Cloudy deep red with a beautiful pink head. Aroma of cherries, medicinal notes, funk, a bit of soap, a bit of sweat and oak. Sour flavor with a big of sweetness, cherries, oak and light astringency hints in the finish. Medium-bodied. 8/5/8/4/17=4.2

(3/12/08) Bottle at Bier Circus in Brussels. 2000 vintage (bottled 2003). Deep red with a medium pinkish head  beautiful. Aroma of sour cherries, barnyard, a bit of sweat and citric notes. A very tart dry flavor with cherries, some lemon and oak  delicious! Some pleasant light astringency. Rounded mouthfeel. I like this beer more and more with each sip. I can definitely understand the flies who keep gathering around the glass of this wonderful brew. 8/5/9/4/18=4.4

750ml bottle (Kaisla, Helsinki)
Deep red, small tight head. Sour cherry aroma, also tart sourness. Sharp in the mouth, slightly puckering. Very pleasant sourness, buttery and tasty mellow cherries. Not particularly sweet at all, which is nice. Woody and estery - some heavy phenols. In fact theres smoked port snack sausages in there!
Richmond Industry Gathering 2007. Bottle 1999. Hazy red boddy with a reddish white head. Sweet dry cherry and sour aroma. Heavy sour flavor, lots of cherry. Light body with high carbonation.

Bottle, vintage 2005. Bright cherry red with hints of light burgundy and a thin white head that dies off instantly. Nose is tart and punchy, but a little less than what I was expecting, cherry and sparkly gueuze. Mouth is tart cherry with some sour swallow, but then a sweet glace cherry aftertaste. Theres some barrel there too, but the palate is delicate compared to the punchy taste. Would have liked some more sourness here. Lightly carbonated, enough to be refreshing, but also enough to stop you downing the entire bottle. Leaves you dry and begging for more. Enjoyed this.

Thanks to TheCheeseMan for this.  Pours a brilliant orange-red color with a large pink foamy head and bubbly lacing.  Aroma is light oak, tart cherry, and basement funk.  Taste is about the same but the palate is lacking.....a bit try and bitter.  I think the cork split a bit and some air got to it and blame this for the palate.

Thanks to my brother Petrucci914 for sharing this!  Pours out a deep cherry color with bubbly pink head that fades quickly leaving just a thin foamy layer.  Aroma is of sour cherries, light wood, must and and yeast.  Taste is sour cherries, light oak and yeast funk.  Palate is a bit acidic and the finish is very dry.  Good stuff!

Bottle (750ml, vintage 2002): Hazy and reddish with a small pinkish foamy layer; very intensive fruity (cherries, almonds), and cellary-sourish nose; very solid dry sourish flavour; almonds, cherries and a cellary acidity in the lingering finish. That is a real fruit beer.........
75cl bottle was too small i quite liked a bathtub full of this stuff! this is just dark, sour cherry devinity. was too busy enjoying it and neglegcted rating it, sorry...

Excellent. Pours a wonderful red that looks like tropical punch kool aid with a nice egg shell colored head. Aroma was much like the smell of a permanent marker with a hint of cherry and spice thrown in for good measure. Taste was fantastic. Cherries so sour it almost make the eyes water that lead you to a wonderful dry finish that reminds me of the flavor of those sour cherries candy you used to be able to get at the penny candy store. This was a great beer that I will be having again.

2001 vintage (still in stock) from Johns in Iowa City.  The last several years have done wonders rounding the taste.
Beautiful hazy bright, seemingly almost neon, ruby red.  Delicate pink-tinged white head that lasts.
Acidic sourness, somewhat watery aroma.
Very strong rounded acidic flavor, some sweetness.  Light cherry flavor.
Thick and ever-changing palate.
A thinking beer.

UPDATED: MAR 18, 2008 A great lambic. Cantillon can do no wrong. Aroma was huge with sour cherries, funk and wet blanket. Pour was a deep ruby with a 2 finger off white head. Taste was mouth puckering sour. Sour cherries and must with light vinegar and hay. Another great lambic by the experts.
user_location: Moon Twp, suburb of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, USA

text: 750ml bottle from renffisch. Great red cherry colour. Sour cherries with a nice strawberry kink as well. Mouldy hay or poo (depending on whether you ask renffisch or Mes - they are arguing while I type!) as well!

(75cl bottle, vintage 2002) Cloudy, murky red colour with a short reddish frothy head. Sour and aromatic morello cherry aroma with light almondy bitter notes. Sour flavour, light bodied with a soft but refreshing carbonation. Acidic cherry fruity taste; bone-dry, cherry-fruity and sourish, long lasting, tart and woody finish (12.03.08).

0.75 l bottle, vintage 2004. Hazy deep red color with thick pink head. Very sour and juicy cherry aroma with grapefruit, strawberry and barnyard. Very sour, dry and juicy flavor with cherry, strawberry and wild yeast bitterness. Fairly full bodied and filling for a lambic, not so drinkable.

UPDATED: AUG 15, 2009 Maroon body with no head. The nose is sour pie cherries, cheese, lactic acid and horseblanket. The flavor is moderately sour and lightly sweet with lots of fresh cherries, almonds, cheese, yogurt, melon and a touch of cotton candy. Medium body is very soft with light carbonation. Fantastic kriek.

2005 vintage on tap at map room. One of the most beautiful beers I have ever seen. The most astounding color of red I have witnessed in a beer. Beautiful thin pink head... truely an amazing appearance. Nose is lovely cherry, wood, and sour notes. Flavor is perfect tart cherry. Feels wonderful in your mouth, juicy and tart. You want to chug this... though doing so would be a sin. Finish is rather dry, the bret sucks the moisture from your mouth, leaving you yearning for another sip. Ends with an almost cherry popsickle flavor that is a perfect end to this wonderful brew. More please!!!

Sampled at Delirium Cafe: 2004 Aroma is amazing.  Floral, sour, funky effervescence.  Pours vibrant bright red with a pink head.  Very beautiful.  Flavor is exquisite, perfectly round.  Various sour notes, sour cherries, rustic lemon, dry, complex, and harmonious.  Mouth feel is great tiny bubbles caress the tongue as the acidity brings a slight pucker to the mouth.  Truly exquisite.
UPDATED: AUG 8, 2009 Draft at Maxs.  Deep ruby red color.  Very acidic vinegar aroma with lots of cherries.  Really delicious.  Nice and sour cherry taste with a really creamy oak finish.  Heavenly

I really have to visit this brewery! On draft at Maxs 72 Hours of Belgian.  A pink cherry gift from heaven. What can you say... yeasty, sour cherries. Slight woodiness and a bit of a carbonation kick. Nice....

UPDATED: JUN 9, 2010 75cl bottle. 2003. Pours wonderful unclear pink with a fine white head. Very sour & fresh & fruity aroma and taste. Cherries & matured oak notes. Very dry & fresh taste of sour cherries. Sticky & fizzy carbonation. Typical cantillon -  typical wonder journey to
the "pharcyde".
Re-Rate June 2010 @ Ma Che Siete, Rome. Tap. This beer is just incredible and now one of my favorite cantillon beers. So fruity, crisp and refreshing. Lovely tartness . . . 4,1 - 4,2

[bottle, dated 2002] Nice aroma, very typical Cantillon house character, super funky yeast. Leathery oak and tart fruit. Beautiful reddish pink color with some fine white bubbles around the glass. Flavors are super tart, sour and dry. Fruit flavors are very well rounded, but again, so damn dry. Outstanding overall.

02 Bottle.   Pours a hazy reddish color with a light pink fizzy head.   Aroma is art cherries, wood, funk.   Flavors of tart cherries, oak, barnyard, citrus.   palate is medium bodied, highly carbonated, finished hugely sour and refreshing.   Simply fantastic.
core rosso violaceo schiuma quasi buona puzza percui come si dice è buona acetica frutta sotto spirito in bocca aspra leggermente amara ma un persistenza lunghissima

Shared with my self when watching Danish Song Contest - a great experience; the beer - not the TV-show. Bottle 75 cl, bottled 2002. Small fizzy white head thats mostly diminishing. Deep red colour, sparkling, lightly cloudy. The aroma is dominated by a great taste of cherry and cask wood. It is lightly malty and hoppy. It has a medium body, a sticky texture and a fizzy carbonation. It is very well balanced, moderate sweet, lightly bitter and heavy acidic/dry.

Holy cow, awesome!!!  Pours a hazy, deep red with a course head.  Scents of funk, sour and, cherries on the nose; very nice.  Oaky, sour/tart flavor with a little spice.  Leaves me salivating for more.

Its been about 3 weeks since I had this but moving to Japan has delayed my rating. First of thanks a bunch to Ross for breaking out this special brew, a 2005 vintage I believe. This beer pours out a nice deep reddish color with a very small pink head that went away almost instantly after pouring. Aroma is light and tart cherries with a touch of sourness and funk. Oak is very present on the nose as well. Taste is light and thin but full of flavor. Sourness of the lambic and tartness of the cherries blend very well. Slightly spicy but balanced agian by the wooden flavors. Very good, thanks again Ross.

Bottle 75 cl, harvest 2001, bottled 2002. A few extra years of age seem to have done wonders for this brew. Gorgeous red hue. Aroma of typical Cantillon funk and gueuze sourness complemented perfectly by sour cherries that break through more and more. Flavor is more of the same, the best blend of the gueuze and the fruit I have had to date. The champagne-like lambic blend has neither been overrun by the cherries, nor is it so powerful  that you may as well be drinking a straight gueuze. Absolutely dances on the tongue, I didnt want to ever swallow as it retained its flavors in my boiling mouth longer than I could have anticipated. Awesome.

Bottle 75 cl, harvest 2004, bottled 2006. Pours a wonderfull clear red with a pink head, best looking beer ever. After opening the bottle I smell red wine, but after pooring this in my glass I smell the aroma of cherries and vinegar. The flavor has a perfect mix of sweetness and sourness but I also note hints of coconut I really dont like, where does that come from? The finish is nice mildly sour, a really good kriek!

UPDATED: AUG 29, 2009 Pours deep red. Aroma is packed with cherries and has a mild sour tone. Flavor is nicely balanced between sour and sweet. Natural sour cherries and usual lambic notes. Good complexity but not as sharp as the plain Cantillon Kriek. Still - lovely!

estoppel hooked me up with this, and what a treat. pours cherry red, with a pink head, and an unmistakably tart cherry aroma. Flavor was sour (but more so cherry tart) cherry. Did not get much in the way of oak as was advertised by the bottle. No matter. A new favorite.

Bottle from the dick rider himself, smitty.  Somehow he was able to get me a 2004 bottle for next to nothing.  I think he did a little under the desk work, if you know what i mean.  Pours out a bright red color with a pink head on it.  Smells like cherries and oak / wood.  (not surprising).  Taste is sweet and has almost a weird spice to it, that goes away after your mouth gets used to it.  Very smooth, and almost refreshing without being overly sour.  Good stuff, Id like to have more.

Bottle shared between my brother, mike, and I.  Thanks Mike!  Almost bought a bottle of this last week, but didnt end up getting it...now I will definitely buy one next time I am at the store.  Poured a beautiful pinkish ruby red with an off white pinksih red head.  The aroma was lots of funk, barnyard, and horseblanket...lots of it!  not too much of the fruits that I expected to pick in the aroma, but they were there for sure in the flavor profile.  Lots of dry fruitiness and tart sourness going on in the flavor.  Some woodsy and earthy tones show through in the flavors as well.  Really good fruit lambic that I enjoyed thoroughly.  Good stuff!!

(Draught) Dark red colored, little vanishing white head. Rich wooden-cherry aroma with convenient dryness, berries and sourness. Fine aroma indeed. Medium bodied, still feels nicely thick and soft. Flavor is more sour with dominating wood in start, cherries come up in aftertaste with berry and safty tone. Aftertaste also turns to even more sour. Some lemony orange in aftertaste.

Beautiful blood red with fizzy pink head and lush, full laces.  Like most Cantillon offerings, the flavor is kind of consumed by a harsh lemon sourness that overpowers everything else.  The cherries were wonderful though, mostly tart but full and fresh.  Good and interesting, but I wouldnt buy it again considering the steep price.

Bottiglia da 75cl condivisa al Duca; versa colore rosso porpora intenso con schiuma vivace ed evanescente come si addice ad un buon lambic. Aroma e sapore canonici nel migliore dei sensi possibili: una kriek allennesima potenza, la più buona mai assaggiata.

UPDATED: JUN 26, 2009 2001 bottle shared with drmatt, smhncabot.
Aroma is all sour cherry and funk that just assaults your senses.  The sour dry, barnyard is so appealing.  Jesus, this aroma used to repel me; what happened?  
Taste is super sour at first, just very unripe cherry and crazy yeast profile.  The finish is slightly bitter, funky, and bright cherry- like you have the first bite of a sour cherry, but as you slowly chew it the cherry develops and matures into a ripe, well-rounded fruit.
This beer is amazing.  
It looks like cranberry juice, tastes like sweet/sour cherry, barnyard, and smells very similar with a lot of cherry and funk.
I could drink this all day.
959518
----re-rate- 1999 Lou Pepe Pure Kriek consumed 1/24/2009
Aroma is dirty hay and rotten cherries; ah, lovely!
Its like an earthy, cherry pie.
Taste is lemony-tart cherry.  Lots of acid and some small bit of sweetness brought on by the malt. 
Wow.
959418

2004. Fantastic looks. Thick pink head, tiny bubbles. Beautiful clear red colour with a hint of violet. Lime, cinnamon and raspberry in the aroma. Extremely tart, dry and almost gooey mouthfeel. The finish has some cinnamon in it.

UPDATED: AUG 21, 2009 2004. This beer has a very brilliant "dark-bright" cherry red appearance.  Full sour cherry nose, with the classic cantillon funk on the background. Very complex but enjoyable and drinkable in mouth, sour cherries, metallic, oak, refreshing tartness. fantastic. My favourite Cantillon so far.

Love it.
Dark red cherry beer with a nice pink head. The aroma of sour cherries is overwhelming. We smelled it already when the bottle wasnt even near our table. Sour cherry flavors as well. Nice tartness.

UPDATED: OCT 14, 2007 Tampa RB Gathering Beer #15....2001 vintage, big thanks to Degarth for cracking this one....the star of a great tasting, for me at least....its amazing how our perceptions and palates can change in such a short time, in March I was literally pouring traditional lambics down the sink, now I have 2 in my top 10, with another tied for the 11th spot....huge aroma on this guy - barnyard, sour cherries, vanilla bean, oak, dont know why I just dont give it a 10 for aroma, another sample and I just might....light red body with a very small head of bubbles....flavor is as good as the aroma, huge notes of mouth puckering cherry pie filling, vanilla, oak and some solid earthy notes, barnyard to the max....palate is sublime, medium bodied but dancing around, even at this age, never cloying....finish is supremely long, tart cherries and vanilla abounds....wow, what a beer....I must have more

Draught at The Farmhouse. Beautiful red body with thin head. Aroma is heavy horse blanket, sour, light fruit. Flavor is a nice sucker punch of sour, light berries and fruit, cherries. Nice tartness to it. My mouth is watering just thinking about this one...

On draught at Moeder Lambic.  Deep red, pink head.  Lovely aroma of Gamay grapes, raspberry and red cherry.  No real condition in mouth.  Mouthfeel is disappointing.  Aroma is good, the rest suffers a bit.  Decent cherry flavours throughout.

UPDATED: SEP 17, 2007 2004 vintage from Holiday Wine Cellar. Not being a huge fanatic of lambics, this one impressed me. Effervescent pour that produces a bubbly pink head that eventually settles to fine lacing. Plenty of carbonation amidst the nice ruby red color. Funky acidic aroma from the wild yeast, backed by loads of berries and earth tones. Amazingly easy to drink, very smooth flavor of breadish yeast, raspberry, cherry and melon. Just the right amount of tartness and carbonation for a crisp, clean finish. Presence of wood as well. Not much lingering, yet I looked forward to each sip. An expensive bottle, but worth every penny.

Bottle 2001.  Cork 2003.  Pours ruby red with a light red head that dissapates to a thin sliver around the glass.  Aroma of cellar and wood and a bit of cherries.  Taste is tart and sour upfont with wood and then sweettart in the end.  Will take some time to aquire a taste for it.

Label reads 2003. Cork reads 2005. Off notes 1/2007.

Pours an extremely slightly hazed garnet color with a pink head that doesnt stick around. Smells like when you have a bandaid on and it gets really wet and you dont take it off for a while, but when you do, your skin smells funny. Antiseptic smell. Also a fair amount of fruit and a very mild yeast influence. Flavor is of the best aged lambics. Mildly funky at first with a typical sour punch in the mouth that isnt very powerful. Definite wood influence on the palate. Calmly there, but not overpowering at all. Feel is typical. Not a ton of bubble, but a little bit. Extremely drinkable. In my limited experience with lambics, this is by far the best I have had. And rightly so for $21 a bottle. If you see it, try it. Worth the money IMO. Bloody marvelous.

Bottle 2003 - Very beautiful clear red body with a huge lasting pink head; Huge very fine nose, lots of kriek aroma: pit marzipan, peel like tannins, a very limited very balanced amount of yeast aromas gives it an extreme degree of complexity; Big body with lots of fill, perfect soft carbonation, lots of fruit acids, lots of lactic acids but superbly balanced (much better balance then your usual Cantillon); Very elegant fine tuned finish, again super balanced fruity acidy, initially lots of cherry meat aromas, late lots of yeast aromas, barrel, very late lemon both meet and peel. Overly complex, very balanced, overly elegant what an amazing beer.

UPDATED: JAN 24, 2010 
Name: Lou Pepe Kriek
Date: February 21, 2004
Mode: Bottle
Source: Tasting, RateBeer SE Gathering, 2004
Appearance: dark red
Aroma: tart aroma with an under current of rich cherry
Flavor: huge tart flavor with a wonderful balance of cherries, long tart finish
Overall: best kreik ever

Name: Lou Pepe Kriek
Date: January 05, 2010
Mode: draft
Words: bsp
Appearance: opaque purple, creamy pink head
Aroma: big tart cherry aroma, touch of sweetness, nice musty character
Flavor: big rich cherry flavor, light sweetness is balanced by a big tartness, musty character adds depth

Aroma: 8/10; Appearance: 8/10; Flavor: 8/10; Palate: 6/10; Overall: 17/20
Rating: 4/5.0Drinkability: 7/10
Score: ***+ /4

Name: Lou Pepe Kriek
Date: December 25, 2006
Mode: bottle
Vintage: 2001
endless tartness, rich cherry adds good balance,

Deep red of color with a reddish head. An aroma of strawberry, fresh cherries, notes of sweets and sour notes. A flavor of dry cherries, sweet notes, sour notes and nice drinkable. A well balanced lambic.

2004 vintage sampled at the blind tiger ale house. Tart cherries and sourness in the aroma, some wood. Not very sugary albeit well balanced. The sourness is incredibly balanced with how acidic this beer is. Delicious

750 ml bottle
I picked this up over Christmas time in Rockford, IL.  It was a bit pricy so I didnt want to drink it for less than a good reason.  In this case it was to ccelebrate the GTMW and clear some cellar space.  I can always pick up another bottle and store it until my stomach learns to not churn after two sips of such wonderful beer.
Aroma / Appearance - The nose is very tart cherries as one would expect from such a style.  It was almost like cough syrup but without the sugary sweetness or thick consistancy.  The body looked almost perfect - translucent medium red as if someone blended red Twizzlers into a liquid form.  A bubbly thin head tried to persist but was quickly swallowed by the acidity below.
Flavor / Palate - Now we get to the painful / delicious part of the story.  I was only able to drink about an ounce and a half of this before my stomach began to rebel.  Next time I wont this on a mostly empty stomach.  The flavor of intensely sour cherries filled my senses.  A very funky sensation then washed down my throat dying out every corner.  Even on the way home thirty minutes later I was still parched.  This is one of the most acidic beers I have ever tried - almost like La Folie but with more funk.

Dark cherry in colour, light pinkish coloured head, some light patchy lacing.  The aroma is acidic, excellent cherry tartness, good sweetness for a Cantillon, woody.  The flavour is actually a bit more mild than your typical Cantillon fruit lambic but thats not to say the the sourness isnt there, lots of acidic cherry burst, quite tart.  Sour mouthfeel, medium body, medium/high carbonation.  Finishes oaky, lots of cherries, acidic, tart and dry.  Amazing stuff, a step up from their regular Kriek for sure.  One of the better Cantillons.
750ml bottle from the <a
href=http://www.ratebeer.com/Place/new-york target=blank>Premier Gourmet in Buffalo, New York.
Purchased in November 2004, opened on March 16, 2007.
Vintage 2001.

Red delicious sour cherry and honey.  Mouthwatering: just the smell of it. Makes saliva glands active. Plenty of fruit. Dry bubbly and sour/ Sour in finish.  Fruity waterfall of mild yet prominent cherries. Yummy, but not the best yummy ever.  Still awesome!

UPDATED: JAN 24, 2014 750 ml bottle. A hazy deep red beer, with a very large, fizzy, mostly dinminishing pink head. The aroma is lightly malty (toasted grain), moderately yeasty (barnyard, leather, cheese), with a strong note of cherry, other notes of wood, hint of vinegar. The flavor is moderately sweet, heavily acidic. Medium body, watery texture, sift/lively carbonation, pretty long finish with very light bitterness. Brilliant and fruity Lambic, only mildly vinegary and astringent

2001.  pours a deep purple, burgundy with a small pink head.  sour, musty, cherry aroma.  flavor of cherry, barnyard musk, green olive, grapes, vinegar and oak.  also a hint of burnt matches.  not as acidic as some....well it doesnt burn my throat as much.  the palate smoothness is what makes this so special.
[2003 vintage - 75 cl bottle] Clear red colour. Pink head. Sour cherry aroma with hints of iron and horses. Sour, oaky cherry flavour with notes of grapefruit. Great balance. Very refreshing.

750ml bottle. 
First off, this beer looks amazing! Bright, full deep red, with a small pink head that doesnt last teribly long. Aroma is a wonderful lambic funk, with great cherries in there with that good old wet hay/barnyard lambic smell. Flavour is all cherry, very refreshing. Very nice and tart, and sour, but not over powering like some lambics, a great balance between the both, just a wonderful beer!
Bottle sampled. Pours red with a small pink head. Aroma of fermented cherries and  sweetness. The flavor is sweet upfront, fermented tart cherries, and slight oak. Good body, good brew.

UPDATED: SEP 1, 2007 2004 75cl bottle. Deep raspberry pink with a short lived fizzy head. Full nose of unripened cherries and sweet juicy berries. Taste is sweet and slightly sour with a soft bitter edge. Some oaky character. Lush body. Prickly mouthfeel. Close to perfect.
Bottle of the 2002 vintage.  This is the sourest slice of cherry pie that you will ever drink.  I cant describe it any better.  Just superb.

Rating # 400.  06 bottle.  Pours a dark ruby color with a nice cherry red head.  Great aroma of barnyard funk, sourness, cherries, oak, and sweet berries.  Flavors of sour leather, funk, juicy cherries, and oak.  Medium mouthfeel.  Excellent Kriek.

UPDATED: FEB 5, 2012 Bottle 750ml. @ 16th Weekend of Spontaneous Fermentation 2007, Opstal. [ Vintage 2002 ]. Unclear medium red color with a average frothy fair lacing mostly diminishing pink head. Aroma is light to moderate berries / fruit, sour / sweet, notes of wood / oak. Flavor is light sweet and moderate acidic with a average to long duration. Nice dry - dry finish. Very nice balance kriek. Body is light to medium, texture is watery, carbonation is flat. ;o))  8-3-9-3-18 
Bottle 750ml. [ Vintage 2008 ]. Clear medium to dark red colour with a average to large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, pink head. Aroma is moderate to light heavy cherry, almond, wood notes. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and light acidic with a long duration, dry, cherries, sharp - tart. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is flat. As alwas very nice ;O) [20120127]  8-4-8-4-16

On tap at Map Room in Chicago.  Im maybe not the best person to judge a kried/lambic, as Im not the biggest fan.  But I thought this was very well done with a nice cherry flavor-- almost a bit too tart.  I still prefer an easier to drink cherry fruit beer like New Glarus Belgian Red over a kriek like this.  But I tried to appreciate it for what it is.

draft at map room.  bright raspberry red, reasonably opaque and a small dark pink head.  smell is a bit sour and entirely of cherry tart.  no sweetness.  im not finding it as sour smelling as a lot of farmhouse beers.  tyler would hate this.  the flavor is simple, but appreciable for how natural it tastes.  all cherries, lots of acidity on the back, no sweetness at all.  pretty puckering at the bottom of the sides of the tongue.  i guess if it wasnt for the novelty of this beer, though, id probably not think too much of it.  i think itd be pretty good to have one on a summer day.  but the syrup that sits on the tongue would be a cloying cherry after a couple glasses.

Shared bottle thanks to CMUBEERMAN.   Vintage 2001. The cork was a bit funky upon opening---there was moldy liquid at the top, but all appears to be ok, judging by the taste. Pours a beautiful red red ruby, pink head. I do believe that this is the first "5" that I have ever given for appearance---the color is stunning. Aroma is super sour, tart cherry and raspberry, tangy bleu cheese, and this other scent that reminds me of this old musty tent that my family used to camp in when I was a kid. Flavor is very sour, tart cherries, funky, musty, tangy, sour dough. Good stuff.

UPDATED: MAY 15, 2007 2004 vintage on tap at Coopers Seafood, Scranton, PA. I was stunned by how well crafted this lambic is. Cherry mahogany red oak flavors with a sour leather aftertaste and the acidity seems so well balanced. A small lacing of a head but visually stunning with its ruby red tone.
Bottle (2003) at ØLbaren - Jens bought this and shared with us, Engelsman, Gunnhild, Mette & Me. Clear red - light pink head. High vinegar, sourness, cherry, light spicy, a clean brew. Very good !!!

01 Vintage.Avery balanced sourness with a hint of tart cherries in the aroma.Pours a very dark red with a medium pink head.Great balance of sourness and cherries.Medium mouthfeel with a hint of cherries in the finish.
Wow- this has a strong sour cherry flavor.  The first taste or two really makes you pucker.  Nice reddish appearance though and strong sour cherry aroma.  It did have a spicey flavored aftertaste.

#800!!!  01 Vintage.  Cork was in great shape, which was a pleasing sign.  The pour revealed  a gorgeous deep red brew that sported a lightly colored pink head with lively carbonation present in the glass.  Aroma of sour cherries wafted from the glass, and presented a wondeful experience for the nose.  Sour cherry spice?  This beer puts forth that flavor and makes it work to perfection.  The sour aspect hits first, of course, but does not overwhelm at all.  In the middle of the experience, the cherry flavor makes itself known without being unwelcome.  Finally, a dash of peppery madness arrives and suprises the taste buds in a delightfuly delicate dance of flavoring.  This is simply a superb experience--one that Im glad I waited to experience.

2002 vintage. Pours deep ruby red with pink highlights. Sour cherry and hints of spice (cinnamon & nutmeg?) on the nose. Quite firm body. WOW! An explosion of sour and tart cherries on the palate. Quite tart and dry. Finish dry and ling. Very fun stuff.

UPDATED: MAY 4, 2009 2004. Pizza Port Belgian Beer Fest. On tap. Vivid, exciting bright real red fresh cherry juice vibrance, alive with dripping moisture and a wildness of the pits. Florid and bright vermillion, with a rose fringe and blush head. Flavor is a sweet, chirping acidity in the note of perfected aged cherry alcohols, fresh flesh and pining pits. Amazing balance derived singularly from the fruit. All around stunning.

Great, great beer(ish).  Ruby red color, spectacular cherry smell.   Much better than lindenmans, because less sharp and less sweet.  The best Cantillon.  Tried it at the12 hour Belgian beer partyin Carlsbad, CA.  Possibly the best beer tasting ever,with 70 bottled rare and expensive beers and 20 on draft.

Bottle 2003. Poured hazy reddish color with an average frothy reddish head that was mostly lasting with good lacing.  Moderate complex sour cherry aroma. Medium body with a sticky texture and lively carbonation. Heavy sour cherry flavor with a medium tart sour finish of long duration. Sour refreshing brew that was good for 2300.

Bottle. 2001 vintage.
Pours a murky, varying, reddish coloured body with a medium-sized soapy white head. Loads of cherry, acidic seeds, vinegar, and sweet jam in the aroma. Very tart acidity, chewy fruit sharpness moving between cherries and raspberries. In the middle there is some fruit sugar and then leads into a well-attenuated long, lingering, aciditic finish.
Another great Cantillon.

Photo of the bottle and glass:
http://www.flickr.com/photos/mdstich/424309507

In the far, far reaching netherworld of the notebook I pull out another one. Tasted way back in March 06, seems a lifetime ago. A 2003 corked seven fifty, into a shallow chalice at just on cold. Classic, candi apple red body, bright, with minute intermittent carbonation almost too fine to distinguish. A head developed off the pour, a tight, thin, wafered pad of pink to sit in charm of the beer itself. Aroma, a let down. I expected aggressive, in fact I wanted aggressive and alas, only subtlety here. A light prickle, acidic and tart, fell fruit, slight dampness of hessian but little else, no real character. Its peppery in the mouth, lively and yet delicate in body. The spritzy carbonation and tart cherry flavours cause it to bounce across the palate with so much haste it barely grips for enjoyment. It is sour, no doubt, but so, so controlled up against the likes of the Cantillon 100% Kriek. The palate so dry, it does manage to leave a feint cherry essence to linger on the lips where the saliva once dwelt. Subtle baby-spew end and fruit on dominance so much to not really be of character at all. It sadly lacks in true Lambic character, its just too subtle to be of worth. Where are the cobwebs, the must, the damp cellar, the Brett. and Lambicus. I did expect more, but hey, I love Cantillon so it is forgiven. (apologies for the overuse of the word subtle!)

Tasted at the brewery. 
Very smooth, the cerries bringing a new dimension. A little sweetness in the finish, but the sourness lingers, too. Very refreshing!

Draft at DRE.  Deep pinky purplish pour with light pink head.  Aroma of Bretty funky cherries, red wine grapes, earthy yeast.  Tastes very tart, but not as mouth puckeringly tart as some of the other Cantillon offerings Ive had.  The mid-palate sees more earthy Bretty notes, with the chery and red grapey notes always present.  Complex in aroma and flavor, this one is very good.

2003.  Jellied cranberry sauce red.  The cherry flavor is sour and big but not overbearing.  This stuff is great just swishing in my mouth.  Effervescent, prickly, sour, sweet...always interesting.  Spicy, peppery finish.

Courtesy boboski or SoLan.  Second beer sampled at O-Town Throwdown.  2003 on neck label.  Light scarlet in color with a pinkish thin head.  Pretty funky aroma, but not as sharply sour as the Framboise.  Not much fruit in the nose.  Well-carbonated and light-bodied.  Sharp acidic taste, but again, not as aggressive as the Framb.  (Im referring to a 2003 LP Framb.).  Sour plum notes in the taste, but overall dominated by the sharp tart funk tastes.  A bit acidic for my tastes.

Pours a hazy, cloudy red with a light pink thin head.  Very thick fruity smell.  Get a little cherry in there but not a whole lot.  The taste is big tannins and sourness, typical of Cantillon beers.  You get a little cherry mixed in but not a whole lot.  You never do with these guys.  Still excellent Kriek.

750mL bottle.  2004 vintage.  Brilliant ruby red color with a small light pink head.  Plastic phenols and muted musty hay with a heavy cherry skin and cherry stone aromatic.  Sharp acidity up front, ripe sour cherries and minor floral notes.  Almondy cherry stone character melds with a softening tartness.  Cherry skin, dusty ester and phenol component in the finish with lingering woody acetic sourness.  Mouthfeel is light, rather dry.
Bottle, 2004 vintage.  Dark reddish beer with a strawberry coloured head.  The aroma is lightly sour cherry, and the flavour is lightly sour cherries and quite dry.  Overall an average beer.

Bottle shared with HogTownHarry & GregClow -- my bottle courtesy of SecretSanta. Vintage 2003. Pours a gorgeous dark ruby-red with a large lasting pink head -- its not often I give a 5 for appearance but this looks great! Nice aroma of very tart cherries, yeast funk, sweet malt, wood and spices. Flavour: Oh man is that ever tart! Really tart cherries, funky yeast, sweet malt, vinegary wine and spices. Quite carbonated. This is amazing stuff!
Tap at the drafting room. Cloudy red with little head. Aroma of sour cherries, yeast funk and a little barnyard. Taste was mostly sour, with a bit of sweet malt.  Acidic Finish. Very good.

Draught:  Aroma of tart, sour cherries.  Smells sweet.  A bit like cough medicine.  Poured blood red with a small pink head.  Very tart flavor.  Made me pucker and salivate.  Also tasted of cherries.  No carbonation.  Light texture.  Too tart.

Bottle (750ml - 2003 vintage).  Shared with blankboy and GregClow, blankboys bottle courtesy of his 2006 SecretSanta.  Poured thick, almost chunky deep red, large pink head - almost perfect.  Aroma - holy crap - deep yeast funk, sour cherry, lush, goddamn great.  Fresh sour cherry with a sweet thick malt base, waves of lanolin and burnt rubber yeast/funk, the flavour rolls and shifts on my palate - my wife (didnt like it) said "lemon juice!" - very acidic but I think well behaved. Thick, acidic, mildly carbonation, medium linger - just friggin amazing, one of my favorites.

Bottle shared with HogTownHarry & blankboy - courtesy of blankboy. 2003 vintage. Deep ruby red with a lovely pink head. Aroma - sour cherry, dark wood, aged vinegar - nice! Flavour - oh, yeah! Seriously puckering, but so good - sour cherries, balsamic vinegar, super dry wine. Mmmmmmm!

rbesg06, bottle at delirium, 2002 vintage. ruby red with a small, fluffy pink head. aroma of stale cherry froot loops. pretty sour, woody, some cider vinegar but balanced by some glace cherry sweetness

UPDATED: FEB 14, 2007 11-23-06. 2001 bottle. Clear ruby red body and lovely pink head; medium carbonation. Aroma of freshly picked dark cherries. Flavor is more of tart cherries, cant get enough of this. Earthy, oak character; dry yet juicy. Very enjoyable and dignified beer for a quiet thanksgiving dinner.
Bottle. Nice acidic aroma. Hazy deep red colour. No head. The flavour is a little acidic with some mild/round notes. Quite earthy, ending on an acidic note. Very nice.

2004 bottle. 
Pours a mysterious dark hazy ruby, with a nice small creamy head. Aroma gives the typical cantillon brett/hessian bag character, probably stronger than their other beers, there was also quite a bit of oak and old dry cherry. Smooth, tart body... the cherry seems less present than the plain kriek, and it just tasted a little old. Flavours were stronger in the finish, which showed plenty of musk, acid and a dry feel. Great.

Tap @ Obriens.  Ruby, thin pink head.  Nose is cantillon funk, cherry pits, earthy oak.  Flavor is sour cherry, acidic lemony/rind, deep earthy fruit.  Yeast and trademark Cantillon.  Nice but I dont really love what Cantillon does with Krieks.

Holy moly is this stuff sour!  But, at the same time, incredibly delicious.  Im very glad I got to try this.  Pungent cherry and beautiful to look at.  Sour as all, get out.  Tasted a little earthy as it warmed up, so get on it and drink it down quick-like.  This will make the muscles in your neck tense up.

UPDATED: JUN 1, 2007 on tap at hopleaf. pours a cloudy ruby red with almost no head. a pretty complex sour cherry aroma. flavor is very crisp sourness with hints of cherries. the cherry flavor is amazing. very clean and ripe. i actually dont usually like the flavor of cherries but this beer accomplishes a wonderful balance of being very sour and tart with a great cherry finish. a wonderful brew.............................................. tap at maproom 5/29/07. this and dreadnaught had to fight for my love that night and i had dreadnaught first, but had 2 pours of this 04 vintage. another stellar impression. cherry flavor is right on for me, nice sour kick, but rounded out acidity made this extremely drinkable. my favorite kiek by far.
2001 Bottle: Probably a bit old by now, but here goes.  SOUR!!!!!  Wow!  Pucker city.  Lots of tart cherries.  Not too complex.

Bottle: Ruby cranberry colored, light head and lacing. Nose of ripe cherry, nice cinnamon and maltiness. Nice nose, clean bouqet, nice tart mouthfeel and finish. End balanced, zesty, good. A lot more balanced than their regular kriek, I could drink this one all night.

UPDATED: APR 29, 2016 2003 vintage. Red with a short lived head. Very fruity aroma has sour cherry of course as well as some wood. Refreshing and quite sharp flavour. 4.1 

2003 vintage in 2011: Rather a lasting head actually. Not a lot of cherry aroma, but lots of almond, along with cellar and complex funk. Complex and quite tart flavour with cherry, almond, wood, funk

2015 in 2016. Loads of sour cherry, and cherry stone/almond. Over the top cherry, but oh, its good.

(Bottle 75 cl) Slightly hazy blood red - no head and completely flat. Fresh and fruity aroma with prominent cherries. Thin and somewhat watery body with acidic - but fresh - accents of cherries. Remains sourish all through the finish. 281006

Yes, thank you to JoeMcPhee for this great beer!  An impressive, brightly colored brew - flamboyantly red with a pink head.  Theres no doubt that this is a cherry beer from the aroma: sour, musty cherries prevail.  The sourness is not too overwhelming in the flavor, as some of the Cantillon beers are for me.  This is a nice balance of tartness, hints of maltiness and plenty of fruitiness.  Very good.

Huge thanks to JoeMcPhee for sharing this at beastiefan2ks place - pardon my french, but this beer is the shiznit! (I know, not the greatest word to describe such a refined beer) - beautiful red body with a slight purple hue to it - the aroma has the customary Cantillon funk, with damp oak, cherries, of course (pits and all) - very mild sourness for a Cantillon, complimented by a very subtle sweetness and acidic cherry flavor - later in the flavor, and all through the finish, there are some warming, almost Christmas-like spices that I couldnt really identify, but they made the beer even more delicious - I will have to shell out the money for another bottle so I can spend more time figuring out what makes this beer so great.
bottle at horsens beerfestival. Red colour with a pink head. Aroma is sour, yeast, citrus. Flavour is sour, yeast, fruit, mould, cherrie.

2003 bottle.  Beautiful dark cherry red with pink dissapating head.  Sour aroma of cherry, citrus and that Cantillon funky smell.  Mouth-watering flavor, oak, cherry, sourness, vinegar and dry.  Quite intense.  A sticky cherry sweetness lingers.  Thin and a bit watery while remaining complex.

Bottled at Horsens Beerfestival. Cherry-red, unclear beer with a rim of pink bubbles on the top. The aroma is sour and citric, with hints of cherry and some notes of yeast and barnyard. The flavor has cherry, not the artificial one, almond and some sweet notes. Thin, astringent mouthfeel and a sour finish with cherries. Very nice kriek. (061028)

Bottle (from Bitter Virtue, Vintage 2002, Bottled 2004). Blood red. Nice earthyness with restrained fruits, almond like cherry stones and zesty citrus. Aroma is quite inviting and leads into a wonderfully fresh and zesty mouthfeel with an orangey sourness in the finish. As would be expected from Cantillon dry and sour. My one complaint with this would be that after drinking the best part of the bottle the juxtaposition of some fruit in the aroma and the intense sourness highlights the sour flavours and light body. On a side note mulls very successfully.
(2003 vintage) Pours a hazy red with a pink head. Sour and quite bitter. Berry flavors. Very flavorfull. Nice champainlike carbonation, but a bit too sour.
Bottle. Small white head. Hazy red body. Sharp cherries aroma and flavor. Would have expected more fruit flavor. Too much acidity.
Pale red colour with raspberry red head. Aroma is yeasty with a feel like cow farms. Quite full body. Sour as always but with a woody flavour gives it a roundness.

Tap at Bruxellensis.  Pours a excellent clear read with a tall pink head, poured carefully by the brewer to not get any sediment in there. The aroma was much sweeter then their normal kriek, and throughout I was waiting for sourness but this was far sweeter then any other cantillon ive had. I found the Lou Pepe Framboise to be a bit more enjoyable due to the sourness that remained, the kriek didnt quite have enough and almost felt a bit watery without it.

25.4 oz bottle.  2003; bottled in 2005.  Clear purple-pink with a brief, sparkling, raspberry egg-white head.  Woody cherry rises up from sourdough earth.  Band-aids, mild funk.  Sips yield smooth sourness. Its all about the tease as hints of cherry appear early and mid-tongue with light sweetness around the mouth.  Peppery vinegar provides pucker.  Cherry pits.  Tingle, more than carb.  Later pours are hazy; fruitier.  I expected more from my first fruit lambic but still soothing and satisfying.  Wish I had some St. Andre.

On tap at OBriens.  Pours a deep, blood red color with a quickly dissipating medium layer of bubbly pink head.  Sour, funky, vinegary aromas of back cherries with a healthy dose of tannins.  Light bodied, marvelously champagne-like, sour mouthfeel.  Two distinct waves of flavor tickle my tongue in an intriguing fashion.  The first wave satisfies my immediate craving for a tart, sour beer, starting out dry and woody.  The second wave blows my hair back with the amazing complexity of the cherry flavor.  Not overpowering, it creeps out from behind the tart mask and keeps building in intensity until the final smack, which is so convincing I feel as though Im sucking the last remaining flesh off of the cherry pits.  Very delicious - unbelievable balance between fruit and tart.
(Bottle) Pours hazy blood red. Pink head. Aroma of sour acid. Wood and berries. Tastes extremely sour with some cherries. Fresh and sour so your hairs curl. Medium body.
Tried at Weekend of Spontaneous Fermentation 27/05/06. 2002 Vintage. Dark cherry red body, short head. Fairly balanced taste of sour cherries with some oak notes .

[Bottled RBESG 2006] 
What vintage was this? Bugger it! Deep red colour. Rich aroma, big on cherries and almond paste, almost like glue. Not as sour as the Cantillons I know. Big vineous flavour, where the Scharbeekse cherriesd add a deep dry sensation. Body is light, but oh so fluffy!

UPDATED: DEC 24, 2006 On Tap at OBriens in San Diego, CA.  I was extremely surprised to find this gem of a beer from a fantastic brewer at OBriens and I was oh so happy to have it.  Deep read apperance with a thin little head.  The aroma is extremely tart and cherry.  The taste is sour and tart and oh so good.  Every sip is full of an insane amount of flavor.  It is a joy to have consumed such a robust brew from Cantillon
2003 Vintage; Nose is tartness with some cherries as a bonus; Transparent hemoglobin red with a small pink head; Flavor is gueuze sour with a little barnyard, and the cherry flavor added.

2003 bottle.  Aroma is cherry, with a bit of pie crust, sourness, smells like a black cherry basically.  Body is rich mohaganey with a thin pink head on top.  Taste is very tart, with cherries, a bit doughy with the sourness and pie crust once again shows up.  Complex beer that as drink more brings out balance but still maintains expectations.

Bottled (Lou Pepe Kriek 2002). Deep ruby red colour, small head. Aroma is cantillonish sourness, but a lot of sour cherries also. Flavour is cherry, sourness and some cookies and nuts. Lovely balanced Cantillon. I just loved it. Thanks to Magic_dave6 & co for sharing.
(2002)Pure lambic goodness. Aroma is sour taste is sour its flat its lambic its just greatness!

(label says 2001 vintage, cork says it was bottled in 2002) after i removed the bottle cap, there was a little liquid on the cork (which was soft) but this didnt seem to effect the beer. poured hazey deep red with good carbonation.  Funky barnyard aromas noted before i even bring this to my nose. nose is oaky, dry sour cherries, vinegar. Flavor is more funky cherries, with notes of oak on the palate.   Sourness is not as intense as its sister (the lou pepe frambroise) but equally enjoyable. Thanks to hopistotle420 for this gift bottle.  Amazing stuff.

UPDATED: DEC 22, 2011 First ratingBottle at Delirium Cafe in Gothenburg, August 2006 Cantillon Kriek 2002 "Lou Pepe".Shady deep red blood orange color, small white to pink head. Sour and bitter almond cherry seed scent. Very sour cherry taste, no bitterness at all. The sour goes on all night!8/3/6/2/12=3.1Rerate750 ml bottle on January 8, 2011. Vintage 2007Thanks to Nisse666!
Hazy dark red color, pink head. Cherry pip scent, also moussy smell Acidic but smooth taste. Moussy mouthfeel, low bitterness.8/4/7/3/15=3.7Rerate75 cl bottle at 3 Små Rum, 2007 versionSampled on December 22, 2011Clear dark deep red color, pink head. Acidic, sour, stable, complex, wonderful scent. Taste about the same as the scent, just beautiful, could smell and taste this all night, damn it is so good! Moussy mouthfeel, at the same time mouthfpuckering sour. Very very low bitterness.Oh so damn nice!9/4/9/4/19=4.5

UPDATED: AUG 19, 2006 Tap at Brouwers.
Pours a saturated light red with a perfect pink head, long-lived lovely fine bubbles that sip like cream. The sour cherry and barnyard aroma is well-reflected in the flavor; there  a tremendous sour cherry juice explodes inside a latrine-dominated lambic. Hints of oak at the side of the palate, amply but not overly carbonated; less of that back-of-the-nose lambic burn than one might otherwise expect given the intensity of the lambic character. Very nice!

UPDATED: OCT 29, 2008 2003 bottle from The Belgian Room, NYC. This beer gains a lot as it warms. Funky sour aroma gives a blast of fresh cherries even 3 years (edit: 1 year) after bottling as the beer enters the mouth. Breathing through the mouth really amplifies the brilliant aroma. After a very brief cherry punch in the mouth, the beer proceeds into familiar sour lambic flavor before imparting a strong white wine muskiness in the finish. The muskiness fades as it warms, allowing more balanced flavors to shine through. More cherry in the finish as the beer coats the lips and leaves lots of flavors for the licking. Sourness wasnt quite as intense or brutal as Ive seen in other Cantillons, less acidic/vinegary/minerals, instead softer and smoother. Top-notch stuff.

Bottle:  Courtesy of rudolf via Secret Santa.  Huge funky sour/tart aroma with a hint of cherry.  Pours a cloudy reddish-orange with a small pink head.  Huge tart and sour flavors up front.  Increased sourness than most Cantillons.  Hints of cherry in the middle.  Not very wood when compared to other Cantillons.  Finishes with an increased sour presence.    Absolutely awesome and ranks up there with the St. Lamvinus as my favorite lambic.

2001 Vintage corked and capped bottle.  Pours a deep red garnet with a frothy and small pink head that mostly dissipates.  Aroma is sour cherry and green berries, yeast (cellar, cobwebs), malt (straw), vinegar and lemon notes.  Tongue tantalizing and mouth watering tart, sour bitter fruit (cherry, lemon zest), moderate acidity that increases as the beer temperature rises, the sweetness of the fruit is hidden, notes of fruit skin and oak.  Medium bodied, dry and clean palate.

Special bottle for my 34th Bday, this did not disappoint for my second from this fine brewer. Big cherry aroma that is a little funky. Flavor continues among this vein with a cheese like sharpness in the profile, ending with a musty sourness that just begs you to take another drink. Rolling it over my tongue gave a nice velvet feel.

Nice cloudy strawberry colour with a small white head. Aroma is dry, sour, with cherries and old leather. Flavour is quite sour and tart, with cherries and a lovely oak presence.  Smooth on the tongue with lingering cherry.
Cloudy deep reddish beer with no head. Tart fruity aroma with yeasty notes and a vague hint of wood. fruity, light tart and sweet flavor with a yeasty and dusty note.

Thanks to beeryum for this one.  Deep, deep blood red colour, thick red head.  Really gorgeous brew.  Tart lactic aroma, much more pronounced cherry character than in the regular kriek with a beautiful vanilla and soft almond note in back.  Plenty of musty and funky aromas as well, but they serve to accent the beautiful fruitiness.  Mouthfeel is lean and dry with some mouthpuckering acidity, dry leathery character and some lingering lactic acidity.  Fruit is more prominent in the nose than in the mouth.  As it warms, the sourness seems to mute, bringing forward some softer earthier character that I quite enjoy.  More temperature also helps bring out the fruity flavours.  Classic delicious Cantillon.

2002 Vintage. Poured a burgundy color with a nice little pink head that subsided to only a ring after a few minutes. Lacing was almost absent. Carbonation bubbles were not in the body. Aroma was tart, vinegar, citrus/cherry. The flavor was full of lots of stuff, hay, vinegar, oak, citrus, light cherries, and definite tartness. Nothing sweet about this, although for Cantillon, not offensively tart. Body was full for the style. Mouthfeel was acidic. Very nice if youre into these sorts of things, but its not something Id go back and pay $24 for another bottle. This is only for the hard core at those prices.

On draft at OBriens - wow, how lucky am I to find it this way in the US!?!  Arrived in a tulip glass, a beautiful cloudy dark cherry color with a small pinkish head that leaves spots of lacing.  Aroma is dry, dry, dry, champagne, pie cherries, wet wool and a bit of funk.  Tart, dry, puckering cherry flavor, with little to no residual sugar evident, oaky and sour finish.   Medium body and fine, crisp carbonation.   Truly a treat!

Bottle.
Clear red coloured with a light pink head.
Light acidic aroma of berries and wood.
Light acidic flavour of berries and wood.

1999, mellow as expected. A reddish pink fruity along with pulp look, good amount of lace. The kriek raspberry more than cherry aroma is invigorating. Sour pucker and mellowed magnificiently. it is Natural cherry.Unimpeding carbonation.Surprisingly drinkable.

On [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */Briens:  Color is a pinkish purple with a small pink head. Aroma is like tart burgandy wine. Flavor starts black cherry tart turning red wine vinegar like acidic and finishing kinda dry. Light bodied and watery with lively carbonation.
bottle. red color. pink head. taste of cherry and vinegar. a bit sour. dry pallete.
Bottle. Pours red in colour with a medium head. Medium dryness. Slightly sour and slightly moldy. Very nice. Maybe a very faint hint of cinnamon.

2002 bottle.  Pours red with a wavering light pink head.  Smells of rasberries and typical barnyard elements.  Taste is light and fluffy with a nice rasberry note throughout and a dry finish.  Extreme over the top tartness.

Draft at OBriens.  Kool-aid looking with minimal head.  Aromas were very tart as expected.  Cherry and even a bit of wood.  Flavors were sour cherry.  made me think of unsweeted pie filling.  Very good and sour as expected.  After the pucker, it goes down with a nice aftertaste.  Very good stuff.

The 750 ml bottle is either a 2001, like the sticker says, or a 2003 like the cork says, Im not sure what to believe!  Anyway, it pours a deep cherry red color w/ a short lived light pink colored head.  Intial aromas of barnyard horse maneur and sour cherries that become more earthy and baked cherry pie like as it warms.  A hint of oaky aroma and bready malt come through as well.  Also some leathery and chloroseptic like phenolic and sourness.  Flavor is definitely sour throughout.  Some corked woodiness, in the long dry finish with some baked cherry pie flavors mid palate that faint into the dryness.  Up front very sour, but it backs off a little bit shortly into the sip.  Earthy flavors thrown in for good measure.  Oddly enough, there is a touch of sugary sweetness at the very front.   Aftertaste is woody cork and dry with a hint of sour cherries.  Dry mouthfeel, very dry and puckering tannin like.  Lighter medium body, lower carbonation.  Not a big fan of sour beers, but this ones not too bad as far as they go.  Im having a bit of a hard time getting past the corked woody flavor.

2001 bottle that I recieved in a trade too long ago to remember who gave it to me.  Deep ruby body with a thin pink head  along with minimal lacing.  Cherries abound along with some clover honey, loads of sourness, and a bit of woody/earthy too.  The wife gets lemon grass, but I dont.  The cherries are there, along with a good deal of honey.  The sour doesnt hit right away, but it makes a sneak attack just before the taste is gone, and it hits with full force.  A lasting sourness as well, only washed away by the next wonderful sip.  Very very tasty.

2001 vintage. Pours a deep dull red with a thin pink head. Sharp, funky and acidic in aroma with just a hint of cherry. Low carbonation with a slender body that still manages to be elegant. Very sour with some oak flavors. Finishes fast, funky and clean. The cherry flavor is slight but lingering. Has a saccharine note in the finish.
Red with notes of brown appearance. Very refreshing an gigantial taste of cherries. Very clean and pleasant. Finish is moderately sour and slightly sweet.
Pours a lovely deep red colour with a smal pink head. Nutty cherry aroma with some sourness. Malty sour cherry flavor with a long nice nutty cherry aftertaste.

"Thank goodness for a good beer buddy or i am not having this one. 2002 Vintage. Poured nice dark red color with a little pink head with almost no lacing. Aroma was citrus and very tart. The flavor vinegar, woody, citrus, light cherries, strong tart. Good for the style not my fav."
Muddy red with a light pinkish head, sour aroma, hint of cherries, flavor is of funk, some cherry , sourness, earth, yeast and citrus. Interesting and delicious.

UPDATED: OCT 15, 2008 Thanks JasonC!  Poured from a 2001 bottle.  The aroma is pine sap with cinnamon and nice earthen funky cherries and lemons.  Wow!!!  This is REALLY tart.  You may actually get jaw ache from cringing too much.  The beer pours to a deep reddish cherry color with a nice fizzy white head.  The flavor is really intense tart cherries and grapes with some nice cinnamon spice and light apples.  Once you get past the first hit with the intense sourness, the complexity really opens up.  The palate is really tart and good feeling. 8, 4, 9, 4, 18 = 4.3.

Thanks JasonN.  2002 vintage.  Phenomenally tart.  Puckeringly sour flavor of fruity cherries and pie filling.  Ridiculously tart palate but finishes clean.  The aroma’s god some tart cherries and funky horseblankets.  Very "simple" but masterfully made. 8, 4, 9, 5, 18 = 4.4

2001 vintage; sampled Jan 2006. Raspberry colored clear body, pick bubbly/creamy head. Woody dry cherry and barnyard vinegar aroma, dry weed stems, urine soaked and dried blanket, fresh liquid cowpie (thanks Dave), sour patch kids. Very smooth sour cherry taste (overall). This is extremely smooth, for a "sour" beer. Some oak perhaps, mostly cherry sour patch kids without the fakeness, but does have Kool Aid hints. Generally full of flavor. Booyah.
Thanks for Jason!  Has a vinegary aroma, with a hint of cherry.  Nice deep red color with a pink head.  Wonderful flavor. VERY tart and sour.  Nice body.  Overall, very pleasing.

There is lots of wood and cherry in this, chased and eventually overtaken by incredible vinegary sourness and patches (mostly in the aroma) of green smoke and cinnamon.  It grew on me, but again one of those beers that I couldnt manage a whole bottle of.

UPDATED: OCT 27, 2007 A Mes rate: 
75cl bottle from Cantillon. When we were given this bottle we were told it was not for sale as it was not ready for consumption yet. It didnt even have labels on it so Jean had to hand write some! We were made to promise that we would not drink it for at least 4 months. 4 and a half months later we could wait no longer and popped it open and oh my word it was worth the wait. Aroma is that of their Lou Pepe Gueuze with some added cherry (obviously) some apple and lashings of cinnamon. Wow. Bouquet is a far more suitable word than aroma. Appearance wise it is just as you would expect. A glorious mahogany cherry red body with a swiftly diminishing head.  Flavour wise it perfectly echoes the aroma. Pulp of cherries with hints of apple and lemons and plenty more cinnamon. Palate is tart and dry but not as overly barnyardy as you would maybe think. It does make moves in that direction but just before it gets over the top a wonderful thick sweet cherry finish washes in and down. Simply an amazing brew.

1999: Poured nice deep red with a nice pink head...smell is funk, subtle cherry, mildey wood...taste is sweet up front turning tremendously sour without a lot of cherry around...dried mouth out a lot though, almost astringent...made my tongue feel like sandpaper...

Bottle, 2001 vintage - courtesy of the ever generous Joris Pattyn
Neon red, plentifull fine bubbles, nice pink head cover.
Wooden, leathery, light metallic notes.
Not too heavyhanded on the cherry, soda, almonds.
Sparkly mouthfeel, light body.
Medium dry exit.

Bright read, with a decent pink head. Very sour nose with hints of lemon, brett, cherry, and vanilla. Extremely tart, dry, with tannic and oaky notes and traces of cherry. Fantastic, refreshing stuff, an effect not unlike super-concentrated cherry lemonade depleted of any sickly-sweetness.

12.10.05  1999, 750ml bottle at RLB YEHA-05.  Dark pink pour, very dark like a pomegranate juice, with dark pink head.  Aroma is fruity, cherries with plum and apple, and light musty wood.  Flavor is boldly sour but not so funky, lots of cherry (starburst).  One of the most pronounced sweet/sour contrasts Ive had.  Very tasty.

Sampled at the Yeha.  Poured red with a pink head.  Aroma is sour wild cherries.  Taste is intensely sour with good cherry flavor.  Almost like an intense sour candy.  Had fun with Paul seeing who could drink it without making a face.  I dont think either of us succeeded.

on tap (MHTG Club holiday party) 
Wow it looks like an odd colored blood entering my glass !   Wonderful aroma emminating from my glass.  What a treat this is to sample from a keg !   There is a slight pinkish head/lacing going on that looks beautiful.  Latic nose with a faint sour cherry/cherry pit(nuttiness).  The first taste is like a bombshell of flavor.  Sweet with brett and lactic acidicness that leads into a wonderful cherry undercurrent.  SImply wonderful !

2001 Bottle, shared with a couple other Toronado patrons, San Francisco.  So when the guy beside me offered to share his $35 bottle with me, I didnt complain.  When he bought a second, I managed to at least chip in some cash.  And I am glad I did.  This was dark blood ruby red in the glass, with an intense red head and wonderful lacing - looks amazing.  Nice mellow sour and cherry aroma.  Taste is incredibly balanced between sourness and cherry.  There is an earthy quality to it as well that is quite nice.  No hint of age at all.  Incredible.

2005 bottle. Dark red with an orange hue. Fine pink head. Very complex aroma; definitely vinous, aromas of cherries and lemons. Flavour starts with sour cherries, gradually revealing its more mellow ,yet lemony base lambic flavours with almond flavours  in the finish. Medium body, medium carbonation. A special occassions beer.

(750ml bottle, 2001 vintage)  Pours a cloudy ruby body with an average pinkish head that diminishes rather quickly.  Aroma of tart cherries with some earthiness.  Flavor of acidic cherry with a dry finish.

2002. Dark cherry red with a small pink head. Aroma of cherries and sour yeast. Very sour up front then mellows to sparkling cherry. Medium body almost like a cherry soda or carbonated juice. Excellent kriek.

UPDATED: NOV 5, 2009 2002 bottle. rated 10-6-05 scored a 3.6. Sharp aroma, acidic, sour, a little fruit.  Pours reddish pink.  Sharp sour taste, the fruit is there but you must look for it.  Excellent lambic!  


1999 bottle.  re-rated 11-5-09.  Tart raspberry and cherries on the nose, very acidic nose. Pours a cloudy reddish with a thin white head.  Very funky tartness upfront, a bitter sourness, sharp, with cherries and raspberries even sour strawberry flavors, smooth in the middle with more acidic sourness in the end.  Excellent excellent beer!!
Super sour aroma, almost stinky like sweaty gym equipment...but I tasted it anyway.  Some sour cherry syrup seemed to help cover the stalness in the nose.  But I dont see the appeal to this one.

2002 Draught at Moan and Dove on 8/19/2005 with Eyedrinkale and Dan Shelton.  Pours a vibrant, opaque, strawberry-pinkish red, with a bit of a ruddy-orange glow to it on the edges.  Head is thin and filmy and pinkish-cream colored, but well-retained and provides ample lacing.  Aroma is lemon juice, lemon rinds, oranges, very yogurty/lactobacillius notes, quite sour, with some sweet cherry pulp, a touch of very dry cask wood.  Thoroughly pungent and quite lovely.  Flavor begins with a woody dryness coupled with the signature lacto/pedio mix of Cantillon.  Eminently drinkable right off the bat, I waste no time in downing a glass and have to go for a second to finish my thoughts. . . and then a third later.  Anyways, the cherries were not as tart and were, perhaps, a bit too apparent for my liking.  Adding to my displeasure, somewhat, was a note of what I would best describe as "coconut liqueur".  I couldnt shake this taste from all three samples.  It had a syrupy, fruity, yet dryish/sour flavor to it that I havent found in any other Cantillon beer.  Could this be the syrup addition?  Maybe.  The flavor ends with plentiful cherry juice notes, more lemon and lacto notes and large dose of tartness lingering.  Mouthfeel was spot-on, as always, from this brewery.  Tiny bubbles, providing a wash of flavors over the palate and just tingly and perfect on the tongue.I dont really like that much fruit in my lambics, so Im not entirely surprised that I wasnt floored by this, but none the less, its damned good and fantastically drinkable.  Not to mention, Im sure I will enjoy an aged sample from the bottle significantly more.  That is, if I ever let myself open one.

On tap at the Moan and Dove in Amherst, MA.  My second lambic.  Hazy red pour with a thin pink film.  Sour cherry cough drop nose.  Sour cherry flavors, and incredibly dry.  Cotton mouth dry.  Pleasant rock candy sweetness to finish.

Tap at Moan and Dove.  8oz glass.  Sour, lactic, and tart aroma with a few cherry notes.  I also get barnyard-like haystacks.  Opaque dark blood-red color with a pink head.  Cute.  Slightly puckering to start with sour, funky, barnyard notes.  Turns a bit sweeter with some cherry flavors in the aftertaste.  Extremely dry finish.  The finish is tasty, though, and somewhat enjoyable after the harsh start.
Cherry red. Thin white head. Cherry nose with hints of sulphur. Clear cherry flavour, extremely dry. Almost agressive sourness in finish.

Bottled @RBESG05(vintage 2002)
Hazy deep cherry red. Sour, not very strong nose. Sour, dry cherry flavor. Long sour aftertaste. Flat, straightforward matured kriek.

2002 Bottle.Wow what a color.Looks like a watered down blood red color.Aromas of cherries and a slight citrus.Sour cherry taste.This is definately an aquired taste.I am not a big fan of these styles.For what it was it was good, not $26 a bottle good, but good.

Bottled. Amazing deep red colour. Loads of cherries in the aroma and in the flavour. This is one of those beers you dont want to drink beacuse of the fantastic aroma. Very soft and well balanced between sourness and sweetness. In June 2005 I tasted the first version of this. A "test brew" from 1986 of which only some 20 litres were bottled. Still after 19 years it was very red in colour and the aroma was extremely complex and full of fresh cherries. Very impressive.

UPDATED: JUL 8, 2005 Vintage 1999:  This smelled more like my armpit than it did of cherries.  It looks fine, red with a pink head, but the aroma is hard for my beginners nose.  The flavor is sour and cheesey with little "kriekness" coming through.  The finish left my mouth feeling as though Id been chewing on an old blanket.  I will have to try this again some day, but not soon.<font size=-4><a href=http://www.ratebeer.com/events-detail.asp?eve Fest at Delilahs, Chicago, IL 06/04/2005<font size=-1>

Bottle 2001, cork 2002, huge thanks to my Secret Santa for dropping this one on me!  My last beer before a trip to a beer wasteland.  Pours a deep red, bright pink, rapidly fading head.  Nice.  Aroma advised me up front that this one was bringing the funk, with a ton of horseblanket upfront.  Faint cherry on finish, definitely going to be sour.  Im psyched at this point.  Flavor was piercingly sour, followed by a rich, almost but not quite cheesy horseblanket.  Definitely a bit more hardcore funky than other, more sour yet refined Cantillons I have had.  The little beasts had quite the party in this bottle.  Only the faintest glimpse of sour cherry shows through on the finish, and I probably wouldnt have noticed if it wasnt for the fact that this is a kriek.  Any fruit sweetness was long, long gone.  Fantastic, aggressive lambic.

A fantastic change of pace! Spritzy, with a bright pink fizzy head. Pink. My buddy claimed this was more of a wine than a beer, but I think its somewhere in between. I wish lambics werent so expensive so I could have more to compare this to. Very pleased.

UPDATED: JUN 12, 2006 2001 750 ml bottle.  pours a beauteous red with a pink head.  tart cherry aroma, with a hint of wine and oak.  tons of carbonation which contributes to a rather big foamy head.  initially very tart but not overly dry or sour.  the finish is extremely dry however, reminds me of licking a freeze-dried cherry.  quite good, perhaps the best fruit lambic ive ever had!

2002 bottle. Cherryade appearance. Theres certainly some farmyard funk in the aroma but its relatively restrained. Quite woody. Very sharp flavour with as much lemon as cherry. Quite easy drinking for a Cantillon. Maybe Im just getting more accustomed to lambics, but I didnt find this as extreme as I expected. Still pretty good though. 750ml bottle at the London Joet gathering.

75cl bottle, sticker says 1999, it was then bottled in 2001 according to the cork.  The pour was amazing...cherry red with a big pink head.  marvelous.  I can still get some sour cherry in the nose...everything else is classic Cantillon, the wild yeast and acidity is there, some cherries still persist in the flavor and finish which is dry.  Much more rounded and less overbearingly acidic than the similiar aged Fou Foune I drank earlier in the week...It was fun spending about 2.5 hours with this beer.

On draft at Monks cafe. 2002 vintage. Pours a bright, horror movie blood red. Obvious cherries flavor, sour with some lemon in there as well. Very subtle nut flavor. Sourness is nicely balanced with a delicate sweet, sugary taste. Nicely dry finish.

mmmmm....How I love the lou pepes---- POursa rich cherry red hue with a nice pink head.  Aromas of horse blanket, sour funk, and a hint of cherries.  Flavors are very sour with the cherries melding in perfectly.

UPDATED: APR 7, 2009 ([email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */) Opaque blood red with a small, fading head. very delicious and full cherry aroma. Smooth and luscious cherry flavor with tartness only hitting in the end, and even then quite smoothly. Medium to full body, low carbonation. Certainly one of the best krieks ever made. (Bottled, 2002 vintage, 0.75l, was 7-4-7-3-13=3.4) Hazy, deep red color with a small, pink head. Very fruity, quite sour cherry aroma. Sour, quite dry cherry flavor - typical Cantillon. Refreshing, crisp summer drink. Not the "worst" Cantillon, but not drinkable in large quantities, either.

2001 vintage (bottled 2003).Deep deep red colour thats as thick as raspberry jam or eczematics beetroot homebrew. Pink head which sticks around pretty well for a Cantillon brew. Typical Cantillon lambic aroma which I find really hard to describe - wood, fish & cobwebs perhaps? Dense morello cherries, vanilla, coconut, whiskey and a nice cidery character.
